Son objectif et de maximiser es revenus  dan s la mesure ou son premier prêt lui a permis de réaliser des bénéfices   qu’il a utilisé pour éponger  les dettes qu’il avait contracté et constituer un fond de roulement.
texts.en: Monsieur Mbaye is 28 years old. He lives in Senegal. He works both as a builder and a poultry farmer. He has 6 years work experience in these activities. He has been a member of his local branch of U-IMCEC since June 2005. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs so that he can buy sheep for resale. His aim is to maximize his revenues since his first loan enabled him to generate profits that he used to pay off the debts he had accumulated and to set up a fund of working capital.

loans.use: to buy sheep for resale

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is 37 years old, married, and has four children who attend school.  She lives in the town of Aopo.  To make a living, Elisapeta runs a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling a variety of confections such as cookies and cakes in the local community.  Elisapeta has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 680 WST a month.

In 2011, Elisapeta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She is requesting her first loan for 1,000 WST, which she will use to purchase baking equipment. Elisapeta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with eight children. Marciana has a pig farm that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed for the pigs. Marciana has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marciana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 33  years old and single. She is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Roselyn owns and operates a food business, selling banana cue (caramelized, fried bananas) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,800 PHP a month. Roselyn joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.

Roselyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to purchase ingredients and supplies and invest in the expansion of her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve her business and buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora. Jhoanna es socia del banco comunal Corazones de Turi, vive en una comunidad perteneciente a la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, lugar que es conocido como el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que desde este lugar se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y carismáticas.

Doña Jhoanna tiene 24 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 1 año de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos del hogar.
 
Ella se dedica  a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría y vende cuyes.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para la construcción de un local para poner una tienda.

Sus sueños son construir su casa y realizar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Jhoanna is a member of the communal bank Corazones de Turi ( Hearts of Turi ), she lives in a community pertaining to the Turi parish in Cuenca, a place known as the viewpoint for the city of Cuenca since from this point you can observe a large part of the city; its people are merchants, they raise livestock, they farm, and are characterized as being very charismatic and nice.  Jhoanna is 24 years old, married, and has 2 children from the marriage, one who is 5 and another who is 1 year old.  Her daughter goes to a small school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  She doesn't own a home so she lives with her mother sharing the household expenses.  Jhoanna focuses on household duties and since she stays at home she also raises and sells guinea pigs.  
This is her 4th loan with the communal bank and her current loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials to be able to build and open a store.  
Her dreams are to build her own home and go to college.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Madoma Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children, two of whom are in school. The remaining one is still young. She has been selling fabrics (vitenge), sarongs (kanga), and mandazi (doughnuts) for four years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a small monthly profit.  

She requested a second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more business stock and covered household expenses, and she has paid back her loan successfully. She hopes for a loan, which she wants to use to increase her business stock to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, “Madoma", which totals 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her business stock.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 46 years old, married to Ann and blessed with 5 children. He is a dairy farmer and also grows cash crops for sell and the business has been profitable. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to buy dairy feeds for his dairy cows and seeds to plant in his farm and hopes this will enable him to  harvest more farm produce sell and make more income to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy dairy feeds for his dairy cows and seeds and hopes this will enable him to  harvest more farm produce for sell and make more income to educate his children.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 22 years old and has 2 small children. She and her mother run a restaurant that is very popular in their neighborhood. Maria has been in the restaurant since she was very young because her mother always ran similar businesses. Now they are business partners and are having great success. Maria is also a saleswoman who sells shoes, clothes and home products. She sells to many of the clients at her restaurant and she also travels into large markets in the city to make her sales. Maria has not had much luck with the father children. The father of the first left her shortly after finding about the pregnancy and the father of the second passed away two months after the child was born. Although Maria faces the difficult challenge of being a single mother, she is hardworking and optimistic.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in food for her restaurant and other products to sell

loans.name: Rooseweli

texts.en:
Mr. Fredy has 15 years of experience selling breakfasts. Before that, he used to live in the country, and his brother came up with the idea of moving to the city. He started out working for his brother, and little by little he saved his money. With those savings, he was able to buy a home site here in Isla Trinitaria. Along with his wife, he began selling breakfasts at a place near his home. He works from Monday through Friday from 4:30 AM until 10:00 AM. In the afternoon he also sells juice by the glass.

Fredy wants this loan in order to invest part of it in supplies for the breakfasts. The rest he will use to pave the floor of the part of his home where he prepares the breakfasts to sell. Right now, the unpaved floor is soaking up water and there are lots of mosquitoes due to the wetness.

Fredy is married. He is 36 years old and has 3 children who are all in school. His wife helps him prepare the breakfasts. He hopes with this investment that his business will create more income so that he can make his home adequate.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To invest in food supplies and improve his location.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: A beautiful woman who has no cause to regret that she belong to LAPO. She is 38-years-old and married with four (4) children. My numerous customers always give me satisfaction, says Mrs. Rebecca O.. She needs the above amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes  for sale

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina Baltasar de Quispe is married and has five children. She is a member of the seven-year-old local association Zaragoza and runs a restaurant in the Cosmos 79 neighborhood. There used to be a bus stop outside her restaurant which brought in many customers, but the bus stop has now moved, taking a lot of business with it, so Josefina joined Pro Mujer hoping to increase her capital and replace the lost income. At this time, she needs to borrow money to remodel and expand her restaurant.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Josefina Baltasar de Quispe, casada, madre de 5 hijos y perteneciente a las asociación comunal Zaragoza, con una antigüedad de 7 años, se dedica a la atención de un restaurante en la zona de Cosmos 79. Anteriormente, el lugar donde Josefina tiene su negocio, era una parada de transporte público, lo que le permitió tener una masiva clientela. A sus 35 años, ingresa a Pro Mujer, buscando la forma de inyectar capital a su negocio, que a raíz del traslado de la parada de transporte público, provocó un fuerte descenso en sus ventas y de forma inherente a sus ingresos. Actualmente, Josefina necesita remodelar su restaurante para poder cabida a la clientela que se da cita, remodelando y ampliando su negocio, y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida

loans.use: To expand and remodel a restaurant.

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Mrs. Thai O., 46, lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is employed as a laborer, while her husband works as a motor-taxi driver. Together they can generally earn around $5 profit each day. One of her children works in a rubber plantation collecting rubber sap from the trees and can typically earn about $2.40 each day, whilst the other three are students.

Mrs. Thai O. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband so he can use his own motorcycle to operate a business and thus generate more profit.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a business ( a motor-taxi)

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: I am happy to be a LAPO client says Mrs. Taiwo O., a married man with has 5 children, who lives in Lagos State She sells provision, drinks and recharge card of all networks and she has been in this business since 1994 .She is a member of LAPO union. She needs the loan of US$625 to buy more provision and recharge card for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provision and drink

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: Abdul B. is a father of five children and pays their education expenses from the profits from the business.  Because of small loans from SMT, Abdul still takes some of the business items from the merchants on credit, which does not provide him with good profits. For two years, SMT has been working with Abdul and found him to be honest and hard working.  Abdul is requesting another loan to expand his business and build his own capital.  He would also like to involve his wife in the daily management of the business. Abdul is 36 years old.

loans.use: Abdul would like to expand his business so that his wife can help contribute to the success of the business.

loans.name: Nyenga East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jesca T.. She is currently in the business of operating a retail shop and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of products. Jesca is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a primary school teacher. She has 2 children aged 22 and 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Jesca makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a commercial house. Jesca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more products and the loan was paid back on time.

Jesca is joined in her small group by Alice K., Agatha N., Luga N., and Allen N.. Alice K. has a hotel business and wants to buy more foodstuffs and furniture. Agatha N. is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Luga N. operates a poultry farm and wants to purchase more poultry feeds. Allen N. is currently operates a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy a hair steamer and dryer.

loans.use: To purchase more shop items

loans.name: Akuété

texts.fr:
Akuété D., age 27, is single and runs a bar. He has been in this business since 2005 and has his own bar, which is named JUDAS DOREE. His first loan of 300,000 francs CFA enabled him to buy a new freezer to replace the old one in order to improve product quality. During this heat wave, the demand for carbonated beverages and for cold water has increased. To rise up to the challenge, he must restock to meet customer expectations and to maintain continuously the entire range of drinks. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA to buy 38 cases of beer.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur D. Akuété célibataire âgé de 27 ans, tient un débit de boissons gazeuses. Il exerce cette activité depuis 2005 et dispose de sa propre boutique dénommée « JUDAS DOREE ». Son premier crédit d’un montant 300.000FCFA lui a permis d’acheter un nouveau congélateur pour remplacer l’ancien afin d’améliorer la qualité des produits. En cette période de forte chaleur la demande en boissons gazeuses et en eau fraîches a augmenté. Pour y faire face, il doit faire un ravitaillement pour satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et avoir en permanence toute la gamme de boissons. Pour cela, il sollicite un crédit de 200.000 FCFA pour acheter 38 casiers de bière.

loans.use: To sell fizzy drinks

loans.name: Ni Wayan Winarti

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Winarti is a homemaker who is assiduous in working. Winarti opens a convenient kiosk in front of her house, and sells basic food ingredients and everyday’s supplies. Winarti opens her kiosk from 9 am until 10 pm for her customers, who live in her neighborhood. Everyday, Winarti buys her inventory from a local market using a motorcycle. Winarti earns from $2.50 to $3.50 daily. From this income and her husband’s as a farmer, they can meet their family’s needs and pays for their child’s 7th grade school tuition. With her healthy and productive family situation, Winarti hopes that the loan she is requesting through DINARI can help expand her business.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Winarti adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga yang sangat tekun dalam bekerja. Winarti membuka warung di tempat tinggalnya yang menjual bahan makanan dan kebutuhan sehari-hari. Winarti mulai berjualan dari pukul 09.00 pagi hingga pukul 10.00 malam dimana para pelanggannya adalah warga di sekitar tempat tinggalnya. Setiap pagi Winarti membeli kebutuhan dan kelengkapan warungnya di pasar terdekat dengan menggunakan sepeda motor. Keuntungan yang diperoleh Winarti setiap hari sekitar Rp 25.000,- sampai Rp 35.000,-. Dari hasil jualannya dan dibantu oleh suaminya yang bekerja di sawah sebagai petani, Winarti mampu mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya dan sanggup menyekolahkan anaknya sampai kelas 1 SMP. Dengan keadaan keluarganya yang sehat dan masih produktif diharapkan pinjaman modal dari DINARI akan membantu mengembangkan usaha dari Winarti.

loans.use: To increase business capital

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario is a widow and has two grown children, ages 30 and 32. She started her business in order to make money as she did not have any other income apart from her sales and the money her children would give her from time to time. She began a few years ago and since then has sold shoes and bedspreads, but now is focused on selling shoes by catalog. The catalog sales are going very well because each month she has a large quantity or orders and people are always purchasing shoes from her.

She is requesting a loan of $475, to be repaid in one month, in order to buy merchandise and fill a pending order. With your help Mrs. Rosario will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Rosario es viuda y tiene dos hijos ya mayores de 30 y 32 años. Inició el negocio para poder sacar dinero ya que no tiene otros ingresos de dinero más que la que le da sus ventas y la de sus hijos que le dan dinero de vez en cuando. Comenzó hace años y desde entonces ha vendido calzado, colchas, ahora esta enfocada vendiendo calzado por catalogo, y le esta yendo muy bien porque cada mes tiene gran volumen de pedidos y la gente siempre le compra.

Solicita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 1 mes, para comprar mercancía y sacar un pedido que tiene pendiente, con tu apoyo la Sra. Rosario podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice D. sells clothing that she sews. She is married but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Eunice and her five children. Demand for her goods is high and she is looking to expand her business. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business sewing and selling clothes.

loans.name: Ha

texts.vi:
Mrs B. Thi Ha is 51 years old. Her husband is a retired military personnel. After retirement, she and her husband saved up a small amount of money and opened a shop selling spare engine parts and repairing engines. At the beginning of 2008, TYM fund opened in her area. She had discussed with her husband that they really should take out a loan to invest in the shop. Her husband is a talented mechanic so they have a lot of customers. In addition to repairing, they also buy old engines to repair and resell which is also a good source of income. She has 2 children who are grown and have stable jobs. Because of the military retirement pension, her family income is very stable. She is asking to borrow 300 USD to invest in spare parts. Their average income is 180 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Hà 51 tuổi, chồng chị là cán bộ về hưu sau khi nghỉ hưu vợ chồng chị tích lũy được một số vốn mở ốt bán phụ tùng máy và sửa chữa máy, đầu năm 2008 Quỹ triển khai trên địa bàn chị đã bàn bạc cùng chồng mạnh giạn tham gia Quỹ vay vốn, để có vốn đầu tư thêm vào cửa hàng. Chồng chị là người có tay nghề cao nên khách đến sửa chữa rất đông, ngoài sửa chữa ra khách hàng có nhu cầu bán máy cũ gia đình chị cũng mua và tu sửa lại rồi bán đấy cũng là nguồn lợi nhuận cao, chị sinh được 2 con hiện tại các con chị đã lớn và có công ăn việc làm ổn định, thuộc gia đình cán bộ về hưu nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 5.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng phụ tùng máy. Thu nhập bình quân. 3.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Sheila is the owner of a Mama Lishe or local café in Dar es Salaam. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business is a restaurant or café, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don't even appear in the Lonely Planet's budget guide, but if you're looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces. As a forty-year-old divorced mother of four (one of her children is still in school), profits from the café are essential to helping her family satisfy their daily needs. Sheila started her café in 2002 and has since been earning a monthly profit of 200 USD, which she uses towards school fees and food for the family. Sheila is requesting a loan of 275 USD to expand her café and help propel her business to increased profits and her family to an improved standard of living. The loan will be used to purchase cutlery, crockery, and more chairs for her customers. Sheila is a hard worker who can be found at her café for long hours every day of the week! Sheila would like to be successful enough to expand her café to other locations.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Tabu's Wapendanao Group

texts.en:
Tabu is 23 years old. She is married with 2 children, 3 and 5 years old. She has been a tailor and bites (snacks) seller since March 2008. Everyday she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Tabu now requests a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Raya, who also has a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. Marta Lidia, soltera, con 2 hijos de 11 y 6 años ambos estudian la educación primaria, el horario de trabajo que tiene es de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm de lunes a viernes, con 19 años de servicio, está solicitando su 4to. Crédito el que tiene destinado para empezar la construcción de su vivienda, construirá ocho metros cuadrados de arranques donde la Alcaldia de Juigalpa con el INVUR le construirá su vivienda ya que actualmente habita en una casa que paga el MINSA donde funciona FETSALUD, en la que no tiene condiciones, ni privacidad, pues sus hijos están creciendo y quiere darles un techo aunque sea módico, con la esperanza de ir mejorándolo posteriormente ya que siente que tiene las puertas abiertas en AFODENIC porque sus créditos los ha cancelado en tiempo y forma, es una persona muy responsable y con alto sentido de honradez y moral de pago.
texts.en:
Ms. Marta Lidia is single with two boys ages 11 and 6-years old. Both are studying in elementary school while she works from 8 AM to 4 PM Monday through Friday. With 19-years of service as a health worker, she requests a loan to start on the construction of her house. She would like to build an 8-square metered house in Alcaldia de Juigalpa with the INVUR (Institute of Urban and Rural Housing). Where Ms. Lidia currently resides she must pay MINSA (Ministry of Health) which operates FETASALUD (Federation of Health Workers) and the conditions there provide no privacy for her growing children. She would like to put a modest roof over their heads, with the hope that things will get better. She feels that doors have opened with AFODENIC and will pay her loan back in a timely manner as she is a very responsible person with a high sense of honor to do what is morally correct to pay her debt.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start construction on her house

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira was born in 1972. She lives in Lukavac, a small village in Bosnia. She is married and her husband is a coal miner. She has two sons, ages 13 and 16. Elvira raises chickens, and earns about 200KM/month (about $132 USD). Elvira is requesting a 1,200KM loan from Women for Women, International, which she will use to buy a computer for her sons. She hopes that the computer will help her sons in school and encourage them to pursue higher education.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng U. is a villager in Smao Lich Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to earn her living. Aside from this plantation, she and her husband, Mr. Sim Chea, are incense stick makers.

Since this business is going well, they want to sell door-to-door, so Mrs. Eng U. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to bU. a motorbike to transport her products door-to-door. Mrs. Eng U. is 25 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study because they are two and four years old. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a motorbike to transport her products

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en: N. Grace is the leader of the Kavule women’s group in Mukono. She is a widow with seven children; she also cares for 2 relatives who are orphans. For 2 years, Grace has had a business making liquid soap.  She sells the soap mostly to supermarkets, shops and clinics.  She has also made empombo (traditional chicken) for 3 years, which she sells to different clubs and restaurants. She needs a loan to boost her liquid soap business by buying more powder, as well as to help her in buying more chicken. She is grateful for the loans because they have helped her to support her numerous businesses.

loans.use: More soap powder and chicken for her businesses.

loans.name: Rukmani

texts.en:
Rukumani S. is the resident of Bholdhoka. Bholdhoka is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small business. There are five members, including herself, in her family. She has two daughters. Her older daughter is studying in grade 3 and younger daughter is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. S. along with her husband Mr. Sahadev S., started a grocery shop, nine years ago in their own house. They sell different types of grocery items in her shop like rice, maize, paddy, noodles and so on.  Now Mrs. S. is requesting a loan for Rs.25000.00 to buy a wider variety of grocery items for her business.She wants to use the increased income to provide better education for her daughters.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
Lailanie M. lives in Barangay Yeban Sur of Benito Soliven, Isabela. She is married to Ferdinand, who is a construction worker. They have two children: Micah Ruth, 9, a grade V student and Franshelle, who is just three months old. Lailanie said that though they are poor, they are still a happy family.

Lailanie wanted to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP6, 000, which will be utilized as additional capital for her store. She intends to use the money to buy stocks to avoid frequent visits to the market to save time and money. Her wish is to send her children to school and for them to finish college education in order to have a better future. Lailanie also hopes to overcome life's difficulties by simply striving to work hard in order to achieve her ambitions.

loans.use: buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Buena Fe 4 Group

texts.en:
Buena Fe group 4 is made up of 5 people looking to receive their very first loan. Each member is currently living in extreme poverty, and is not living with any of the luxuries that we often take for granted. Each member is hoping to take this first loan and get started on their very own small business. The ideas range from clothing stores to food markets. This loan will give an opportunity to 5 people who have not had many good opportunities in their life, and give them a chance to change their future.

Santa J. is the representative of this group and is extremely excited about this opportunity. Santa is the mother of two young children and realized she needed to do something when she couldn't afford school for both her children. Santa wants nothing more than a better life for her children, and she knows that getting them an education is the only way to do that. She wants to start a small business selling clothing in her area. She plans to buy the clothing from Santo Domingo where she can buy clothing cheap, and then sell it for a profit in her area. She is excited to have something of her own and believes that this is her chance to change her family's life!

Thank you for giving Santa a chance at changing her future!!

loans.use: Buy clothing for their business

loans.name: Omo

texts.en:
Omo sells hair extension and is also a stylist. She is 30 years old and married with four children.

She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past three years and lives in the Adeloko Lagos state.

Omo needs a loan of N80,000 to purchase more hair extensions, dryer and washing basing in order to satisfy the demand of her numerous customers. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase a dryer and washing basing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Eleuterio tiene 35 años de edad y esta domiciliado en la compañía de Calle Ybate de la Ciudad de Itá. Esta acompañado de la señora Bernardina de 30 años de edad, con quien tiene dos hijos, Daniel (12) que cursa actualmente el sexto  grado de la Educación Básica y Leticia, de 5 años que va al pre-escolar.

De profesión mecánico,  hace más de 12 años, donde día a día trabaja con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia ya que no le ha sido fácil mantener a sus hijos ya que proviene de una familia humilde y a vez ayuda a sus  padres.  Ha decidido confiar en la Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de herramientas como: una pulidora, taladro y una soldadora eléctrica, de manera a poder mejorar su trabajo y consecuentemente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Eleuterio is thirty-five years old and lives on Ybate Street in the city of Ita. He lives with thirty-year-old Mrs. Bernardina with whom he has two children: Daniel who is twelve years old and currently enrolled in sixth grade and Leticia who is five years old and enrolled in kindergarten. Eleuterio has been a mechanic for twelve years and worked consistently with the objective of improving his family's quality of life. It has not been easy to support his children given the fact that he comes from a humble background and continues to help his parents at the same time. He has decided to trust the Fundacion Paraguaya to help him with the purchase of several tools such as: a polisher, a drill, and an electric welding machine. He hopes that these tools will help him improve his work thereby improving his income as well.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a polisher, a drill, and an electric welding machine

loans.name: Yessenia De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Yessenia de los Ángeles R. tiene  26 años de edad, nació en Managua y habita en el barrio la Esperanza, es casada y su marido es auxiliar de limpieza en un supermercado de la capital, tienen tres hijos una  de 5,7, y niño de nueve meses, las metas para su familia es obtener una vivienda digna que le permita dar seguridad a su familia, ella tiene un año laborando en seguridad interna , y su meta personal es adquirir un buen empleo que le permita obtener mejores ingresos y sastifacer las necesidades cotidiana de su hogar y que le permita un margen de ahorro para asegurarle a sus hijos un  futuro mejor. Con esta solicitud de crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción y construir una pared externa de un cuarto y sala. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios adquirido.
texts.en:
Yessenia de los Ángeles R., 26, was born in Managua. She lives in the Esperanza neighborhood. She is married, and her husband is a cleaning assistant in a supermarket in the capital. They have three children ages five, seven, and nine months. The family goal is to get a decent house that will provide safety for the family. She has worked for a year in internal security. Her personal goal is to get a good job that will give better earnings, meet the daily household needs, and allow for a margin of savings to assure her children of a better future. This loan is to buy construction materials to build an external wall to a bedroom and living room. She gives thanks to the institution for the benefits she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build an inside wall to a room

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren J. lives with her husband and 20-year-old son in Arhangai Province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Their son goes to a local university. 

Davaasuren has a small retail business in clothing. She usually travels to Ereen, China, a border town from where many inexpensive Chinese products are exported, and purchases inexpensive yet attractive clothing for women and men.

She started her business in 2005 with a loan of 700,000 MNT (approximately $500). Within two years, she was able to buy a small car for her family with the business profit. Today, her business has expanded; business capital has exceeded 2,000,000 MNT. She says that she works hard on her business in order to make sure that her son receives a good education without any financial strains. 

She requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To buy more men's and women's apparel from Ereen, China

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia A. is a food vendor. Emilia prepares and sells kenkey. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. Emilia buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for four years.

Emilia is 29 years old, married and has one child, a son, who is currently in primary school. Her husband works with an environmental protection agency. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. She wants to expand her business and give her son a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer R. is from the village of Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Jenifer is married to Alaine R. and has two infant children. To make a living, Jenifer owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from the sale of different varieties of viand (tasty dishes) in the local community. Jenifer is just starting this business.

In July, Jenifer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenifer is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Jenifer from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Morgana

texts.en:
Morgana is 35 years old and lives in Cardona, in the Philippines. She is mother to four; two boys and two girls. She is married to Simeon who is tricycle driver.

She is tired of being poor. In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines to gain access to capital for her business. Her previous loans were carefully used in her current "general store" business. The business had helped them meet their daily needs.

Now she hopes for a loan of 15,000 pesos for her store. The loan will be used to pay for two sacks of rice, soft drinks, liquors, groceries and transportation expenses.

She is positive that her business will grow bigger since they have access to capital through ASHI and KIVA. She believes she can reach her dreams to send her children to school until college, and to expand her business into a much bigger store.

loans.use: Buy store supplies to sell.

loans.name: Mariedy

texts.en:
Mariedy R. is from the village of Upper Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old, single and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mariedy owns and operates a food stall, selling snacks and delicacies, such as banana cue and camote cue, in the local community. Mariedy has been engaged in her business for over 2 months, earning approximately 1,800 PHP per month.

In 2009, Mariedy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in the business. This will be Mariedy's first loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education and supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Investment in a food sales business

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan C., 36, and her husband, Mr. Khom Sor, 35, married in 1994 and have two sons, one of whom attends school. The family live along National Road Number Five, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Since they were married, Phan has been a nail make-up artist and her husband has worked as a fisherman. Phan is requesting her first loan of $600 USD in order to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza is a 34 year married with 7 children aged between 3 and 17 years.All her children go to school. Aziza resides and owns a three roomed house where she staying with six people. There is electricity and no piped water at home. Aziza takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 20 customers a day. Aziza owns a stall of snacks and charcoal and incurs transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly market dues, medication, feeding the family and increasing food prices. Aziza has been in this business for 6 years and with MCDT for eight years servicing her sixteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more charcoal and stock more vegetables and fruits. Aziza is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure and open up another stall .

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.en:
The agriculture business is one that requires much effort, for the simple reason that it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. Abdukayum, has dedicated himself for already twelve years to cattle raising, which supports his humble family which so relies on him.

Currently, Abdukayum has turned to IMON International for a loan of 1000 USD to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his dearest children and wife who he loves greatly.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: La Unión Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: La unión hace la fuerza está conformado por Mayra Jerónima P.
texts.en: The Group “La Unión Hace La Fuerza” (Unity is Strength) consists of Mayra Jerónima P.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en: Rashidatu sells planks retail to earn a living. She is friendly and a hard-working woman. She is determined to excel in her business and family life. She is 27 years old, married with three children. Her husband sells motor vehicle spare parts to support the family. She hopes for the loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy wants to improve her family's living conditions and is doing her best to achieve it. Daisy is 30 years old and married, but she does not have a child.  Daisy has been managing a sari-sari (community-based variety store) in her village for four years. She also started a junk shop business. She is glad her businesses are doing well.  

Daisy’s husband source of income is farming. She wants to expand her small businesses, so she wants to borrow PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. This loan will help her to purchase basic commodities for her store and to maintain her junk shop business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her store and junk shop business

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Mrs. Un C., 26, is a low-income person living in Kompong Chhnang province, where she and her husband earn their income by growing rice. Un C. learned the skill of planting rice from her grandmother and used her knowledge to earn money for years. Day to day, Un C. is very busy at her farm and never wastes time. She is a good mother who tries to generate cash to be sure that both of her school-aged kids attain the highest levels of education. This is rice harvest season, and in order earn extra income, Un C. requested a loan which will allow her to order mature rice in bulk from other farmers. She will then sell it when the rice commands a high price.

Un C. was busy when the photo taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To order mature rice in bulk from other farmers

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 27 años, es una mujer trabajadora que comparte la vida con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 6 y 5 añitos de edad.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, actividad que la mantiene ocupada gran parte del día, siendo un trabajo muy cansado. Luz sale todos los días a las casas de sus vecinas y amigas ofreciendo las novedades que adquiere, además es muy querida en su barrio, ya que además de vender siempre da buenos consejos sobre los colores y modelos que mejor les quedan a sus clientes. 
Felizmente las ventas son buenas, lo cual beneficia a su familia, es por ello que está pensando en mejorar su negocio para que en el futuro pueda tener una tienda donde ofrecer con mayor comodidad sus prendas.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para estas fiestas navideñas, en las que espera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Luz, 27, is a hard-working woman, who shares her life with her husband and two children, who are 6 and 5 years old, respectively. For the last 3 years she has sold clothing and footwear, an activity that keeps her busy most of the day, and a very tiring line of work. Luz makes her daily rounds to homes of her friends and relatives offering her wares. She is very well-liked in her neighborhood because, besides selling, she always offers good advice regarding the colors and styles that best suit her customers.. Happily, her sales are good, which is of great benefit for her family. She is, therefore, wanting to improve her business so that in the future she can have a store from which to offer her goods with greater comfort. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she has always been very punctual with her repayment. The funding requested now will be used to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to have sufficient stock available for the Christmas season, which is when she expects her sales to increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Jovanny Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Jovanny Janeth F.  es otra socia activa Banco Comunal Jardín del Artesano en el cantón  Montecristi,   aquí la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la elaboración de  artesanías que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.

Nuestra socia   es de profesión profesora    en un colegio de Manta, está casada  y tiene cuatro hijos, a sus 61 años se da tiempo para dar clases y dedicarse a su negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.

Con el préstamo solicitado a la Fundación va a comprar principalmente pantalones, camisas, blusas,  pijamas para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Sra. Jovanny Janeth F. is an active member of the Artisan’s Garden Communal Bank in the region of Montecristi. Most of the residents in the area make handicrafts that are sold to both domestic and foreign tourists.

Sra. Jovanny is a high school teacher in Manta. She is married and has four children. At 61 years of age, she devotes her time to teaching classes and operating her retail business selling clothes for women, men, and children.

With this loan she is requesting from the Foundation, Jovanny will buy trousers, jackets, blouses, and pajamas for women, men, and children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase trousers, jackets, blouses, and pajamas

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 55 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene 4 hijos, pero sólo vive con su última hija, Anamela de 30 años, su yerno y su pequeña nieta.

Desde hace un par de meses de dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto que está ubicado estratégicamente al lado de un mercado. Es así que los deliciosos platillos que prepara tienen mucha acogida entre sus asiduos comensales que buscan precios bajo y buena comida. Marcelina atiende desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde y le gusta realizar esta actividad porque le da buenas ganancias económicas que le alcanzan para los gastos de su casa.
Adicionalmente, se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de golosinas y cigarrillos, según dice este negocio también es muy rentable, ya que vende desde que cierra su puesto de comida hasta altas horas de la noche.
Como es una mujer emprendedora, tiene pensado para el futuro mejorar su puesto de venta de comidas y convertirlo en un “chifa” (restaurante de comida china), con la ayuda de su yerno que sabe preparar este tipo de comida.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete, una vez más, a ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas. El dinero que solicita lo usará en la compra de comestibles y bebidas para su negocio de venta de comida, así como más golosinas, ya que tiene muchos planes para el futuro y espera hacerlos realidad incrementando sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 55 years old, is a hardworking woman that has four children. She only lives with her youngest daughter, Anamela, 30 years old, her son-in-law and her small granddaughter. In the last few months Marcelina has been selling food in a stall strategically located next to a market. Here the discerning diners that look for low prices and good food welcome the delicious dishes that she prepares. Marcelina works from 10 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. She likes to do this work because it provides a good income that helps with the household expenses. Additionally, she is a roving salesperson. She sells candies and cigarettes. According to what she says, this business is also very lucrative. She sells from the time she closes her food stall until the late hours of the night. Since she is a businesswoman thinking of the future, she would like to improve her food stall. She would like to change it into a “chifa” (a restaurant that sells Chinese food). She would have the help of her son-in-law, who knows how to make Chinese food. This is Marcelina’s sixth loan with MFP and she promises, one more time, to be punctual with each one of her payments. With the money that she is requesting she will buy groceries and drinks for her food selling business. Also she will buy more candy. She has great plans for the future and hopes to make them a reality by increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor francisco Javier Labora para Alcaldia de Managua , es de oficio mecánico pero el se desempeña como operario de limpieza,
Es padre de familia de sod hijos los cuales están en edad escolar , por lo que su crédito lo utilizara en compra< de útiles escolares para sus dos hijos .
El lleva dos años de trabajar con CEPRODEL  dos créditos en termino de dos años loc cuales los ha utilizado en momentos de emergencia y los ha sabido utilizar ya para el el desarrollo de familia es lo mas importante los montos han sido de acuerdo a la capacidad de pago ya que su salario es de 200 dólares poco para la situación económica del país.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier works for the municipality of Managua. He is a mechanic by trade, but he is working as a cleaner. He is the father of two children who are of school age. The funds from this loan will be used to buy school supplies for both of his children. Francisco has worked with CEPRODEL for two years, receiving two loans during that time. He has used those funds during times of emergency, and he has been able to use them effectively for his family's development, which is most important. The amounts have been in accordance with his capacity to pay, since his salary is 200 dollars, which is low for the country's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing school supplies and paying school fees

loans.name: Otilio

texts.es:
En el municipio de somotillo, comarca nombre de Jesús, el señor Otilio C. se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino y porcino para la mantención de sus dos hijas y su esposa también se dedica al establecimiento de cultivos anuales dentro de los cuales figuran el maíz, frijoles y sorgo, el señor Otilio C.  ha dedicado la mayor parte  de su vida a estas actividades las que le ha brindado el bienestar familiar y su progreso, el realiza sus actividades de 6 a 3 de la tarde todos los días de la semana.
El crédito será empleado para la compra de una vaca parida con la cual pretende mejorar aun más su situación económica.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Nombre de Jesús (Name of Jesus) district, Mr. Otilio raises cattle and hogs to maintain his 2 daughters and his wife. He also plants crops each year, including corn, beans, and sorghum. Otilio has spent the better part of his life engaged in these activities, which have provided for the wellbeing of his family and for his progress. He works from 6:00 in the morning until 3:00 in the afternoon every day of the week. The loan will be used to buy a cow that recently delivered a calf. He hopes this will improve his economic situation even more.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A COW THAT GAVE BIRTH TO A NEW CALF

loans.name: Hulley

texts.es:
La Sra. Hulley, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Barbará II”  del Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín ,  tiene 25 años , es Casada y madre de 01 que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando.

Hulley, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de carteras y zapatos, ya que habiendo estudiado cursos de manualidades, no dudo en ejercer ese conocimiento e implementar su propio negocio, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad. Se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y carisma, que siempre la ha caracterizado. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, materiales para la elaboración de carteras, zapatos de diferentes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará materiales como: Plantas de zapatos , cueros y viocueros ,  lentejuelas , diseños , etc. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra  de un andamio, donde pueda exhibir sus productos, a sus clientes.
  
Hulley, esta contenta y realizada por cumplir sus sueños y metas, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
La Sra. Hulley, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Barbará II” del Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín , tiene 25 años , es Casada y madre de 01 que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando. Hulley, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron muy buenos resultados y hoy en día, se dedica a la venta de carteras y zapatos, ya que habiendo estudiado cursos de manualidades, no dudo en ejercer ese conocimiento e implementar su propio negocio, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en esta actividad. Se encuentra ubicada en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes, con la amabilidad y carisma, que siempre la ha caracterizado. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, materiales para la elaboración de carteras, zapatos de diferentes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará materiales como: Plantas de zapatos , cueros y viocueros , lentejuelas , diseños , etc. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de un andamio, donde pueda exhibir sus productos, a sus clientes. Hulley, esta contenta y realizada por cumplir sus sueños y metas, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprarà materiales para la elaboración de sus carteras y zapatos.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: Née en 1967 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, D. Pauline est mariée à DEFLY Jules et est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pauline n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Pauline vend du charbon de bois à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Pauline achète ses produits. Pauline est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu trois crédits antérieurement, et qui ont été bien remboursés. Malgré la passion qu’elle a pour son activité, Pauline ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de la rehausser davantage et de faire face à la nombreuse demande de sa clientèle. C’est au vue de cela que Pauline sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Pauline D. was born in 1967 in Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital. She is married to Jules Defly, and is the mother of four children who all attend school. The family lives in the Kpondéhou district of Cotonou. Pauline and her husband cover the family’s expenses together. Pauline never went to school. To meet her own needs and those of her children, she sells charcoal out of her home. She buys her stock at Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She is an old client of ALIDé, having previously received three loans, all of which were paid back. Although she is passionate about her business, Pauline doesn’t have the financial resources enabling her to build it up further and meet the high demand of her clients. With this in mind, she is asking for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Chelsea Rosendale, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bags of charcoal

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Manuela del Socorro M. se dedica a la venta de comida en el sector del mercado el Bisne desde hace más de ocho años es acompañada y tiene dos hijos ambos en edad escolar y su esposo se dedica a realizar trabajos de electricidad por cuenta propia.

Doña Manuela M. lleva ya seis años de trabajar con CEPRODEL y le ha ayudado a superarse económicamente por que con el financiamiento logra comprar granos básicos y carnes para no estar comprando a  diario y así le sale más barato y obtiene mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
La señora Manuela del Socorro M. se dedica a la venta de comida en el sector del mercado el Bisne desde hace más de ocho años es acompañada y tiene dos hijos ambos en edad escolar y su esposo se dedica a realizar trabajos de electricidad por cuenta propia. Doña Manuela M. lleva ya seis años de trabajar con CEPRODEL y le ha ayudado a superarse económicamente por que con el financiamiento logra comprar granos básicos y carnes para no estar comprando a diario y así le sale más barato y obtiene mejores ganancias.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para compra de granos básicos.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Isabel tiene 44 años D. edad está casado con el señor Carlos E. tiene dos hijos D. 12 años y 16 años D. edad viven en Esquilan es una comunidad D. la provincia D. Colcapirhua D. Cochabamba, ella es productora D. leche y Carlos trabaja en perforación D. pozos.

Isabel tuvo varios problemas en diciembre del año 2009, porque su esposo sufrió un accidente muy grave en una perforación D. pozo el cual la empresa para la cual realizaba el trabajo no pago nada ella tuvo que vender sus vacas para poder ayudar y pagar la operación D. su esposo como también la escuela D. sus hijos los padres D. Carlos no quisieron ayudarla ella sola pago y él se quedo si trabajo y no podía caminar y este año en el mes D. febrero le realizaron una nueva operación D. la columna la cual salió muy bien porque él empezó a caminar y empezara con sus fisioterapias para poder trabajar y ayudar a su esposa y a sus hijos, Isabel es una mujer que nunca lo dejo solo a Carlos en esos momentos en los que él estaba muy mal ella no perdió la fe ni la esperanza D. que Carlos salga adelante y luche por estar bien.

Isabel piD. el crédito para poder comprar una nueva cabeza D. ganado y poder entregar más leche y realizar quesillo para poderlo vender en el mercado D. Quillacollo D. esa manera poder obtener más ingresos hasta que su esposo este totalmente recuperado y puedan trabajar juntos para que sus hijos puedan realizar una carrera y darles un futuro mejor y sobre todo enseñarles a valorar la vida y seguir apoyando a su papá para que pueda recuperarse trabajar junto a él son una familia que son muy unidos y que tienen sueños para poderlos realizar en un futuro, como el hijo menor quiere hacer estudiar la carrera D. medicina para poder ayudar a niños que por su zona son familias muy pobres y también ayudar a personas que necesitan, como su padre lo necesito cuando tuvo el accidente.
texts.en:
Isabel is 44 years old and married to Carlos E.. She has two children, ages 12 and 16. They live in Esquilan, which is a community in the Colcapirhua province of Cochabamba. Isabel works in dairy production, and Carlos works in drilling. Isabel had various problems in December of 2009; that is when her husband suffered a serious drilling accident that maD. them realize that the company and the job paid poorly. She had to sell her cows in order to help pay for her husband's operations as well as for her children's schooling. Carlos' parents did not want to help; she paid everything herself. Carlos was left without a job -he couldn't walk- and this year in February, he went through another operation for his spine, which went well because he has begun to walk and has started physical therapy in order to be able to work and help his wife and kids. Isabel is a woman who never left Carlos' siD.. In those moments when he was in bad shape, she never lost her faith or hope that Carlos would succeed and fight to become well. Isabel is asking for this loan to be able to buy a new head of cattle and so she can to produce more milk and make farm cheese to sell at the Quillacollo market. With this help she can earn more income until her husband is totally recovered and that they can work together so that their children can have careers and a better future and, above all, to teach them the value of life and to continue supporting their father so that he can return to work. Together they are a very united family, and they have dreams they hope to achieve in the future, such as the youngest son who wants to study medicine in order to help children of poor families in their neighborhood and to also help people who need it, like his father needed help after his accident.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Né vers 1963 à Tiby, préfecture de San, Abdoulaye Yaré n’as pas eu la chance de faire de brillantes études, alors il embrassa tôt les activités génératrices de revenus. Il est mari d’une épouse et  père de 12 enfants. Il vit chez lui même dans le quartier Dabani de la préfecture de San (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).  
Abdoulaye opta pour l’achat vente de téléviseurs et accessoires  qu’il a appris  auprès de son grand frère il y a plus de 20 ans.  
Actuellement il exerce pour lui même au grand marché  de San depuis 10 ans.  Il est très sollicité surtout les jours  des foires hebdomadaires de San  ville et environnants.  
Afin de diversifier son activité, il décida de faire recours à l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans.  Il est à son 3ème prêt  individuel, après avoir correctement remboursé les deux précédents. 
Monsieur Abdoulaye  compte acheter, différentes sortes de  télévisions, de DVD et VCD(écran 14, 21 et 26) avec ce prêt. 
Il s’approvisionnait  auprès des commerçants grossistes de San, mais avec l’augmentation du fonds de commerce, il compte aller juste qu’a Lomé ( capitale de Togo).  Il  vend  dans sa boutique au grand marché de San et dans les foires hebdomadaires à une clientèle constituée  de femmes et d’hommes à crédit ou au comptant. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 175.000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour rembourser l’échéance du prêt, payer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants, acheter la nourriture et investir le reste dans d’autres activités de revenus .
texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Tiby, in the San Prefecture, Abdoulaye Yaré did not have the opportunity to excel in school, so he embraced revenue-generating activities at an early age. He is married and the father of 12 children. He lives at home in the Dabani borough of the San Prefecture (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Over 20 years ago, he opted for the commerce of televisions and related accessories, a business he learned from his older brother. For the past ten years he has been running his own business at the main market in San. He is in high demand, particularly during the weekly market fairs in San and surrounding areas. To diversify his activities, he decided two years ago to call upon the Soro Yiriwaso MFI. He is requesting a third individual loan, having fully reimbursed the two preceding ones. Mr. Abdoulaye will use this loan to buy different televisions, DVD and VCD players (with 14, 21, and 26-inch screens). He used to get his supplies from wholesalers in San, but as he increased his working capital, he now would like to go as far as Lomé (the capital of Togo). He sells in his shop at San’s main market and in weekly market fairs, to a customer base of both men and women, for cash or credit. He is hoping to attain monthly earnings of 175,000 FCFA he will use to reimburse the loan, pay his children’s tuition fees, buy food, and reinvest the remainder in other revenue-generating activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy electronic appliances

loans.name: Sashi

texts.en:
Mrs. Sashi A. is a farmer in the village of Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur.

Sashi owns a piece of land where she grows green vegetables; mostly she prefers to grow seasonal vegetables. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily and spends her income on household expenses.

Now Sashi is requesting an Rs 20,000 loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable farming.

loans.use: To buys seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Filipense Group

texts.es:
El grupo Filipense está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ellas es Karla Patricia R. R. quien vende tortillas y nacatamales. Ella aprendió este negocio con una tía  a la cual le ayudaba. 
R. tiene tres niños de 6, 13 y 14 años los cuales le ayudan en el negocio. Ella invertirá el crédito en materia prima como maíz y en los ingredientes para los nacatamales.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Damaris del Carmen Joaquín M. vende helados, fresco, ropa y chinelas, además cose y Reyna Isabel Acantara comercializa fresco, helado y repochetas.
texts.en:
The Filipense Group consists of three hardworking and determined women. One of them is Karla Patricia R. R. who sells tortillas and nacatamales. She learned this business from an aunt who helps her. Karla has three children (ages 14, 13, and 6) who also help with the business. She will invest her loan in supplies such as corn and other ingredients used in making nacatamales.

Her fellow group members include Damaris del Carmen Joaquín M. who sews and also sells ice cream, soft drinks, clothing, and slippers. Reyna Isabel A. sells soft drinks, ice cream, and “repochetas” (Nicaraguan appetizers similar to quesadillas).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn & other ingredients

loans.name: Rutilio

texts.es:
El sr. Rutilio S. V. tiene 58 años de edad, es padre soltero y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad. Reside en la Colonia El Recreo ubicada en Juticalpa. Es miembro del Grupo Solidario Nazareth. Desde 1974 se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano.  Comenzo comprando a Sor. Maria y decidio vender porque no tenia otro ingreso.  Ahorra compra los fardos en Coincal y el y su Mama atienden el negocio.  Su Mama maneja los precios y el sale los Sabados y Domingos para vender. 

Con el prestamo de 20,000 Lempiras se construira una pila de abastecimiento de agua y hara una fundacion de concreto en el lugar donde esta ubicado el parqueo de su casa.  Con las mejoras cambiara el ambiente y valor de la propiedad.  

Actualmente su Mama ha estado enferma y ha tenido que pagar gastos medicos y manejar el negocio solo.  Su sueno es superarse y duplicar las ventas y que su casa se vea mejor.
texts.en:
Rutilio S. V. is 58 years old. He is a single father with two children, aged 11 and 7. He lives in the residential development El Recreo in Juticalpa. He is a member of the Nazareth Solidarity Group. Since 1974, Rutilio has sold second-hand clothing. He began buying clothes for Sister Maria and decided to begin selling them because he had no other means of income. Now he buys bundles of clothes en Coincal to sell. He and his mother manage the business. His mother is in charge of the pricing, and he leaves Saturdays and Sundays to sell clothing. With a loan of 20,000 lempiras, he will build a basin for water supply and lay a concrete driveway outside his home. The improvements will change the feeling of the house and increase the property value. Rutilio's mother has been sick lately, and Rutilio has had to pay her medical costs and manage the business by himself. His goals are to better himself, double his house, and improve the look of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials for water basin

loans.name: Oah

texts.en:
Oah N., 42, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for it's rubber plantation. N. is a housewife while her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

N. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to produce rice wine to sell. In the future, she would like to use aN. additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to produce more rice wine to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose J. is currently in the business of selling bread and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock fresh fish to fry and sell.

Rose is 42 years old and is married to a carpenter. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita V. is a married woman who lives in Suyac, Brgy. Taba-ao, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing and selling fish.  Her husband Deonesio V., who is 54 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living.  They have 7 children who are 17 to  34 years old. Carmencita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmencita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use purchase more fishing nets and repair her existing nets so that she could continue to save up for future and also repair and improve their fishing boat. Carmencita V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase more fishing nets and repair old ones

loans.name: Braulio Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Braulio lo conforma Norma del Socorro Dávila M. de 38 años, Martha Lorena López García y María Evalia Martínez C.; la primera es coordinadora del grupo y su labor es la compra/venta de cosechas, principalmente de frutas, actividad la cual realiza desde hace 4 años; dado que su esposo es agricultor ocasionalmente son las cosechas de él las que vende lo cual le deja mayores márgenes de ganancia.

Martha vende verduras en el mercado y María Evelia tiene una pulpería la cual surgió hace cuatro años y poco a poco ha venido creciendo. El sueño de estas mujeres es seguir prosperando con sus actividades y poder hacer mejoras en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The “Braulio” communal bank’s members are: Norma del Socorro Dávila M., 38, Martha Lorena López García and María Evalia Martínez C.. Norma is the group Coordinator and she buys and sells crops, mostly fruits; she’s been in this line of work for 4 years since her husband’s a farmer. Sometimes it’s his crops that she sells which means higher profit margins. Martha sells vegetables in the market and María Evelia has a grocery store that she started four years ago and has been growing gradually ever since. The dream of these women is to continue prospering with their activities and to be able to make some improvements to their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crops.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a 44 years old married man from Bint Jbeil and father of 4 children. Hassan has worked  in car repairs for 20 years. His major business is  changing car lubricants and repairing the cars air conditionners. Hassan is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to increase the business capital. His clients like his work a lot. He hopes to expand his business to let his children benefit from it.

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Trabajando Para El Futuro Group

texts.es: La señora Ela tiene 50 años y vive en la zona G D. huaycan, es separada y tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales aun tiene a uno a su cargo y es la presidenta del grupo "Trabajando para el Futuro" el cual se conforma D. 7 vecinas y amigas unidas por sus ganas D. mejorar. El grupo lleva un año trabajando con Edaprospo y esperan llegar a sus metas gracias a su apoyo. La señora Ela ha vendido pollo, cerveza, gaseosas y bebidas en general por 20 años y lo sigue haciendo para ayudar asu hija Fabiola ensus estudios D. colegio particular. Pienza poner su propia polleria ahorrando el dinero q le envia su esposo desD. la selva, su trabajo y el capital que espera por parte D. Edaprospo que le ayudara a conseguir sus metas aunque para esto necesite mas habilitaciones.
texts.en:
Ela is 50-years-old and lives in Zone G of Huaycan. She's separated and has 7 children, one of whom still lives with her. She's the president of the group "Trabajando para el Futuro" ("Working for the Future"), which consists of 7 neighbors and friends united by their desire to improve their lives. The group has been working with EDAPROSPO for a year and they hope to reach their goals thanks to its support. 

Ela has sold chicken, beer, sodas, and other drinks for 20 years and she continues to do so in order to help her daughter Fabiola in her studies at a private school. She hopes to open her own poultry store with the money she's saving that her husband sends from the jungle. She hopes that her job and the working capital from EDAPROSPO will help her achieve her goals, even though she'll probably still need a little more assistance.

loans.use: Purchase of products and consumables

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie B. is a 34-year-old woman from the village of Linconmonan, Gingoog City in the Philippines. Rosalie is married and has two school-age children. To earn a living, Rosalie owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. She explains that her primary source of income is derived from buying and selling coconuts in her local community. She also makes and sells charcoal. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. As a result, she is able to better engage in business activities and to improve her standard of living. Notably, Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. The prior loan was used to purchase additional coconuts to buy and then sell. Rosalie is now requesting a new loan, this time in the amount of 8,000 PHP ($200), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital purposes. She plans to use the additional revenue generated on account of the requested loan to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To improve and expand her business by purchasing additional inventory

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena S. has been an active member of ASHI Antique South Branch since 2002. She is a resident of San Pedro, San Jose Antique, Philippines. She is married to Ruby S. who is a driver and they are blessed with four children.
