They are Julier who is 36 years old, Glen who is 34 years old, Zaldy who is 31 years old and Charlene who is 29 years old. Through their hardship, industry and the support of ASHI, two of their children have  finished college.

Her loans in ASHI really help them a lot because the income that they get from her business is used for their daily expenditures.

Azucena has been a member of ASHI for eight years already and, because of her good attitude, she had been elected as center chief of San Pedro Center 10 of ASHI ASB at present. As a member, she maintains her good performance, which is why she got a bigger loan. 

She aspires to have a loan from ASHI, through the partnership of KIVA, for PHP 24,000 to use as additional capital for their hog fattening and tricycle businesses.

If this request is granted, it will be a great help for them to sustain the needs of the family and to help their relatives and neighbors.

Their greatest dream is to build a decent and comfortable house with their income and to improve their business so that they will be financially stable.

loans.use: As additional capital for their tricycle and hog fattening businesses

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo K., 30, lives in the Takeo province and works in a garment factory.  She is married and has two young children living at home to support.  Living in Takeo province, she is able to make about US$ 3 per day, while her husband works in construction, typically making US$ 4 every day.  

Keo K. aims to take out a loan of US$ 1000 for her husband to make a new investment. Since the construction work is not permanent, she wants her husband to have an extra business selling meat balls in front of the garment factory.

loans.use: To start a additional business selling meat balls.

loans.name: Minerva Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Minerva es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras, del Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo menor, su  esposo se desempeña como comerciante, lleva como socia de Manuela Ramos solo 1 año.
Minerva ayuda a su esposo con la bodega que tiene instalada en su casa, gracias a ello no descuida a su niño que todavía necesita de sus cuidados.
Con el poco tiempo que tiene en Manuela Ramos ha podido invetir todo su dinero en su bodega.
Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200.00 soles comprará 2 sacos de azúcar, una bolsa de harina, una caja de leche, 1 caja de aceite, una bolsa de caramelos, 2 paquetes de papel higiénico, 15 kilos de frejol, 10 kilos de fariña, 5 kilos de pescado seco, verduras y condimentos.
La señora Minerva quiere tener un negocio más grande y espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Minerva is a member of the communal bank "Las Almendras" in the Ucayali department.  She is 22 years old, married, and has a young child.  Her husband works as a merchant.  She has been a member of this group for only 1 year.

Minerva helps her husband with a store that is set up in their home.  Thanks to this business she is able to care for her child, who still needs close attention.  Over the short time she has been with the Manuela Ramos organization she has invested her loans in her store.

With this loan of 1,200 Peruvian soles she will buy: 2 sacks of sugar, a bag of flour, a crate of milk, a crate of cooking oil, a bag of caramels, 2 packages of toilet paper, 15 kilos of beans, 10 kilos of potato flour, 5 kilos of dried fish, vegetables and seasonings.  

Minerva wants to have a bigger business, and she hopes to continue to have the support of the Manuela Ramos organization.

loans.use: she will buy 2 sacks of sugar, a bag of flour, a crate of milk, a crate of cooking oil, a bag of caramels, 2 packages of toilet paper, 15 kilos of beans, 10 kilos of potato flour, 5 kilos of dried fish, vegetables and seasonings

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina E. is from the village of Minaog. She is 51 years old, married, and has 5 adult children. Josefina operates a family member's business in the food sector, making & selling peanut butter in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2005, Josefina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials needed for her peanut butter business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Josefina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for peanut butter business

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiru

texts.en:
Eunice has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last nine years.  She is 36 years old, married to Peter Njenga and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers.  This will be her second loan.  She cleared her previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

In future, Eunice hopes to use technology to increase her farm outputs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn R. is from the village of Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She is 36 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marlyn owns & operates a business selling bananas. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Marlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients to make a product. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Marlyn from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for banana vending

loans.name: Cheam's Group

texts.en:
In this group loan there are four members, located in Preaek Hour Lech village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Cheam N. is the group leader. She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She stays at home, while her husband, Mr. Chham Vuthy, earns their living as a motorbike taxi driver and earns a small income to support his family. This couple has three children. Two are security guards, and the other is a seamstress in a garment factory. 

Now her husband's motorbike is broken, so she would like to ask for a loan to support its repair.

loans.use: To support her husband’s motorbike repair

loans.name: Marie Claudette

texts.en:
Marie Claudette is 32 years old and she has 4 children who are between the ages of 4 to 13. All her children are in school, while her husband is an electrician.

Marie Claudette sells beef and she has done this business for 10 years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more cattle for beef. She hopes to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle for beef.

loans.name: Sofía Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Sofía del Carmen J. R. ella es trabajadora activa de la Empresa “MINED” desempeñándose como Docente de educación primaria tiene veinte y un  años  de trabajar como docente  es Casada  actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Sofía del Carmen J. R. is an active hardworker at a business called “MINED”. She works as a primary school teacher, and has done so for twenty one years. She is married and has two school aged children. She has had five loans with CEPRODEL and has taken out each one to buy construction materials such as: sand, cement, stone, gravel, blocks, etc. This has been to enlarge and improve her home. The loans from Ceprodel have really benefitted her, since with them she has been able to improve her and her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: sand, cement, stone, gravel, etc. .

loans.name: Nyakitokoli Basubuzi Group

texts.en: Sedrack is a 30-year-old married man with four children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For six years, he has been operating a drug shop and with the proceeds he was able to buy land. He has challenges of limited drugs due to limited finances and his desire is to own a pharmacy. Sedrack needs the loan to buy drugs.

loans.use: To buy drugs.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Нозимова Насиба проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 32 года. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Муж находится в России. Сама Насиба предоставляет услугу. Она более 10 лет занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается у себя дома. Кредит берет для покупки цветных ниток и тканей.
texts.en: Nasiba N. lives in the town of Tursun-zoda. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works in Russia. Nasiba provides a service, she has been sewing national Tajik dresses for more than ten years. She does this business from home. She is taking out the loan to buy color threads and fabrics.

loans.use: to buy color threads and fabrics

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Patricia esta agradecida por su cooperación en los dos anteriores créditos los cuales ha realizado mejoras a su vivienda. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para terminar los acabados del interior del cuarto que esta haciendo para su hijo, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y la mano de obra. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como jefa de aria comercial de una compañía.
texts.en:
Ana Patricia is grateful for your cooperation in her two previous loans which she used to make improvements to her home.  She is requesting this loan to finish off some work to the interior of a room that she is building for her son.  Right now she doesn't have the money she needs to buy the materials and pay for people to carry out the work.

Ana Patricia plans to repay her loan with the wages that she makes in her job as head of commerce in a company.

loans.use: to finish off some work in a room that she has been building

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother of one child who attends college. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Susan faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. The demand for clothes is high only during December holidays. Susan dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 that she is requesting, Susan wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 46 years old and married with two school-aged children. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the community. Gloria has had this business for 12 years and she earns approximately PHP 8,000 monthly.

Gloria is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional products to sell like rice, frozen foods and drinks. She hopes that through the loan, she will acquire more customers and gain more income.

In the future, Gloria hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family, especially the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like rice, frozen foods and drinks

loans.name: Lyra Joy

texts.en:
Lyra Joy is 20 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells plastic wares, curtains, blankets, towels, kitchen utensils and groceries. Lyra Joy has had this business for two years. Because of patience and sacrifices made by Lyra Joy and her husband, they are able to start another business- a grocery store. 

Lyra Joy is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional plastic ware, curtains, blankets, towels, kitchen utensils and groceries. Each month, Lyra Joy earns about PHP 5,000 on her dry goods and PHP 1500 from her store.

In the future, Lyra Joy hopes to buy more stock of kitchen utensils, towels and other kinds of dry goods and additional groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, ingredients, oils, sugar and different kinds of baked breads. She will be thankful if her request loan is granted.

loans.use: to buy additional plastic ware, curtains, blankets, towels, kitchen utensils and groceries

loans.name: Bukono Kwetungura Group

texts.en: Twenty-eight-year-old Robina has been in a tea farming business for five years now. Robina is happily married with three kids. She says she began this business with her own capital. On the side, Robina also has a small retail shop that she operates. Weekly, this business generates her 80,000 shillings as profit. With this loan, Robina says she is going to purchase manure for her farms and also additional retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase manure for her farms and retail commodities to resell

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: is 51 years old and has eight children who range in age from 9 to 23 years old. Her husband makes a living by selling shoes, and Immaculate sells plastic products such as buckets, soda and beer crates and other items. She has been in this line of work for 16 years, and has used her income her to feed her family and meet the needs of her children. She is applying for this loan to increase her profits by buying more plastic products to sell. She plans to use the additional profit made possible by this loan to begin building a house for her family. In the future, she plans to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy plastic items such as buckets to sell.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 48 years old and lives in the village of Cabungaan, four kilometers away from the town of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two school-age children.

Catalina has a small market at home. She also has a second business planting and harvesting corn. Her main business is selling assorted food products in the community. She has been engaged in this business for over 20 years. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase rice and corn grains to sell. 

Catalina has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Catalina hopes to expand her retail business and purchase additional land for corn production.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn grains to sell.

loans.name: Nita Marianita Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto rodeado de una playa hermosa lugar donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y además visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar.

La señora Nita es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 50 años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tuvo  cuatro hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive una chica de 17 años que la crio desde pequeña ya que sus padres fallecieron y es como su hija, además de un nieto de 8 años que son sus compañía y su alegría, ellos estudian en colegio y escuela.

Nuestra amiga para ganarse la vida hace dos años empezó con un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, ella tiene un pequeño bar en su casa que está ubicado frente al mar y allí vende tostadas, batidos de frutas, sodas, hamburguesas, energizantes, hielo, y otras bebidas, vende todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 que cierra su negocio, nos cuenta que le gusta ya que en él a mas de ganarse para sus sustento diario se entretiene y está al tanto de lo que la rodea.

Este crédito es para comprar sodas, frutas, pan, carne y otros ingredientes y productos necesarios en su negocio.

Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
In the beautiful resort town of San Jacinto, surrounded by a beautiful beach, in a place where the Portoviejo River joins the sea and many tourists both national and foreign come to visit, the communal bank Esperanza Para Superar [Hope To Overcome] meets together every two weeks. 

Mrs. Nita is the founding member of the communal bank, and she likes it for the ease with which loans may be obtained. She is 50 years old and separated, although she had four children from that relationship who are now adults and independent. She has living with her a 17-year-old girl whom she has raised since she was small because her parents passed away, who is like her daughter, as well as an 8-year-old grandson, who are her company and her joy. They attend high school and elementary school. 

Two years ago our friend, in order to earn a living, started up a fast food business. She has a small bar in her house which is located on the seafront, and there she sells tostadas, fruit smoothies, sodas, hamburgers, energizing drinks, ice, and other drinks. She works every day from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. when she closes her business. She tells us that she enjoys it because, in addition to earning her daily sustenance, she is entertained and stays tuned in to everything around her. 

This loan is for buying sodas, fruits, bread, meat and other ingredients and products necessary for her business. Her dreams are to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bread, meat, sodas, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Doris Maritza

texts.es: Doris Maritza, de 44 años es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas y su nieto de 2 años.Para Doris los días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a una amiga sale a los caseríos y centros poblados a vender ropa usada y a comprar frutas para surtir su puesto de venta de frutas que tiene en su casa. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es salir a los caseríos ya que ahí encuentra todo tipo de productos y de alguna manera de distrae al mismo tiempo que genera ingresos para su hogar. Lleva 12 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que salir muy temprano ya que a veces es peligroso. Con el tiempo, espera poder empezar a vender ropa nueva que le traerán de la ciudad de Lima.Este es el sexto préstamo de Doris con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las demás socias del banco comunal, es donde es muy querida ya que junto a su madre son las que le ponen la alegría al grupo.Con los 1500 soles que solicito, comprará más frutas y ropa para poder seguir en el negocio.
texts.en: Doris Maritza is 44 years old and she is a simple and hardworking woman. She lives in a house of her own together with her two daughters and a 2-year old grandchild. Doris starts her work very early in the morning when she gets together with a friend. They set out into the communities and towns to sell used clothing and to buy fruit to stock the fruit stand she has in her home. What she most enjoys about her work is traveling to the different communities because there she can find all types of products which passes the time, and at the same time she also generates an income for her household. She has been in business for 12 years and the most difficult part about her work is having to set out very early in the morning which can be dangerous. In time she hopes to start selling new clothing that will be brought to her from Lima. This is Doris' sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she recognizes the responsibility of paying it back on time. She doesn't want to cause any problems to the other members of the communal bank. She is very well liked in her community bank especially because she and her mother are the ones who bring humor to the group. With the 1500 nuevos soles she requested she will purchase more fruits and clothing to keep up her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and clothing to keep up her business.

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité Dulce Esperanza se formó D. la unión D. varias vecinas y amigas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso. Ellas se unieron con el propósito D. obtener mayores ingresos, y D. D. esa forma puedan ayudar en la economía D. sus casas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz D. realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen al compañerismo.
La señora Maria, está casada y no tiene hijos, se dedica a la venta D. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser cubiertos, ropas, frazadas, sabanas, calzados, y demás. Ella trabaja muy duro para poder mantener a sus sobrinos que quedaron huérfanos siendo muy chicos y que ahora viven con ella. Se considera una mujer muy creativa y llena D. sueños. Uno D. sus mayores anhelos es poder tener un local donD. ofrecer sus productos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. sábanas, frazadas y demás, para la posterior venta. Ella está muy agradecida a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, ya que D. obtener el crédito le será D. mucha ayuda en su pequeña empresa.
texts.en:
The "Dulce Esperanza" ("Sweet Hope") committee was formed by the coming together of several friends and neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  They came together with the objective of earning better incomes, and in this way to be able to help with their household finances.  The members have formed a group that is very united, and capable of together achieving things that strengthen their partnership.

Señora Maria is married and has no children.  She works selling all kinds of things such as cutlery, clothes, sheets, blankets, shoes and other items.  She works hard to support her nephews who were orphaned when they were very young.  She considers herself to be a very creative woman who is full of dreams.  She dreams that she will be able to have premises to offer her products.

She is asking for the loan to buy sheets, blankets and other items, for subsequent sale.  She is very grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that is being offered to her.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets and cutlery.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap, 34, resides with her husband and children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Sopheap sells groceries, earning an income of 5 USD per day. Sopheap also grows yams on her own plot of land to generate more income for her family. Each month, the family has to spend 80 USD on food and 40 USD on other necessary expenses. Sopheap is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike to commute to her yam plantation. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to her yam plantation

loans.name: Ricardo Presentado

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 33 años de edad, está casado con la señora Daniela, que trabaja como docente, comentan que aún no tienen la dicha de tener hijos.
El señor Ricardo es Técnico en Electrónica, realiza servicios técnicos, proyectos ejecutivos, mantenimiento de computadoras y PC, y además venta de accesorios para computadoras en general. Hace mas de 8 años que se decica a esta profección y hace 2 años aproximadamente que trabaja de manera independiente. Él se define como una persona muy trabajadora. Comenta que uno de sus proyectos a futuro es poder tener una tienda amplia donde pueda vender todo tipo de dispositivos para las computadoras. Desea darle a su esposa un estilo de vida diferente, donde vivan con las comodidades mínimas y sin privaciones.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de accesorios de computadoras, para la posterior venta, sabe que de obtener el crédito este le será de gran ayuda en sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
Señor Ricardo is from the city of Ita. He is 33 years old and is married to Señora Daniela who works as a teacher. He says that they have not as yet had the joy of having children.

Señor Ricardo is an electronics technician. He performs technical services, project management, computer and PC maintenance and in addition sells accessories for computers in general. He has been in this profession for more than 8 years and for the last 2 years has been self-employed. He describes himself as a very hardworking person. He says that one of his future projects is to have a large shop where he can sell all kinds of devices for computers. He wants to give his wife a different lifestyle, to live with the minimum of facilities and without deprivation. 

He is asking for the loan to buy computer accessories for subsequent sale. He knows that obtaining this loan will be a great help to him in his  endeavors.

.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
This is Estella, 34, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Separated from her husband, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Estella maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange and other direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Estella hopes to be able to be successful in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Maria Milagro De Los Angeles

texts.es: María, se ha decidico por un nuevo préstamo, que lo utilizara para comprar materia prima como (maíz, quesillo chicharon) y comprar un cedazo de maya, para arreglar el local donde tiene el negocio, de esa forma podrá tener más lo necesario para realizar la venta y mantener a su clientela bien atendedida. Ella logra mantener el negocio con el aporte que recibe de los prestasmo, tanto el anterior como este, sera un gran apoyo, ya que se le hace facil por cada venta ahorrar la cuota para pagar.
texts.en:
María has decided upon a new loan to buy ingredients like corn, cheese, and “chicharon” (fried pork rinds).  She will also buy a wire mesh sifter to set up her place of business.  This way she will be able to have more than the basics to make her sales and to keep her customers well-tended to.  

She will manage to keep her business with the help she receives from the loans.  This loan, as much as the previous one, will be of great help.  It makes it easy for her to save from each sale in order to make her payments

loans.use: to buy ingredients like corn, cheese, and “chicharon” (fried pork rinds) to make "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans).

loans.name: Mujeres Con Suenos Y Metas 5, 6 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator for the group “Mujeres de Sueños y Metas 5, 6 & 7” (Women with Dreams and Goals). Her family consists of her four children and her long term partner who is the father of her children. They live in Santo Domingo in one of the poorest communities located north of the city. This community is in a rural area.

Dominga is excited about receiving her third loan from Esperanza International. She run a fast food business from a stand in front of her house. Her specialty is salted and fried meat. She plans to invest her new loan in the purchase of meat (beef and pork) and also fruit to prepare natural juices. She started her business because her grandmother uses to sell meat and she talked to her. She has been selling meat for 13 years.  Her profits will be saved and to buy different things her children need. 

Dominga's most difficult challenge has been to raise her children, and she is dreaming to finish building her house into a concrete block structure, to live tranquil and safe.

loans.use: to buy meat and fruit

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
A sus 69 años de edad, Luis Alberto trabaja desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde en los oficios propios de la construcción en Medellín, al lado de su hijo y otras tres personas, este luchador se dedica a esta labor desde hace 30 años. 

Para continuar realizando su labor de una manera más eficiente, Luis Alberto necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunas herramientas como esmeril y equipo de pintura pues los que tiene ya no le prestan un buen servicio debido a su antigüedad.
texts.en: At the age of 69, Luis Alberto works from 6am until 6pm in construction jobs in Medellín alongside his son and three other people.  This hardworking man has been in this line of work for 30 years.  To continue doing his work more efficiently, Luis Alberto needs to buy some tools like emery and painting equipment because the ones he has aren’t working too well anymore because of their age.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant et a 3 enfants.  
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1996. Elle achète et revend des produits de mercerie genre boutons, doublures, fermetures et autres à toutes personnes à Lomé au quartier HANOUKOPE. Elle achète les produits au Ghana. 
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de merceries destinés à la vente. Elle veut agrandir son activité avec ses profits supplémentaires.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait ouvrir d’autres points de vente à Lomé et à l’intérieur du pays. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 47-year-old woman. She is married to a teacher and has three children.
Afi has worked as a retailer since 1996. She buys and sells haberdashery items such as buttons linings, clasps, and other goods to all customers in the Hanoukope area of Lomé. She buys her products in Ghana.
Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy haberdashery articles for resale. She wants to enlarge her business with her supplementary profits.
In the coming years, Afi would like to open additional sales locations in Lomé and in the interior of the country. She says that with the profits, she intends to contribute to providing for the family.

loans.use: To buy haberdashery items.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: Madame Aissatou  habite dans une  des localités sénégalaises. Elle  est âgée  de 51 ans . Elle est mariée et s’active depuis  plus de 10 ans dans la couture et le tricotage de pagnes et robes. Ses études  dans le domaine du tricotage lui ont assurée sa compétence actuelle. Elle est membre du guichet  de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle vit depuis janvier 2006. Elle a déjà remboursé 7 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour le financement des études de son fils. Son crédit antérieur lui a permis d’honorer une commande pressante.
texts.en: Mrs. Aissatou lives in a district of Senegal. She is a 51-year-old married woman who has been a seamstress and a knitter of pagnes and dresses for over 10 years. The knitting classes that she took have helped her to become the skilled knitter she is today. She became a member of her local U-IMCEC branch in January 2006. She has already obtained and repaid seven prior loans with the organization. She is now seeking a loan of 200,000 francs to fund her son’s studies. The previous loan helped her to fill a rush order.

loans.use: to fund her son's studies

loans.name: Lotolelei

texts.en:
Lotolelei is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Salelavalu Uta. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lotolelei owns & operates a business raising cattle for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 800 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lotolelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD, used to purchase baby livestock to raise, and is now requesting a new loan of 1450 WST to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. The loan will be the third taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Lotolelei plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Flutanata

texts.en: Flutanata is a single woman who is committed to her work. For five years, she has operated a grocery store where she sells bananas, avocados, and other items. Her business is located along a busy main road, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of fruit. Flutanata will use the requested KES 20,000 loan to buy more fruit. Her business goal is to run a big shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy, 56 years old, is married and has one child. She lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Nancy has owned and operated a general store for 10 years, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. Nancy earns a monthly income of PHP 5,000 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional products to sell. Nancy recently joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance for her business. In the future, Nancy hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Adiccion Group

texts.es:
Sandra, es mujer y madre, de quien dependen dos hijos. Ella pensando en su familia y en la forma en que podía apoyar en la economía de su hogar y con ello dar una mejor calidad de vida a los suyos, decidió poner un stand de comida afuera de su domicilio. Esta idea nació a partir de que sus amigas y vecinas le comentaban en fiestas y reuniones que tenía un rico sazón. Estos comentarios la impulsaron a emprender su negocio. Al principio, tenia incertidumbre de  funcionar y más por la competencia, pero poco a poco ha crecido su clientela.
Ahora ella pide un crédito para poder devolver el tanque de gas que le prestaron para echar andar el negocio y reparar la parilla con la que inicio.
Ella ha puesto toda su voluntad y esperanzas en este negocio pues desea ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor presente.
texts.en:
Sandra is a woman and a mother, with two children who depend on her. Thinking of her family, and how she could support her household finances, and so provide a better quality of life to her family members, she decided to set up a food stand outside her home.

This idea originated from her friends and neighbors commenting at parties and gatherings that her food had a delicious flavor. These comments motivated her to launch her business.

In the beginning, she had doubts about it working, and more because of the competition, but little by little, her clientele has grown. Now she is asking for a loan to be able to return the gas tank that was lent to her to get the business going, and to repair the grill that she started with. 

She has put all of her will and her hopes into this business, as she wishes to offer her children a better present.

loans.use: To buy a new tank of gas, and repair her current grill.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина замужем, имеет одну 6-ти летнюю дочь. Галина занимается фермерством –  у нее 3 большие теплицы, где она выращивает овощи. Галина занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет и он ей очень нравиться.  У Галины много своей земли и она с мужем хочет посадит там сад в будущем. В планах на следующий год – построить еще одну теплицу.

Галина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 8,000 гривен на установку системы отопления в теплицах. Это позволит ей сделать более раннюю посадку и продать овощи по более высокой цене. Полученную прибыль Галина вкладывает в обустройство своего жилья, а также в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Galina is married and has one 6 year-old daughter.  Galina is involved in farming and has three large greenhouses, where she grows vegetables.  She has been in this business for ten years already and likes it very much.  Galina has a lot of her own land, and she and her husband want to plant a garden there in the future.  They plan to build another greenhouse next year.  Galina is requesting a loan in the sum of 8,000 hryvnia to install a heating system in her greenhouses.  This would allow her to to begin planting earlier and sell vegetables at a higher price.  Galina invests her business profit into improving her home and to develop her business further.

loans.use: to install heating in her greenhouses

loans.name: William Alfredo

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Inició tiempo atrás cuando decidió incrementar sus ingresos para el beneficio y estabilidad de su familia.  Trabaja junto a su mamá y esposa de 7 am hasta las 6 pm, todos los días.  Su esposa se encarga de las actividades domésticas y también le ayuda en la costura.  Tiene 2 hijos pero por ahora no estudian.  Quiere en un futuro incrementar su negocio para poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.  Necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de hilos, telas y botones para sus labores de confección.

loans.use: Compra de artículos de costura

loans.name: Oussoukpevi Marguerite

texts.fr: Oussoukpevi Marguerite âgée de 51 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Oussoukpevi Marguerite est mariée à un certain Félicien. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Oussoukpevi Marguerite vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont assumées par Oussoukpevi Marguerite et son mari. Pour cette raison, Oussoukpevi Marguerite vend du charbon de bois, des condiments et des céréales à son domicile depuis quinze ans environ. Oussoukpevi Marguerite s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Afin de satisfaire davantage sa clientèle, Oussoukpevi Marguerite sollicite pour une septième fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du charbon de bois, des condiments et des céréales.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and a mother of two.  Together with her husband they are selling fish in winters and water melon and summer fruits in summers.  She is using her fifth loan and with the help of the loand she expanded their business.  She is also cooking fish in the same place they are selling fish as per requests from the customers.  The number of her customers increased.  With the help of the loan she is planning to buy necessary materials. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Fatma hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Eşi ile beraber kışın balık satıyor yazında karpuz ve yaz meyveleri satarak evini geçindiriyor.  Mikro krediden 5. kredisini kullanıyor aldığı kredi ile işlerini geliştirdi.  Balık satışı yaptığı yerde müşterilerinin isteği üzerine balıkları pişirerek de satmaya başladı.  Müşteri sayısının artmasına neden oldu.  Aldığı kredi ile gerekli olan malzemeleri alacak.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials

loans.name: Noemí

texts.en:
Noemi is a single woman, engaging and productive, living in Monclova, Coahuila. Some time ago she bought a small house on credit. She needed an additional income to cover the costs of her home, so she started a smalll business selling shoes through catalogue. She started the small business about a year ago and she has seen great success. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory to meet demands during this high sales season.

Noemi needs your support to keep her business growing. She needs a loan of $200 which she plans on repaying within three months. Be part of her success. She thanks you for it.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Monclova, Coahuila, vive Doña Noemí, una mujer sola, pero muy emprendedora y productiva, hace algún tiempo compró a crédito una pequeña casa y adquirió otros compromisos. Ella necesitaba de ingresos extras para poder hacer frente a sus gastos, por lo que vio la oportunidad en la venta de zapatos por catálogo. Hace un año que comenzó con el negocio y le ha dado buenos resultados, pero ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más zapatos, pues en ésta temporada los pedidos de los clientes aumentan en grandes cantidades.

Apoya a Doña Noemí en su proyecto y ayúdala a seguir creciendo, ella requiere de un préstamo de $ 200 DLLS, mismo que tiene planeado cubrir en un plazo de 3 meses, se parte de sus logros, ella te lo agradecederá.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has had a bazaar for the past 25 years. She opened it with savings from her work in a warehouse where she had the idea of starting her own business. Her bazaar is located inside her home where her children help her attend to customers. She is open for business every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m.

Victoria wants to use the loan to add more products to her store like candy and school supplies to meet the demand of her customers. With the added income she plans to invest in more products.

Victoria is 45 years old and is a married mother of two children who go to school. Her husband is a driver who works outside of the city. Victoria says the good thing about her husband is that when he’s home he helps her very much with the business, knowing that this is an extra source of income for the family, allowing them to continue improving their house.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Victoria tiene su negocio de bazar desde hace 25 años lo inicio con ahorros de su trabajo en almacén de productos de consumo masivo de donde le nació la idea de poner un negocio. Su bazar lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio donde sus hijos le ayudan en atender a los clientes. Su atención al publico lo hace todos los días desde las 6AM hasta 22PM

Doña Victoria con el préstamo desea agregar a su negocio mas productos como: colas, confites, útiles escolares otros para así poder cumplir con la demanda solicitada por sus clientes y con las utilidades generadas poder realizar mas inversiones.

Doña Victoria tiene 45 años. Es casada y tiene dos hijos que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es chofer labora fuera de la ciudad lo bueno de su esposo indica doña Victoria es que cuando esta en su hogar la apoya mucho porque sabe que esto le da otros ingresos que le van a permitir seguir adecuando la vivienda

loans.use: Add more products

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Miss Thuy is 37 and her husband is 43 years old. They have 5 children between 17 and 2 who are going to school. They don’t have any land for cultivation. Mr Thao, her husband is a mason but he can only find work in the dry season. Miss Thuy sells vegetable and fruits at the small market. Her selling is thus important to increase her family about $1.5/person/month. Their income is $9/person/month. Miss Thuy has already repaid the first loan in time. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling business.

loans.use: sells vegetable and fruits

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Tengo ya casi terminada mi casa solo me esta asiendo falta el piso en el patio y quiero terminar una cochera, ya que cuando llueve es inunda todo el patio y es un problema con la humedad. Solicito 1,200.00 dlls. Para poner piso en el patio y cochera.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

I have already nearly finished my house; it is just that I need a floor in the patio and I want to finish up the garage because when it rains, it floods all over the patio, creating too much humidity. I’m seeking a loan of $1200 to install a floor in the patio and a garage.

loans.use: To install a floor in the patio and a garage

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.ru:
Dilfuza N. sells food and household products. She is married, has 3 children and a secondary education. Her husband helps her in her business. She started her business by selling food products. She became a client of MicroInvest in 2004. Back then her assets were valued at $200 and she got a loan for $100. After receiving the loan and using it fully she acquired a large store and added household products to her inventory. Today her assets have doubled. Dilfuza plans on using the new loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Нурматова Дилфуза- занимается продажей продуктами питания и хозяйственными товарами. Замужем, мать троих детей, образование среднее. Муж помогает в торговле своей жене. Начала свою деятельность с продажи продуктов питания. Клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» стала в 2004году, тогда её активы составляли 200$, она получила займ в размере 100$. После получения займа и целевого использования она приобрела большой магазин и добавила ассортимент хозяйственные товары. Сейчас ее активы увеличились в два раза больше.В будущем планирует увеличить товарооборот.

loans.use: to increase turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Jesse

texts.en: Jesse F. is from the village of Samatau. This is one of the oldest and most active centres of the loan program. She is applying for this loan in order to improve her business and also for the improvement of her house. Jesse delivers her biscuits to the urban retail shops five days of the week and makes 300 WST ($120 USD) a week. She has no husband or children, and she is responsible for taking care of her elderly grandmother and grandfather. She is one of the active members of the loan program, and she is looking forward to receiving more loans.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, sugar, and other ingredients for her Samoan biscuits business

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar A. is a 35-year-old trader and businessman who owns his small store in Imishli region. He sells stationary and provides printing/copier service for the local people.  He has seven years of experience in this field. He enjoys his job very much and has a good relationship with clients, so his store is always full of people. Vugar is requesting a loan of $1100 so he can diversify and increase the number of products he sells.

loans.use: To diversify and increase number of products for sale

loans.name: Nyenga East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Suzan N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and selling clothes and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of clothes. Suzan is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 2 children raged 24 and 26. Each week, Suzan makes approximately UGX 28000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand business Suzan has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to increase stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Suzan is joined in her small group by Suzan B., Faisi N., Eseza N., and Fardia M.. Suzan B. has a farming business and wants to buy more land for cultivation. Faisi N. is currently operating a business in poultry farming and wants a loan to buy more chicks and poultry feeds. Eseza N. operates a farm and wants to enlarge her farm. Fardia M. is currently in the business of cattle rearing and is requesting a loan to buy another cow.

loans.use: To improve clothing business

loans.name: Bechijtic 2 Group

texts.es:
Alicia is part of the Solidarity Bechijtic 2 Group from the community of Chamula, Chiapas. She is 21 years old and single. Together with her parents and her five brothers and sisters, she grows vegetables: chard, spinich, radishes, lettuce, turnips and cabbage, which they sell to wholesalers who then sell them in the nearby local communities. In this way, her family works to obtain the resources to survive. With a loan she will invest in purchasing seeds and fertilizers so they can have a good harvest. Her other colleagues: Manuela, Veronica and Guadalupe, work at the same activity, and Josefina has a small grocery installed in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

ALICIA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO BECHIJTIC 2 DE LA COMUNIDAD DE CHAMULA, CHIAPAS. ELLA TIENE 21 AÑOS, ES SOLTERA. JUNTO CON SUS PADRES Y SUS CINCO HERMANOS SE DEDICA AL CULTIVO DE VERDURAS: ACELGA, ESPINACAS, RABANOS, LECHUGA, NAVOS, REPOLLO Y LOS VENDE CON MAYORISTAS QUE LOS COMERCIALIZAN A LAS LOCALIDADES MAS CERCANAS. DE ESTA FORMA SU FAMILIA TRABAJA Y OBTIENE RECURSOS PARA SOBREVIVIR, CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA COMPRANDO SEMILLAS Y FERTILIZANTES PARA OBTENER UNA BUENA COSECHA SUS DEMAS COMPAÑERAS MANUELA, VERONICA Y GUADALUPE DESEMPEÑAN LA MISMA ACTIVIDAD A ESEPCION DE JOSEFINA QUE TIENE INSTALADO UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES EN SU CASA.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Nakazadde Women's Group

texts.en:
Selina is the treasurer of Nakazadde Women’s group in Lugazi town. The 53-year-old is a single mother of 6 children and cares for 4 grandchildren in her house. She separated from her husband many years ago but she has managed to raise her children through her fish selling business in Lugazi Central market which she has been running for 23 solid years. She buys the fish from Kiyindi Landing Site usually on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, and she is not regretting the steps she took. She also supplies small silvery fish to chicken mash stores in Lugazi and this has increased her savings.

Selina wants to start a shop at her home since she is aging, as well as building houses for rent and above all, she looks forward to sending her remaining 2 school-going children to a higher level since one is in Senior 6 while the other is in Senior 3. She has planned to buy more fish if given the loan, with a view to increasing her savings so that she can start with her construction plans soon.

loans.use: buy more dry fish for re-sale

loans.name: Miriam Caro

texts.en:
Miriam Caro is fifty-three years old and she lives in the Libertador community of Santo Domingo. Miriam has been selling homemaD. cakes and bonbons for seven years to people in her neighborhood. Her husband is very old and can no longer work, so Miriam has the huge responsibility of providing food and ensuring the well being of the family.

She’s requesting a loan to buy raw materials to keep producing her delicious goods. Miriam Caro hopes her business will allow her and her husband enjoy their golden years.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cakes and other sweets for her customers.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn C., 53, and her husband, who is 58, live along National road number six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1973 and have nine children: five sons and four daughters. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home. Two of the other five children are garment factory workers and three attend the local school.

Mrs. Thorn C. and her husband have been farming since 1979. They grow rice and vegetables on the farm to sell around their village. Beside the farming business, they also buy fruit for resale. Currently, they purchase mangos from farmers on contract. They need to pay money to the villagers before the harvest season and when harvest season arrives they take the produce to sell at the market. Mrs. Thorn is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase mangos on contract and to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase mangos from farmers on contract and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., aged 24, is married and has a young child. She and her family are currently living in Hung Nguyen Town, Nghe An Province. In 2007, Mrs. T. joined TYM Fund, who gave her loan to purchase vehicles so her husband could transport goods for customers. Mrs. T. also opens an internet café at home to increase family’s income. And since she has the advantage of living in a populated area, her business has been relatively lucrative so far. In the next round of loan, Mrs. T. hopes for a loan of 9.000.000 VND ($550) to purchase more facilities (computers) for her internet café. Her family’s monthly income is 4.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị T. năm nay 24 tuổi. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con đang còn nhỏ tại huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ An. Năm 2007 chị thma gia vào Quỹ tình thương vay vốn đầu tư mua phương tiện vận chuyển để chồng chị đi chở hàng thuê. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi chở hàng thuê còn chị kinh doanh Internet tại nhà. Nhà chị ở khu đông dân cư, gần đường giao thông nên công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm máy vi tính phục vụ cho việc kinh doanh Internet.

Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more clothing to add to her stock.

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza Tanzania!

Pendo M. is a married woman with two children, aged eleven and twelve. She is thirty-five years old. She started her ice-cream business in 2005. She works six days a week for four hours a day and is assisted by two employees. She earns a monthly profit of about $100 from this business. Pendo is requesting a loan of $450 to purchase another refrigerator and additional containers. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so she can use it while in process of paying back her loan Ð a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and additional containers.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe A., 50, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village and general public 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

SPBD loans are Pepe's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home renovation. Pepe's earning will be used to improve her business and help out with family expenses. Her husband and children work on the plantation.

loans.use: Buy bushknives, barbed wire, pesticides, gromozone, and timber for home improvement

loans.name: Reina Dayse

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Reina F. me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tengo varios años de dedicarme a esta actividad, soy una persona trabajadora, honesta y responsable. este negocio es muy bueno ya que la tortilla es un aliemento escencial en nuestro pais, la tortilla se come en los tres tiempos, ademas que es un alimento nutritivo. en estos momentos mi demanda es mucha y no me doy abasto con todo lo que produzco por tal razon estoy solicitando un credito para comprarme un molino electrico y asi poder moler mas maiz para tener mas masa y poder hacer muchas tortillas, esto me ahorra tiempo y esfuerzo ya que en estos momentos muelo el maiz con molino manual.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Reina F.. For several years I have made and sold tortillas. I am a hardworking, honest, and responsible person. This is a great business because tortillas are an essential and nutritious food in our country, eaten throughout the year. Right now, what I can produce cannot keep up with the high demand. For this reason, I am asking for a loan to buy an electric grinder. That way I can grind more corn to make more dough and be able to produce more tortillas. This will save me time and effort, since I currently grind the corn by hand.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an electric grinder

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs Nguyen Thi V., 43 years old and married with two children, lives in Hung Yen Commune, Hung Nguyen District, Nghe An Province. She has been in the TYM Fund since 2002, and her main income comes from raising chickens and growing rice. Her husband is a driver, and their combined incomes have provided a measure of stability for their family. Nguyen is now requesting a loan to buy more chicken feed and chickens to raise.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and chickens.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina E. is married and has 5 dependants. She has received schooling through junior high. Regina operates a local restaurant, which is popularly known as chop bar hear. She serves a variety of local dishes, such as "fufu" which is made out of cassava and plantain pounded together. She has operated her restaurant at Idan Hill in Cape Coast for the past 5 years. Her husband is a trader. Regina uses her income to support her husband in meeting the family's financial needs.

Regina will use the loan to purchase more ingredients, spices, and food items for food preparation at her restaurant. With the new profits from her expanded business, Regina plans to add to her husband's savings in order to acquire a piece of land on which to build their family house.

In the photo, Regina is pounding the ingredients to make "Fufu".

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients, spices, and food items for food preparation at her restaurant.

loans.name: Ni Luh Eka

texts.id: Semakin mendesaknya biaya hidup dari hari ke hari membuat Luh Eka tidak bisa hanya mengandalkan hasil dari mengolah ladang bersama suaminya. Luh Eka mencoba untuk lebih meningkatkan hasil dari beternak babi yang sudah menjadi kerja selingan pada waktu pagi dan sore hari. Tetapi melihat hasil dari beternak babi cukup lumayan maka Luh Eka memutuskan untuk menambah populasi ternak babinya dengan meminjam modal ke DINARI sebesar Rp.3.750.000,- dengan jangka waktu pinjaman selama 6 bulan dan pelunasan akan dilakukan pada akhir periode pinjaman setelah babi terjual. Kedepan setelah menerima pinjaman ini rencananya akan dibelikan bibit babi penggemukan sebanyak 2 ekor dulu disamping sekarang di rumahnya juga sudah ada babi-babi dari modal sendiri yang dipelihara. Harga bibit per ekor berkisar Rp.350.000,- dan sisa pinjaman nanti akan digunakan untuk biaya pakan babi selama 6 bulan pemeliharaan. Luh Eka berharap bisa mendapat keuntungan mencapai Rp.500.000,-. Hasil pelihara babi ini diharapkan bisa meningkatkan penghasilan keluarganya dan mampu membiayai anaknya yang masih kecil.
texts.en:
Increased pressures from day to day living expenses, made Luh Eka could not depend on field farming with her husband. Luh Eka tried to increase results from pig farming which is already her side job mornings and evenings. But seeing results from pig raising is quite good, Luh Eka decided to increase her pig populations by borrowing capital from DINARI for Rp.3,750,000,- (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp10,000-12,000.00) for a period of 6 months, and payment at period end after the pigs are sold. When loan is received the plan was to buy 2 piglets for fattening, besides the other pigs she already raised from her own capital. Price per piglet is Rp.350,000,- and rest of the loan would be used for feed expenses for the 6 months raising period. Luh Eka hopes profit could reach Rp.500,000,-. Result from pig raising is hoped to increase family's income, and to pay for child expenses, who is still small.

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: pigs and it's feed

loans.name: Jonaliza

texts.en:
“Love your neighbor as you love yourself”, this is one of God’s commandments that Jonaliza tries to practice for she believes that loving your fellow man means loving God. She is already 40 years old and married to Juan M..  Her husband is a farmer which is the main occupation of the residents in their village.  They do not have a child but they are still hoping that their prayers will be answered despite their age.  

Jonaliza is engaged in the sari-sari store (a community based store) business.  Aside from selling different commodities, she is also planning to venture into rice retailing.  With this, she would like to borrow at least PHP 7,000.00 that she will use to buy a minimum of 5 sacks of rice.  The amount will also assist her in developing her village store in terms of increase in merchandise.  In this way, she can meet the demands of her customers and they do not have to go to the town proper.  Her store has been operating for almost one year and she is hoping that it will last for years.

loans.use: To buy 5 sacks of rice

loans.name: Gniné

texts.fr:
Madame Gniné Samaké est âgée de 30 ans et vit avec ses  4 enfants et son mari dans une famille monogamme  dans le quartier Faraba de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elle fait le commerce d’articles divers qu’elle commença dès son âge auprès de sa mère. Avec une expérience de 15ans Madame Gniné Samaké maîtrise son activité et est appréciée des habitants de Bougouni.
Afin d’obtenir une ressource financière  complémentaire, Madame Gniné Samaké décida de collaborer  avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier individuel.
Elle veut  acheter, 15 draps de lit et de 50 paires de chausures de toutes catégories  au Burkina Faso et à Bamako (capitale de republique du Mali). Elle effectue ses ventes dans les differents quartiers de Bougouni mais aussi au marché les jours de foires. 
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise afin de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gniné Samaké is 30 years old and lives with her 4 children and her husband in a monogamous household in the Faraba district of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She has a business selling various items, which she started at a young age with her mother. With over 15 years of experience, Mrs. Gniné Samaké has mastered her business and is valued by the residents of Bougouni. In order to obtain additional financial resources, Mrs. Gniné Samaké decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan. She would like to buy 15 bedsheets and 50 pairs of shoes of all types in Burkina Faso and in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). She makes her sales in different areas of Bougouni and also at the market during market-days. With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA. With this profit, she foresees enlarging her business with the goal of becoming a wholesaler.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bedsheets and shoes

loans.name: Bola

texts.en:
Bola is a young lady who believes that business struggle is the antidote to poverty. She is 26 years old and married.

Bola has operated her restaurant business since 2004. Acquiring the skill took five years. Bola needs a loan of N 120,000 to enable her buy more drinks and sachet water to sell.

Bola is very grateful for the financial support rendered to her by LAPO Microfinance and Kiva. She thanks you.

loans.use: Purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell.

loans.name: Edgar Plutarco

texts.es: El señor de Nombre Edgar Plutarco tiene la edad de 33 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Edgar tiene 1 hijo. La actividad económica de Don Edgar es la venta de mercadearía en general como pantalones, camisas, ropa interior y calzado. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que dio inicio por la necesidad de proveerle a su familia una fuente de ingresos por que no poseía un trabajo. Los propósitos de Don Edgar son de invertir cada día en su negocio para ofrecerles a sus clientes lo que ellos solicitan. El financiamiento solicitado por Edgar es destinado para capital de trabajo para realizar la compra de calzado, camisetas, faldas y cosméticos. El mayor deseo de Edgar es obtener una tienda y mantener disponible la ayuda que le brinda Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar Plutarco is 33-years-old and married. He has one child. Mr. Edgar sells general merchandise like pants, shirts, underwear, and shoes. He has worked in this field for more than ten years. He began doing this sort of work because he saw that he needed to provide for his family and didn't have a job. Mr. Edgar plans to spend each day working on his business so he can offer his clients what they ask for. The loan Edgar is requesting will be capital for his business so he can buy footwear, shirts, skirts, and cosmetics. His greatest wish is to have a store and to continue receiving the help offered him from the Leon 2000 Foundation and its sister organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Merly

texts.es:
MERLY L. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MU7JERES CORAJE” vive en el Jr Fortaleza, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 19 años de edad, 1 hijo, y su pareja es motocarrista.

Hace algún tiempo se inició en el negocio de motocar.  Con  el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró repuestos para su motocar.

Actualmente se dedica a administrar el motocar.  Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa invertirlo en la compra de un nuevo motocar y así obtener mayores ingresos.

“Doy gracias a Manuela Ramos por confiar en una mujer joven porque en ninguna institución me dan esa oportunidad.  Sé que puedo trabajar y además estoy planificando estudiar por las noches para así hacer crecer mucho más el negocio.... ahora y ser una gran empresaria”.
texts.en:
Merly L. T. belongs to the “Mujeres Coraje” community bank. She lives on Fortaleza Street in the town of Pucallpa. She is 19 years old, has one son and her partner is a motocarrista (moto-taxi driver). She started the motocar business some time ago. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles she bought spare parts for her motocar. Now she manages the motocar. With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles she plans to buy a new motocar and thereby increase her income.

“I am grateful to Manuela Ramos for trusting a young woman when no other institution would give me such an opportunity. I know that I can work and I am planning to study at night so that I can grow the business much more… now I shall be a great entrepreneur.”

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motocar

loans.name: Leli

texts.es:
La señora Leli es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, está divorciada y tiene 5 hijos a su cargo.  Vive en el Jr. José Carlos Mariategui Nº 135 Barrio Revolución.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de chalona (carne).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para comprar mas chalona.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo de S/ 1000.00 nuevos soles, este dinero le servirá para poder adquirir mas chalona, carne y quesos, y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; su deseo es seguir trabajando para poder, en el futuro, vender al por mayor sus producto.
Le gustaría poner un emporio, en el cual vendería carnes y productos afines.
texts.en:
Leli is a member of the “Aswancaris II” community bank in the Azangaro province of the department of Puno. She is 56-years old, divorced, and has five children under her care. She lives on Jr. José Carlos Mariategui street, Nº 135, in the Revolución neighborhood. She has worked with the program of Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year. She buys and sells meat for a living. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy more meat products. Currently she wishes to take out a loan for 1,000 PEN. This money will allow her to acquire more meat and cheese, and thus continue expanding her business. She hopes to keep working and, in the future, to sell her products wholesale. She would like to set up a store, in which she would sell meat and other related products.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat and cheese

loans.name: Busari

texts.en: Busari is 36 years old and married with 2 children. He sells rechargeable phones and cards. He is requesting the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more phones and rechargeable cards to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phones and cards to sell

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert S. is a married man with no child yet. He has received schooling through junior high.

Gilbert is a cobbler and also sells hardware in Hohoe. He uses all his income to pay housekeeping expenses. He will use the loan to purchase leather to manufacture shoes. With the new profits from his expanded business, Gilbert plans to save.

loans.use: To purchase leather to manufacture shoes

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie C. is from the village of Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 20 years old. Ana Marie is married to Alvin. To make a living, Ana Marie owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grilled pork and chicken (barbeque vending) in the local community. Ana Marie is just starting this business.

In July 2009, Ana Marie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ana Marie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ana Marie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mrs. Chandoeun Huorn Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which consists of fifteen members, is located in Ta Reab Doun S. village in Kandal province, and they plan to use the loan they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Chandoeun H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a vegetable seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to resell to earn more profits to support her family. Mrs. Chandoeun H. is a 30-year-old widow with three children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell to earn more profits to support her family

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
Gilberto is 22 years old and still single. He works as a hog raiser. He started in this business when he resigned from his work in Manila as a waiter for seven years right after he graduated from high school. He lives in Cabisera 25, Ilagan, Isabela and used his savings towards the hog raising business.  

He sells his hogs after five months and now he needs additional capital and would like to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders a loan of PHP5,000.00.  He will use this amount to purchase hogs and feed supply. He hopes that lenders will grant his request so he can fulfill his dream for his business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en:
Making furniture is a main part of 45-year-old S.’s daily routine. S. and her husband currently buy raw materials to make rattan cupboards to sell in bulk to their customers, who come directly to their house to buy. They also buy furniture from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profits. They have done this since 2002.

S. is modest mother who has five children: one is single and the others are married and have ready started new homes. All five of her children also help make cupboards. S. is looking for a loan to sustain her business growth.

loans.use: To sustain her business growth

loans.name: Nancy Socorro

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcas.
Nancy es separada, tiene 46 años y 3 hijos, Nancy tiene un Multiservicios en donde vende ropa, productos naturales, cosméticos, artículos de limpieza, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural.
Los sueños de Nancy son mejorar sus ventas y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de medicina natural.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario T. Sr. is 33 years old and married to Carry. They are glad because they have been blessed with five children:Bernardino-13 years old, 1st year high school; Rodolfo-9 years old, grade-IV; Mario Jr.-4 years old and the twins Aristotle and Ariston-1 year old.

Mario hopes that he could sustain all the needs of his family. He repairs umbrella,water jag and shoes in their village. He is striving hard to provide the needs of his family. He would like to improve their way of living through his small business and he is now asking for additional capital from the KIVA lenders the amount of PHP5,000. He is praying that he could attain the amount of loan he is requesting. He is currently spending tuition fees, projects and allowances to his two children. So, he needs to double the income he generate to further supply all the needs of his family.

loans.use: additional capital for business

loans.name: Ngoun

texts.en:
Ngoun S., 33, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband.

To make a living, she sells breakfast, including coffee and Chinese noodles, to her existing and new customers, earning an income of US $3. She has to get up early in the morning every day to prepare her food shop while her husband goes fishing at a big lake in the province. S.’s husband is skilled in producing Cambodian traditional fishing traps, so he is able to catch a lot of fish to sell at the local market, earning an income of US $4 per day, which is the primary source of income of the family.

This couple is seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate more income, so Ngoun is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a big fishing boat for her husband's fishing business. The boat will also enable her husband to transport goods to her shop easily.

loans.use: To buy a big fishing boat

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is 39 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a carpenter. All her children are schooling. She hopes to give her children a quality education. She sells spiritual items like candles, olive oil, and incense in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to excel in her business and family life. The high season for her business is here and she hopes to meet the demands of her numerous customers. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more spiritual items to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase spiritual items to sell

loans.name: Jovencio

texts.en:
Jovencio is engaged in a retail business, selling different flavors of ice cream on sticks in his village using his motorcycle. He hopes that he could further expand his business by having more items to sell. He dreams of selling his products in different villages, if only he could gain additional capital for his business. He hopes that his first loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos will be granted for the growth of his ice-cream business.

Jovencio is a 50-year-old businessman. He and his wife live together in the village of Punit, Benito Soliven, Isabela. They are blessed with three children. As a father, he is glad that his children have their own work now. His eldest graduated with a degree in education and she is presently working in Hong Kong. Two of his children are in Manila and busy with their own work. Although they are apart from each other, Jovencio hopes that their good relationship with each other will remain.
