loans.use: Additional capital to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn S. runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 32 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the village of Gud. Ednalyn earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Ednalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ednalyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Renovadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Renovadoras” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del barrio Las Garzas, de la ciudad de San Antonio. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas. Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a dichas actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable.
La historia de Doña Juana es muy conmovedora, la misma se encuentra con 5 hijos y su marido no tiene empleo, ella hace de todo con la ayuda de su marido para mantener a su hijos, actualmente ella se dedica a la preparación de comidas para la venta.

texts.en:
The Mujeres Renovadoras formed with the union of various neighbors from the Las Garzas neighborhood in the city of San Antonio. All of the group’s members work in independent activities like sales. The members formed a very united group, which is capable of working together. The majority of its members work by selling, and they are colleagues among themselves. All of the group’s members are mothers who work to strengthen the household economy and to develop their enterprises in a sustainable manner. Juana’s story is very moving. She has five children, and her husband is unemployed. She does everything, with help from her husband, to support her children. She currently makes food to sell. 1 Lina G. de Rodas Sells Clothes 2 Mónica Gómez Sells Clothes 3 Victoria B. Sells Clothes 4 Damaris Gómez Pastry Shop 5 Mirtha E. Sells Cosmetics 6 Olga C. Sells Sports Lottery Tickets 7 Idalia C. Sells Sports Lottery Tickets 8 Luciana Agüero Sells Drinks 9 Mónica Valdéz Snack Bar 10 Gregoria R. Food Store 11 Rafaela M. Pastry Shop 12 Teresa R. Sells Clothes 13 Juana Liz R. Sells Food 14 Lilia F. Food Store 15 Maria Lucia P. Sells Fruit

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and ingredients

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Gran Pajaten”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 44 años y 03 hijas, que aun dependen de ella.

Margarita, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora, con ganas de seguir adelante, así aportar en el ingreso económico, en su hogar.
Lleva 10 años dedicándose a la venta de comidas, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos, decidió abrirse más en el campo, así que con su esfuerzo estableció un pequeño ambiente, ubicada en su misma casa, para atender a sus clientes; con ese carisma y alegría que siempre la ha caracterizado.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es muy conocida y tiene buena acogida.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos para preparar sus alimentos  como: kilos de arroz, azúcar y papas, racimos de plátanos, pollos vivos en javas. Y algunas herramientas de cocina, para remplazar a los antiguos.

Margarita, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado, y desea asegurarse una vejez tranquila por lo que agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras   mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Margarita, 44, is a member of the “El Gran Pajaten” communal bank, which is in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and three daughters, who still depend on her. Margarita is a hard-working, enterprising woman, who wants to get ahead and provide income for her family. She has sold prepared meals for 10 years now. As this is a profitable enterprise, she decided to expand and set up a small eatery in her home to tend to her customers with her characteristic good humor and joy. Currently, she continues with this work and she tells us that she does very well since she is well-known and liked. With this 2000 sol loan she will buy ingredients for her meals like: kilograms of rice, sugar and potatoes, bunches of bananas, live, crated chickens as well as some cooking utensils that need to be replaced. Margarita is a tranquil woman who is happy with what she has accomplished. She wants to insure a peaceful old-age for herself so she is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to meet her goals and have her dreams come true, as well as for other women that want to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meal preparation.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en: Margie A. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Margie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Margie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Margie is just starting this business; before she was engaged in the buying and selling of personal products. In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Margie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Margie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Glinis Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Glinis madre de familia de dos hijos, tiene 36 años de edad, junto su esposo se esfuerzan para poder hacer las mejoras a su casa, vive en el barrio Healeah,  pues han logrado ir a poco a poco haciendo las mejoras, su esposo es albañil lo que se le ha hecho mas fácil en la construcción ya que la mano de obra es cara. Su negocio es una pulpería que inicio hace siete años con dinero que su esposo dio, productos de su trabajo, cuando comenzó, palmeaba tortilla, vendía leña, y frijoles cocidos, y luego comenzó con la pulpería lo cual ha sido para ella una buena inversión ya que apoya a su esposo, cuando este no tiene trabajo. sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa ya que le falta el repello de las paredes por dentro, mejorar los baños, y lo que desea hacer con este financiamiento es poder cambiar el techo que esta totalmente dañado por viejo y desea hacerlo ante que comience el invierno ya que se ha mojado las otras temporada lo cual comprara: zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura para cambiar todo su techo y poder estar mas tranquila cuando comience a llover. Con esta solicitud es su tercer ciclo el cual han sido de mucho beneficios ya que ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vidas.
texts.en:
Mrs.Glinis has two children and is 36 years old. She and her husband make an effort to improve their home. They live in the neighborhood of Healeah as they have been able to improve their situation little by little. Her husband is a bricklayer which has made construction easier since labor is expensive. Mrs. Glinis' has a grocery store which she started seven years ago with money earned by her husband. Earlier she sold tortillas, firewood, and cooked beans. Afterwards, she started her grocery store business which has been a good investment for her as she is able to help when her husband is out of a job.
Her plans are to continue improving their home as she needs to plaster the walls and renovate bathrooms. She is requesting this loan to fund the fixing of the roof which is severely damaged due to age. She would like to fix the roof before the winter begins as it has gotten wet in the past. She plans to purchase zinc, beams, hinges, and weld to replace the entire roof and be able to have peace of mind when it starts to rain. This is her third round of loans; the previous loans have been very beneficial, allowing Mrs. Glinis and her family to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to replace roof

loans.name: Mode

texts.en:
Mode T., age 42, is married and resides with her children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She stays at home to look after her children and do household chores.

Her husband is a skillful blacksmith who earns a gross income of US $9 per day. By doing so, he is able to cover his family's expenses, especially the children’s education. He has been with this job since 1979. T. is requesting a loan of USD 200 to purchase more metal for her husband to expand his current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more metal to expand the business

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es:
Claudia  tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus abuelos, ubicada en el pueblo joven San Martin, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de un año se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos a través de catálogos, empezó el negocio debido a la necesidad de obtener ingresos económicos que le permitan solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia. Durante este tiempo ha venido trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y ha ido incrementando su nivel de ventas, actualmente ya tiene una cartera de clientes que siempre le piden productos.

Claudia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de productos a precios de oferta para posteriormente venderlos a mejores precios y así obtener mayores ganancias, por ese motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr sus objetivos

Claudia es una joven bastante empeñosa y trabajadora. Sus clientes prefieren acudir a ella debido a su responsabilidad y compromiso con las labores que realiza. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus abuelos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia is 21 years old, single, and lives with her grandparents in the town of San Martin, a suburb of the City of Chiclayo. For the past year she’s been selling cosmetics through catalogs. She started this business out of necessity for generating an income, which she needed for her personal expenses and to contribute to her family’s support. She’s been putting a lot of effort into her work, and has been improving her sales. She now has steady customers who request her products. Claudia would like to expand her business by buying items at sale prices and reselling them, thus increasing her income. In order to help her meet her objective, she has seen fit to request this first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa. Claudia is very persistent and hard working. Her customers prefer to deal with her because of her responsibility and commitment to her work. Her greatest desire is to provide a better quality of life for her grandparents.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Julia Lucila

texts.es:
Julia tiene 43 años de edad, se separó de su esposo hace 8 años y vive junto a su hija de 18 años de edad en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado a 5 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años tiene un negocio de venta de ropa en una zona aledaña al Mercado Modelo (el principal mercado de la ciudad de Chiclayo) llamada Galerías Rosadas, ella vende ropa tanto nueva como usada y trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana hasta muy avanzada la tarde.

Su negocio es la única fuente de ingreso que sostiene a su familia, por lo que ella trata de dar todo de sí para sacar su negocio adelante, gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido apoyar a su hija en sus estudios de enfermería, lo que la llena de orgullo.

Actualmente Julia desea implementar el negocio con nuevas prendas, sobretodo de la temporada otoño – invierno, ya que el verano terminará en las proximas semanas y ella desea tener la mercadería suficiente para responder a la demanda una vez cambiada la estación. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Su mas grande anhelo es seguir ampliando su negocio y convertirse en una comerciante mayorista. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva y se encuentra muy agradecida con la ayuda brindada, este es su segundo préstamo y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Julia is 43 years old and separated from her husband 8 years ago; she lives with her 18 year old daughter in the Jose Leonardo Ortiz district about 5 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 10 years, she has sold clothing in the region around the Mercado Modelo (the principal market in Chiclayo) called Galerias Rosadas. She sells new and used clothing and works from early in the morning to late in the evening. Her business is her only form of income to support her family which is why she gives her all to grow her business. Thanks to her business, she has been able to help her daughter in her nursing education; this makes her very proud. Currently Julia would like to supply the store with new clothing, more than anything fall and winter clothes since summer is coming to an end in the next few weeks. She would like to have enough inventory to fulfill the demand when the seasons change. This is why she is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for $175. Her dream is to continue growing her business and to become a wholesale merchant. She has worked with Kiva before and is very grateful for the support she has received; this is her 2nd loan and she has been punctual with her payments in the past.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to grow the business during the fall and winter

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
No. de Socio: 31527      		No. de Foto: 208

Sánchez A. Ezequiel tiene 70 años, es viudo, y  tiene diez hijos.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

El  socio es miembro de la ventanilla rural La Palmera es un recinto que se encuentra a una hora y media  del Cantón San Miguel.  Son 16 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y pocos a la Ganadera. 

Ezequiel trabaja en la agricultura,  para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen es el maíz,  además se dedica a la cría de animales chanchos, gallinas.  Vende los productos en el mercado de San Miguel en la Feria de los Jueves.

Le gusta criar animales, y cuando no trabaja le gusta caminar por los alrededores de la comunidad.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos para el trabajo del campo y sobre todo para fertilizantes y abonos.  Su meta es tener una buena actividad económica para la familia y para la compra de un carro para el trabajo.  Los desafíos que enfrenta son los problemas climáticos, las enfermedades que afectan a los cultivos.
texts.en:
Member Number: 31527 Photo Number: 208 Ezequiel Sánchez A., 70, is a widower; he has 10 children and lives in San Miguel canton, Bolívar province. He is a member of the La Palmera (The Palm Tree) communal bank which is an hour and a half from San Miguel canton; it has 16 members most of whom are farmers, a few raise cattle. Ezequiel works as a farmer to increase family income. His main crop is corn. He also raises pigs and chickens. He sells his products every Thursday at San Miguel’s farmer’s market. He enjoys raising animals and in his time off he enjoys walking around his community. He needs funding to buy farm supplies, mostly fertilizers and manure. His goal is to have successful sales for the family and to buy a car for work. The biggest challenge he faces is the weather and plant diseases.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and farm supplies.

loans.name: Know Yourself Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline T. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “Know Yourself Group”. She is 49 years old, is married, and has seven children who range from 18 to 32 years old. Jacqueline was only able to attend school through elementary school because of a lack of financial support.

For over fifteen years, Jacqueline has been selling dry goods like floor mats, rugs, and used clothing at the G. Town Market,  near Monrovia. She says that she talks to her customers in a friendly manner, which keeps them returning.

Jacqueline plans to use her 26,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 89,600 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry goods like floor mats, rugs, and used clothing.  Her dream is to grow her business and expand it to other parts of Monrovia.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jacqueline is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods like floor mats, rugs, and used clothing

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis M. is 43 years old and married with five children, ages 6 to 21 years of age.  He has been selling second hand clothes and bags in the Kawangware open air market.  He has been in this  business for twenty years. He has hired two people to assist him in his business.  Previously Francis took out a loan of Kes.20, 000 which he used to boost his business and has successfully repaid.  Francis is requesting a loan of Kes.40, 000 from Faulu Kenya.  He plans to buy bags and add to his stock of clothes.

loans.use: To buy bags and clothes

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 54 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Elena is involved in farming and earns through planting and harvesting rice for sale. She says that she experienced a lot of difficulties in her business but she is eager to move on and be successful someday. In 2008, Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be her fourth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Diego Boanerge

texts.es: Diego Boanerge tiene 55 años, su actividad es compra y venta de chatarra. Hace más de 5 años que tiene esta actividad pues anteriormente trabajaba en la alcaldía en donde se enfermo y decide con sus pocos ahorros comprar una camioneta e iniciara esta actividad, pues le ha sido muy útil ya que sus hijos 4 están a su cargo y que junto a su esposa los han sacado adelante proporcionándoles estudios. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de chatarra. Para el futuro quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
55-year old Diego Boanerge buys and sells scrap metal. He’s had this job for more than five years; he used to work for city hall, but he became ill so decided to use the small amount of money he had saved to buy a truck and start the scrap metal business. It’s done well, so he and his wife have managed to give their four children a good start in life and educate them too. The loan he is asking for is to buy scrap metal. In the future he wishes to increase his working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy scrap metal

loans.name: Edeliza

texts.en:
Edeliza D. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 26 years old, is single, and has two school-aged children. Edeliza owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling bamboo products like chairs, lantays (bamboo beds) and dividers to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Edeliza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. Edeliza plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea D. is from the village of Brgy. Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lea has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lea joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lea is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the fifth loan Lea has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the increased inventory to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more water to sell

loans.name: Violito

texts.en:
Violito H. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. He is 50 years old. Violito is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Violito owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Violito has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Violito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violito is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Violito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace dos años, pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo,  departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene estudios de secundaria completa.  Julia tiene un hijo de año y siete meses.
Ella trabaja junto a su esposo en la elaboración de antenas para televisión, las lleva a vender a La Paz - Bolivia, así mismo vende abarrotes en su tienda. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital en compra de abarrotes.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar su mercadería y una parte en comprar alambres para elaboración de antenas.
Su visión es comprar máquinas de coser para confeccionar ropas en La Paz - Bolivia. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son las reuniones y las conversaciones que se dan.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the community bank named Chojchoni for the past 2 years. She lives in the district of Copani located in the province of Yunguyo in Puno. She is 19 years old and she lives with her boyfriend. She graduated high school. Julia has a 19-month old son. She works together with her boyfriend, making antennas for television. She sells them in La Paz, Bolivia. She also sells groceries from her store. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles she purchased grocery store items for her store. She requests a new loan in the amount of 2500 neuvos soles and it will be used to increase her merchandise and to purchase wire to make antennas. Her dream is to purchase sewing machines to make clothing in La Paz. What she most likes about the community bank is the meetings and the talks that are given.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery store items and wire to make tv antennas.

loans.name: Simeo

texts.en:
Hard-working R. Simeo has been operating an agro produce sales business in Kyengando village, Ibanda for a period of over 20 years. With nostalgia, this happily married father of four children recalls how his business basked in high profit returns at its onset. Times have changed, however, as the business now is in diminishing returns earning him 200,000 Ugandan shillings in sharp contrast to the previous earnings due seasonal changes.

Simeo is no exception in terms of doing business. What he is looking forward to now is the prospect of enhancing his business by buying fertilizer and improving production of bananas and coffee which he grows the most of. Under the auspices of this loan, he will improve on business expansion and production through mulching the plantations. He hopes to improve his revenue and also make himself more able to meet his day-to-day family necessities.

loans.use: buying fertilizer and mulch

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna J. is a widow who lives in Purok Bulinaw, Brgy. Zone VI, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a pig-fattening business. Myrna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past sixteen loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Myrna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5200, improving her family's standard of living.  This time, for her seventeenth loan, she is borrowing PHP 17000, which she intends to use to buy more inventory to sell in her general store.  With the increased income, she will continue to save up for the future education of her child. Myrna J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou R. is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Binakalan outside of Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental province on the Mindanao islands. Marilou runs a specialized store from which she buys and sells coconut or copra to the local community. She has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. Marilou is requesting a new loan, her third from HSPFI, of 11,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Saba's Group

texts.en:
Saba lives in Chichwatni, a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives in a 2 room brick house with her parents. She is a widow and has no children. In order to financially support her father, she sells clothes. She buys clothes from different clothing shops in the market and sells to her neighboring clients.

Her father is an herbal medicine expert. He operates his business from his home. He has been doing this business over many years. He has a good experience of diagnosing diseases and giving the right herbal medicine to his patients. She has 2 brothers. The elder brother is involved in the cotton selling business and the younger one works in a private organization for a meager income. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder brother. He will invest the loan in purchasing cotton in bulk quantity that will cut his cost of purchasing and allow him to fulfill larger orders on time.  He has been doing this business for the past 6 years and has good experience in this field.  Saba is hopeful that this investment will definitely help him to further improve his business.

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her brother. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Saba.

loans.use: To buy cotton for reselling

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em S., 30, is married and lives with her husband in the province of Takeo. She is a farmer who works for less than one dollar a day. She has one little child. Her husband, pictured here, is a mechanic who fixes motorbikes. On average, he earns $3 per day to help support the family. Since farming is not stable, she would like to take out a loan of $300 to purchase a sewing machine to have a new job as a professional tailor.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Kang's Group

texts.en:
Eighteen members form this village loan; they live in Akreiy Ksatr village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kang S., who is 56 years old, was selected as the village bank president by the loan group members. Each member of this village will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Kang S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate citronella grass. She lacks enough money to cultivate it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy citronella seeds. The rest of the loan will be used to cultivate eggplant. Her husband, Mr. Chhay Leang, works as a construction worker and earns a small salary with which to support his family.

This couple has four children: two are employed in a casino club and the others are farmers.

loans.use: To buy citronella seeds for cultivating.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer J., 34, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Bonifacio J., a factory worker, and mother of two children, both of whom are already settled in elementary school. By the grace of God, Jennifer has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to send both of them all the way through college, a dream of most Filipino parents like Jennifer as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best legacy parents can leave their children.

Jennifer operates bicycle rental and flower shop businesses, earning at least Php4,000 per month from the rental of her bicycles and at least Php3,000 per month from her flower shop business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

To help continue operation of her businesses, she is requesting a Php18, 000 loan to buy more quantities of fresh flowers to fill advance orders by her customers and to buy new bicycle units for renting. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Jennifer dreams of giving both her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her businesses. She also hopes to have more patrons who will regularly buy her products. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of fresh flowers and additional bicycle units

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros T. was born in 1972 and is a marry woman. She and her family are living in Smaong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice to sell in order to support her family while her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Chhun, is a duck breeder who is able to earn some money from selling duck eggs at local market every day. So to increase her daily income, she wants to expand this business, but she has a little money. To improve this purpose, Mrs. Ros T. is applying for a loan to buy one ton of ducks, duck food, and vaccine duck. Through this activity, they support three children, one of whom is employed in garment factory, but the others are students.

loans.use: To buy one of ton of ducks, duck food, and vaccine duck

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley Kenya. He has been in the dairy business for two years now and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to the local market.

He has requested a loan of 25,000KES through Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  The extra income from this loan will enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. In future, he would like to buy land and plant more pasture and also improve the quality of his dairy cows. He faces the challenge of poor infrastructure and lack of enough animal feeds.

Charles is 21 years old and married with one child who is two years old now.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel S. is a 45-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: the buying and selling of Nipa (palm fronds woven into roof materials) and a general store business. She lives in Purok Bugnay, Barangay Vista Alegre, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her buying and selling of Nipa and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of $114. 

Jocel is now borrowing 29,500 PHP so that she can purchase more materials.  This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 29,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jocel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of oil.

loans.name: Aurora Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Aurora L. es maestra de primaria del colegio cerman ubicado en el Municipio de san Rafael del sur tiene dieciséis años de trabajar para esta institución, es casada  actualmente tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Aurora L. is a primary school teacher at the Cerman school located in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur. She has worked with this institution for sixteen years. She is married and she has two school-aged children. She has had three past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each one she has used to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, rocks, gravel, construction blocks etc. with the intent of expanding and improving her house. The loans that Ceprodel has granted her have been a great help because she has been able to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, rocks, gravel, and construction blocks

loans.name: Dossou

texts.fr: Monsieur a 50 ans et est marié.  IL a 4 enfants. Il habite quartier Attiegou. Pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, il exerce comme activité la blanchisserie. Il compte 16 ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Il achète ces outils de travail au grand marché de Lomé.  Il a employé une personne dans la boutique. Il sollicite un prêt pour acheter  un lave linge, un fer à repasser, des cintres et les produits anti-rouilles.
texts.en: This man is 50 years old and married. He has four children and lives in the Attiegou district. To be able to respond to his children's needs he has a laundry business, which he has been running for 16 years. He buys his working materials at the large market in Lomé. He employs one person in the shop. He is requesting a loan to buy a washing machine, an iron, hangers and anti-rust products.

loans.use: To purchase products for his work

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala N. is a 46-year-old lady, married to Sameer, age 52, and has 6 children. She is a committed volunteer at the handicap club helping the less privileged in their day-to-day challenges. 

Hala has worked in the nursing industry since 1988, so she decided to combine her nursing experience and skills along with her passion to help those with special needs to start a therapeutic center that includes physiotherapy, Chinese cupping, and other forms of therapeutic massage.

In order to make her dream come true, Hala continued studying and achieved many certificates in the field of physiotherapy and special needs therapies and has been practicing these therapies at home for four years now. Hala is also working at a beauty salon where she managed to establish a wide client base. 

Now Hala wants to take a loan in order to broaden her practice and open a therapeutic center of her own, equipped with the latest physiotherapy devices and therapeutic tools for her to help as many patients as possible.

loans.use: To open a therapeutic center of her own

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esmeralda tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar mercancía zapatos y ropa para bebes y niños también quiere  un carro que le esta haciendo falta a su negocio ya que vende en diferentes partes de la ciudad, y no tiene como andar moviendo su mercancía sin que se le dañe. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que su esposo el señor Ezequiel se encargara de los gastos de la casa y  de la escuela de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Esmeralda has been selling new and used clothing for over four years now.

She is requesting a loan because she does not have the necessary funds to buy infant and children's shoes and clothing.  She also wants to buy a car for her business since she has to travel to different parts of the city and has no means to do so without damaging her goods.

She plans to pay back the loan with the earnings from her business since her husband, Ezequiel, takes care of the household expenses and school costs for their two children.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and a car for her business

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela is 39 years old, married to an engineer, and has eight children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling bread. Manuela has taken a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Joshua Maina

texts.en:
Joshua is a 39-year-old, married man. He and his wife have two children. For the past nine years, he has farmed in Naivasha town to earn a living.

His friend introduced him to KADET LTD, and this is the third loan he has sought from the organization. Notably, he successfully repaid both of his previous loans, and he did so in a timely manner on both occasions. He plans to use the loan proceeds to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Joshua hopes to become a leading farmer in Naivasha.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 57, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Oscar, a driver, and is the mother to their 7 children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Evelyn earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 31,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evelyn hopes to be able to expand soon to increase her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a gari seller in Breman, a village near Elmina. She is currently living with her husband and three children. She responsibly helps her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy bags of gari to sell. She anticipates reinvesting the new profits back into her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of gari to sell.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio, tiene tres hijos de 20, 16 y 11 años de edad, él vive en familia y se dedica a la ganadería, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, la realiza desde hace 4 años, además de trabajar realizando viajes en su microbús escolar, trabaja todos los días iniciando muy temprano para ordeñar las vacas.
Por el momento el necesita comprar más ganado y también sembrar maíz, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra el gasto del ganado y los insumos agrícolas como abono y fertilizantes, esta compra es muy importante para Porfirio, pues aumenta el número de reces y aprovechara para cosechar maíz.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ofrecerles la oportunidad de estudio y una vida más confortable.
texts.en: Porfirio has three children, ages 20, 16 and 11, and has been working as a livestock farmer for four years, having learned the trade from his father.  He also drives a school microbus.  He works every day from very early in the morning milking his cows.  Currently he is in need of buying more livestock and planting corn, for which he has requested a loan to cover the cattle purchase and farm supplies such as fertilizer.  This purchase is important to Porfirio since it will increase the number of cattle and enable him to plant corn.  His goal is to work hard so his children can get ahead, have the opportunity to get an education and lead a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more livestock and fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар проживает в районе Шахринав. Она замужем. У неё трое детей. Санавбар имеет среднее образование. Более 12 лет она занимается продажей женских национальных платьев. Кредит берет для покупки тканей и увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Sanavbar lives in the region of Shahrinav. She is married and has three children. Sanavbar has secondary education. She has been selling traditional national women's dresses for more than twelve years. She is taking out the loan to buy fabrics and to increase the variety of her inventory.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
En el centro poblado menor de Kiteni, distrito de Quillabamba, provincia de La Convención, en el Cusco conocimos a la señora Luisa y nos cuenta: 

“Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 52 años edad, tengo cinco hijos y ahora vivo en la ciudad de Kiteni y donde desarrollo mis actividades económicas que son: venta de frutas y crianza de animales menores”. 

Luisa es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella escucho por unas amigas que hay una entidad financiera que presta microcréditos para invertir el dinero en el negocio y entonces sin más que pensar decidió participar del nuevo  banco comunal “Choclo de Oro de Kiteni”. 

La Asociación Arariwa decidió conformar el banco comunal porque confía en las personas y ella accede al préstamo para invertir en el negocio de crianza de pollos.
texts.en:
We met Mrs. Luisa in the town on Kiteni, Quillabamba district, province of La Convención, Cuzco, and she told us:

"I was born in the city of Quillabamba. I am 52 years old and have five children. Now I live in the city of Kiteni and this is where I work selling fruit and raising small animals".

Luisa is a hard-working and enterprising lady who works to help her family get ahead. She heard from some friends about a financial organization that provides micro-loans to invest in businesses and, without giving it another thought, she decided to join the Choclo de Oro de Kiteni (Ketini's Golden Corn) community bank. The Arariwa Association chose to form the community bank because it trusts the members. Luisa asked for a loan to invest in her business raising chickens.

loans.use: invest in her business to raise chickens

loans.name: Ana Margoth

texts.es: Ana Margoth D. 45 años D. edad, vive en casa familiar con su compañero D. vida y dos hijas. Ana se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora y entregada a su familia. DesD. hace muchos años que posee una pequeña tiendita en su hogar D. residencia y gracias a su dedicación y amabilidad en el mismo ha logrado mantenerlo activo y hasta el momento cuenta con mucha clientela gracias a su carisma y buena disposición a la hora D. atender a sus clientes. Su sueño es surtir su tienda  para cubrir una mayor demanda que le generen un aumento en sus ventas que le lleven a mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia. Ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito para invertir en su tienda en la compra D. los principales artículos como: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, detergente, pan dulce, y muchos productos más que ayuden a atraer a más clientes que le permitan lograr su sueño.
texts.en:
Ana Margoth, age 45, lives in the family house with her life partner and her two daughters.  Ana is characterized as being a tenacious woman who is devoted to her family.

She has had a small store in her house for many years.  Thanks to her dedication and affability she has managed to keep the store active.  So far she has a lot of customers thanks to her charisma and willingness to tend to her customers.

Her dream is to stock her store in order to cover a greater demand that will be created by an increase in sales.  This will lead to a better quality of life for her and for her family.

She decided to request this loan in order to invest in her store by purchasing basic items such as sugar, rice, beans, oil, sweets, detergent, sweet rolls, and many more products that help attract more customers.  This will allow her to fulfill her dream.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil, sweets, detergent, and sweet rolls, etc.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
La Señora Felicita tiene 40 años, está casada con Don Carlos hace mas D. 20 años, el cual trabaja como chofer D. una linea D. transporte hace 18 años, tienen dos hijos, el mayor es Juan D. 17 años y Juan Ramón D. 15 años.
La misma es comerciante hace mas D. 4 años, tiene una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio. Dice que tiene buena clientela ya que ella misma atienD. su negocio y le trata bien a la gente. Es muy conocida en el barrio y en las zonas aledañas. Además comenta que su marido la ayuda en su tiempo libre a atender en la despensa. Sueña, con poder agrandar su negocio, ya que D. esa forma podrá atraer a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. lactes, bebidas, panificados, carnes y demás para el abastecimiento D. su negocio. Está muy esperanzada con el crédito, ya que D. obtenerlo le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Señora Felicita is 40 years old.  She has been married to Don Carlos for more than 20 years.  He has been working as a driver for a transportation company for 18 years.  They have two sons; the older is Juan, aged 17, and Juan Ramón is 15.

This same woman has been a retailer for more than four years; she has a well-stocked storeroom in her home.  She says that she has a good customer base whom she serves in her business, and she treats people well.  She is very well known in her neighborhood and in the neighboring areas.  She also comments that in her husband's free time, he helps her with the storeroom.  She dreams about expanding her business, as in this way she will be able attract more customers.

She is requesting the loan to buy diary products, drinks, bakery items, meat and other things for stocking her business.  She is very hopeful about the loan, as obtaining it is going to be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products and other items for stocking her storeroom.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Viviana de 29 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 9 años respectivamente en el municipio de Soledad, donde tiene una miscelánea y vende artículos para el hogar, accesorios femeninos, útiles de papelería etc. Antes de tener este negocio había ya iniciado con el servicio de telefonía celular y la venta de mercancía variada mediante guías especializadas y desde hace 1 años con dinero de su esposo compró tres vitrinas y la surtió convirtiendo su negocio en un punto comercial donde exhibe calzado, artículos de papelería accesorios etc. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y tiene una cartera de clientes rentables que le pagan semanal, quincenal y mensualmente de acuerdo a lo que con ellos haya planeado. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará 1 vitrina que surtirá con mercancía que no ha podido organizar, con ello planea aumentar su cartera de cuentas por cobrar a corto plazo y comprar mercancías en descuentos que trasladaría a ellos para impactarlos. Mientras esto ocurre maneja un margen de contribución de 29% y desde allí se proyecta su potencial crecimiento.
texts.en: Viviana is 29 years old and she lives with her spouse and two children, aged 7 and 9, in the city of Soledad. she has a variety store there and sells various household items, women's accessories and paper products, etc. Before having this business, she had already started a cell phone service business and sold various merchandise via specialized catalogs. A year ago, with money from her husband, she bought three display cases and she converted her business into a retail space where she shows displays shoes, paper products, etc. she charges upfront and has some customers who make monthly payments according to a payment plan. Her Kiva loan is the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy a display case that she will fill with merchandise that she hasn't been able to organize. With it, she plans on increasing her short term accounts payable and on buying discounted merchandise that she will pass on to the customer. While this is going on, she has a contribution margin of 29% and she plans on projecting her potential growth fro there.

loans.use: to buy a display case to show merchandise that she will also buy.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua lives in Jukwa in Ghana’s central region. She is divorced and has two children. After completing junior high school Akosua became a seamstress; which she has been doing for seven years. Akosua uses her income to support her family. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchse sewing materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en:
Immaculate's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Immaculate is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells snacks and cooking ingredients. 

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, and will help Immaculate to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Immaculate hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Immaculate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Immaculate's future prospects by helping her to improve her business knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for large bags of sugar

loans.name: Felix Angel

texts.es:
Félix de 49 años, un hombre trabajador  que ha sabido salir adelante con sus hijos y con aspiraciones de crecimiento en su negocio.

Su negocio es una pequeña tienda ubicada en la parte delantera  de su vivienda.

Su negocio inicia desde las 6am hasta las 22pm. Su dificultad es la delincuencia de su sector.

El solicita este préstamo para expandir su negocio e invertir para la compra de víveres como: arroz, aceite, pollos, etc.

Su sueño es expandir su negocio a otras partes de Guayaquil, en donde pueda dar empleos.
texts.en: Félix, 49, is a hardworking man who has known how to get ahead with his children and with hopes for his business’ growth.  His business is a small store located in the front part of his house.  The store is open from 6am until 10pm.  His problem is the crime in his neighborhood.  He asks for the loan to expand the business investing in the purchase of foodstuffs like rice, oil, chickens, etc.  His dream is to expand the business into other parts of Guayaquil where he can provide jobs.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and chickens.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: La Sra. Lourdes tiene  3 hijos  que se encuentran estudiando es divorciada, cuenta la señora que la separación fue difícil para ella pero pudo salir adelante por el bienestar de su hijos, ella sola mantiene a su hijos y corre con todos los gastos de hogar, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa pero también es maestra  medio día,  y la venta de ropa la realiza todos los días, el préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de mercadería  por cambio de temporada, la Sra.  Lourdes trabaja mucho por el bienestar de sus hijos su deseo es el poder verlos profesionales y personas de bien, se encuentra agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Lourdes has three children that are currently in school and she is divorced. She says that the separation was difficult for her but that she was able to move forward for the good of her children. She alone provides for her children and pays for all the household expenses. She makes a living selling clothing every day but also is a teacher half of the day. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for the change in the season. Lourdes works a great deal for the good of her children and her hope is to be able to see them become professionals and good people. She is thankful for the institution and for the support they have given.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Urunzhon

texts.ru: Урунжон любящая жена и в воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Она любит свою семью и хочет помогать мужу на содержании семьи, и с этой целью открыла свой бизнес. Более 4 года она занимается купля продажей продукты питания. У неё в магазине не большой ассортимент продуктов и она хочет, добавит широкий ассортимент продуктов в своем магазине, чтобы клиенты могли найти свои нужные продукты. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 2500 Сомони. Она заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Urunzhon is a loving woman, and is raising one child. She loves her husband and her child and wants to help with financial support for the family. With this goal in mind, she opened her business. For more than four years, she has run a grocery store. Presently, her store does not have a very wide selection of products, so she would like to present a wider range of products to her customers, enabling them to find the products they need. For this purpose, she is seeking a loan of 2,500 TJS. She is grateful for your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for retail

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario tiene 35 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Nueva Esperanza que pertenece al municipio de Concepcion Sur. Mario se casó muy joven (a los 15 años) y lleva 20 años de casado con su esposa Maria. La pareja tiene 4 hijos de 5, 10, 12 y 15 años. 

Don Mario tiene una pulpería donde vende granos básicos como arroz y frijol, y otros productos de la canasta básica como carne, huevos, leche y sal. También vende productos como papel higiénico, pañales, medicamentos, productos de limpieza, champú y pasta de diente, jugos y golosinas. Mario trabaja todo el día en la pulpería como es el único fuente de ingreso de su familia. 

La pulpería fue idea de su esposa. Siguiendo los consejos de ella, don Mario se puso la pulpería. La empezó con capital propio y con un crédito que solicitó en ODEF. Notó un aumento en la venta y en sus ganancias después de haber sacado el crédito. Con el crédito actual de L20,000, don Mario comprará productos para aumentar su inventario y un molino para moler maíz. Espera incrementar su venta para poder vivir mejor y poder sacar adelante sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Mario, age 35, lives in the village of Nueva Esperanza in the Concepción Sur municipality.  Mario married very young (15 years old), and he has been married to his wife, Maria, for 20 years.  The couple has four children; ages 5, 10, 12, and 15.

Mario has a grocery store where he sells basic grains like rice and beans, and other staple products like meat, eggs, milk, and salt.  He also sells products like toilet paper, diapers, medication, cleaning products, shampoo, toothpaste, juice, and sweets.  Mario works all day in the grocery store as it is the only source of income for his family.

The grocery store was his wife’s idea.  Following her advice, Mario established the grocery store.  He started it with his own capital and with a loan that he requested from ODEF.  He noticed an increase in sales and in his earnings after having taken out the loan.

Mario will use the current loan for 20,000 lempiras to buy products to increase his inventory.  He will also buy a mill to grind corn.  He hopes to increase his sales to be able to live better and to be able to get his children ahead with their education.

loans.use: to buy a mill and inventory.

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Fiordaliza is one of the members in the group called Fuente para el desarrollo 2 & 3 (source for the development). She lives in the beautiful town of Samana with her long term partner and their two children. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

Fiordaliza is receiving her 7th loan with Esperanza Internacional. She started having Esperanza loans and became a member of this group around 4 years ago when she was started doing some business to help her family's income. She is selling cosmetics from a popular brand and who sells their products through their catalog. Fiordaliza will use this loan to buy parfum, make up, body and hands lotion and wash, and also some other products you can find in the catalog that are in high demand so she can increase her inventory. 

She intends to use her business profits to reinvest in her business and to buy different things they (herself and her family) need like clothing, shoes, and to improve her home. Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products from a catalog.

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi is a 21-year-old woman living in the town of Asau.  She is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Emi owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting taro for sale. Emi has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Emi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emi is requesting a loan for the first time from SPBD. The loan of 1,000 WST will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. Emi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.en:
Benedicto is 39 years old and is married to Flordeliza. Benedicto is a farmer in the Philippines, and he plants and harvests rice to sell. His business has been very helpful for him and his family. His income from the business provides their food. 

Benedicto has experience in this field for almost 15 years. His income depends on the weather, but he states that most of his income comes from his crops, earning up to P45,000 per season. He has no other source of income. As a result, he is requesting a loan of  P25,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his rice production.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizer and insecticide for his rice production

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children.
 
Agustin has a shop where he sells corn grains & a variety of vegetables. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy corn grains & vegetables to sell.

Agustin has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Agustin hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy corn grains & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Mr. Yong, 27, is a single man who lives with his older sister in the Dongkor commune, Phnom Penh. These two relatives have different careers: Yong works in a garment factory as a mechanic and gets his pay monthly, while his older sister is a seamstress near a local market.
To get to his workplace, Yong takes public transportation and pays monthly. It costs him dearly. Yong wants to reduce his expense on transportation fees, which will allow him to improve his standard of living. Consequently, Yong would like to ask for some funds from HKL, a Kiva partner, to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for commuting to his workplace. Yong hopes that this loan will be granted to him to better his situation and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.en:
Emiliano is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Emiliano has a shop that sells herbal medicines and therapeutic products. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of herbal products to sell.

Emiliano has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emiliano hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of herbal products to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura lives on a farm outside of Kakamega town, in Kakamega county. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Laura is married, and has three children. Her husband works as a watchman, while she runs a small business. When not busy with their jobs, both her and her husband farm their land. They have been farming for twenty years, and are currently growing maize and beans as well as rearing a cow. This is Laura’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income from her hives to expand her small business. In the future, she hopes to “be a successful farmer and business lady.”

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Melisa Xiomara

texts.es:
Melisa, vive con dos hijos de 6 y 2 años de edad, uno de ellos ya inició sus estudios, su esposo vive en otro domicilio pera es responsable y le ayuda económicamente para los gastos familiares, Melisa por su parte se dedica a vender panes con pollo, refrescos naturales y otras bebidas enlatada desde hace 5 años, su negocio nació a consecuencia de la necesidad de generar más ingresos para lograr disminuir las carencias familiares, lo atiene de lunes a sábado de ocho de la mañana a tres de la tarde.
Con el capital podrá comprar pan, verduras, pollo, aderezos, aceite, frutas, azúcar, bolsas, etc., así tendrá los materiales necesarios para preparar la venta de panes con pollo y refrescos, la finalidad de la inversión es aprovechar las fechas importantes de  lo que queda del año como lo son graduaciones escolares, fiestas de fin de año y otras, ya que por su experiencia sabe que los clientes demandan mucho sus productos en esta temporada.
Sus sueños son tener un negocio estable, sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar en la universidad, pues ella desea verlos como profesionales, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.

loans.use: comprar pan, verduras, pollo, aderezos, aceite, frutas, azúcar, bolsas, etc., así tendrá los materiales necesarios para preparar la venta de panes con pollo y refrescos

loans.name: Nedko

texts.en: Nedko G. is a musician but he and his wife Vildana were unemployed for a very long time. So they decided to open a small grocery in Smolian and to start own business. As the time goes by Nedko starts to supply mostly meat and meat products and the grocery becomes a butcher\'s shop. Now he is one of the most popular butchers in the town and has lots of customers because his meat is always fresh and delicious. Soon he starts to make deliveries to his most attractive clients. Now his two sons work in the family business too. Nedko Garberski and his family need to buy a new professional meat freezer for  their butcher\'s shop. The loan amount is $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a new professional meat freezer

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria distributes rice to stores and markets. She started her business with the help of her husband who gave her $200 in start-up capital so she could have her own business. At the beginning she only sold rice retail but now sells it wholesale. María wants to sell other basic foods such as sugar, oil, and beans. She will use the loan to purchase the products at wholesale prices to make a bigger profit.

Maria is married and has one son. She is 37 years old and depends on her business to support her family and save money for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Þór Vilhjálmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria se dedica a la distribución de arroz en tiendas y mercados. Maria empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su esposo quien le facilito 200 dólares para que emprendiera su propio negocio. Al principio solo vendía arroz por menor. Ahora ofrece este producto al por mayor. Maria aspira vender víveres de primera necesidad como azúcar, aceite y fréjol. Ella usara el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería al por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias. Maria esta casada tiene un hijo. Ella tiene 37 años, depende de su negocio para apoyar a su familia y ahorrar para el futuro.

loans.use: Purchase products wholesale

loans.name: Maseiga

texts.en: Maseiga is married with four children.  She lives very far from town.  In order to support her family, she weaves mats in the traditional Samoan way.  At one time all Samoan women knew how to weave both the mats used daily in Samoan households as well as the fine mats used on special occasions, such as weddings and funerals and village ceremonies.  Now Maseiga is in the minority.  But she is committed to using her weaving talents to support her family.  She focuses on making the fine mats.  These mats can command high prices because they are very intricate and labor intensive.  It can take up to two or three months to weave just one fine mat.

loans.use: Purchase paints for decorating the mats

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en: Zamina is forty-three years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is shown in the photo in place of her. Zamina and her husband have their own shop, where they produce boxes made from boards. They have been in this business for four years. These boxes are used for keeping agricultural produce. Zamina would like a loan of $600 to purchase boards for making the boxes.

loans.use: to buy board

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish for her fish shop.

loans.name: Adellah

texts.en:
Adellah own a ladies salon. She is single and has one child who is 2 years old. She is very hard working in business. She is asking for a loan of USD 275 to buy new machines for the salon. She is proposing to repay loan in 12 months. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipments from the said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: Buying chairs and steamer

loans.name: Faalua

texts.en: Faalua is the secretary of Solaua Center. She is 28 years old and runs a plantation and an ice cake business. She sells her ice cakes (popsicles in a bag) for fifty sene (20 cents) each at a Primary School Compound, and her plantation produce to the Fugalei Market. She has three children, and they are all young and dependent on her. Faalua's husband works as a carpenter, earning additional income for the family. Faalua is hard-working, reliable and supportive, and needs to borrow money to buy plastic bags and a second-hand refrigerator to improve her ice cake business.

loans.use: Purchase of plastic bags, and a second-hand refrigerator for her ice cake business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok S., 35, is married with two children. He works as a motor-taxi driver and is employed part-time as a security guard earning on average around $4 each day in revenue. His wife is lately employed by a garment factory earning typically about $3.20 per day. To raise his income, Mr. Sok S. would like to build rental rooms partly onto his house, to rent to the people in his area, but he is faced with a financial constraint. To build the rental rooms, he has applied for a loan amount of $1000 from Credit MFI.

loans.use: To build rental rooms partly onto his house to rent to the people in his area.

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en: Bisi D. is married with one child. She is 22-years-old and lives in the Mushin area of Lagos State. She sells plywood and is requesting a loan amount of $450 to acquire additional inventory for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional plywood for resale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
“I have tried to make improvements to my home but in reality the economic situation is very difficult. I would like to put in a concrete floor on the patio of my home so that there isn’t as much dirt and also I need to construct a security wall. The houses are very close together and are separated only by a wall so it is very easy that someone enters the home to rob it.” I am asking for $650 to put a concrete floor on the patio of my home and construct a security wall.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.
