“He tratado de hacerle mejoras a mi vivienda pero en realidad la situación económica esta muy difícil, me gustaría poner piso de concreto en el patio de mi vivienda para evitar que haya tanta tierra y también necesito construir una barda, las casas están muy pegadas ya que solo nos separa una pared y es más fácil que alguien se meta a robar”. Solicito $ 650.00 dlls para poner piso de concreto en el patio de mi casa y levantar una barda.

loans.use: Put in a floor and construct a security wall

loans.name: Kijoli's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en: Kijoli is 23 years old and is married with one child, age 3 years old. She and her husband also take care of one other person, age 30 years old. Kijoli is a fish seller through a business she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan of $275 to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Magreth, who has business dealing in charcoal and firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Ram Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Ram Devi M., 33 years old, lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, Nepal. Thecho is one of the beautiful, underdeveloped villages of Nepal. Most of the people of this region are poor and depend on agriculture to make a living.

Mrs. M. has two children, a daughter and a son. Her daughter took her SLC (School Leaving Certificate) exam recently, and her son is in grade 7. Her husband, Mr. Krishna Bhakta M., works in an office.

Mrs. M. opened a grocery shop four years ago She sells different types of grocery items such as rice, maize, pulses, biscuits, and noodles in her shop. Her children also help her in her work. The demand for grocery goods is increasing in that area so she is requesting a loan of NPR 30,000 to buy grocery items to meet the demand.

She spends the major part of her income to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop

loans.name: Gafur

texts.ru:
Gafur R. is 22 years old, he is married and has one young daughter. He has a specialized high school education and for 3 years he has been helping his mother to bring products for sale from Bishkek. He and his mother sell men’s shoes. He currently has a lot of out of season inventory – fall and winter shoes – which is why he has turned to MicroInvest for a loan. He will use the loan to purchase summer products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Рустамов Гафур парень в возросте 22 года женат имеет одну маленькую дочку. Образование средне специальное, уже 3 года как помогает маме по доставке товара с Бишкека.Он с матерью торгуют мужской обувью. На данный момент у него осталось много не сезонного товара, осене- зимней обуви , поэтому для завоза летнего ассортимента он обратился за кредитом в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Purchase summer inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana R., married with one daughter, sells women's clothing in the central market in Kherson. She has invested $8000 in her business over the past four years. Tatyana has the unique ability to understand people and build relationships with her customers, a wonderful quality to have since her business is located in a very busy place.

Tatyana dreams of building a career to gain economic independence and is therefore requesting a seasonal loan of $675 to increase her range of merchandise. She plans to repay this loan in two months, and has been very prompt with all previous loan payments. Tatyana's discipline and diligence will be helpful as she plans to use additional profits to invest in other ventures in the future.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Ms. Fatoumata S. is 45 years old and lives with her four children, husband, and her co-spouse in a polygamous family in the village of Sanankoroba in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou (Kati Prefecture, region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali).

She has had an association with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso for five years. After having completed four group loans with an association in her district, she is on her fourth individual loan, all repaid correctly. She intends use this loan to buy 60 Wax pagnes (highly prized cloth in West Africa) of different grades in the grand marketplace of Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers of the specialty area.

She sells her goods retail, cash accepted, and by credit payable monthly for salaried workers. These sales are made locally in Sanankoroba at fixed locations, and door-to-door, and also from displays at the marketplace on market days. Her customers are essentially composed of retailers and women. She intends to realize a profit of 45,000 francs CFA per month that will be used to cover the loan interest and family expenses and to invest the rest in business. In the future, Ms. Fatoumata S. intends to open a shop selling pagnes, specifically Wax pagnes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Fatoumata S. est âgée de 45 ans et vit avec ses 4 enfants, son mari et sa coépouse dans une famille polygame dans le village de Sanankoroba dans la sous préfecture de Ouelessebougou (Préfecture de Kati Région de Koulikoro République du Mali).

Elle est en relation avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis 5 ans. Après avoir bouclé 4 prêts de groupe avec une association de son quartier elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel et tous correctement remboursés. Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 60 pagnes wax (tissu très prisé en Afrique de l’Ouest) de différentes qualités au grand marché de Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) auprès des grossistes du domaine.

Elle vend ses produits en détail au comptant et à crédit payable mensuellement aux salariés sur place à Sanankoroba de façon fixe, ambulante et sur des étales au marché les jours de foire. Sa clientèle est essentiellement composée de revendeurs et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000F CFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans les affaires. Madame Fatoumata S. compte dans le futur ouvrir une boutique de vente de pagnes spécifiquement les pagnes wax.

loans.use: To buy Wax pagnes

loans.name: Assa Komuntale's Group

texts.en:
Assa is the leader of this four-member group. She is 40 years old and married with three children between the ages 22 and 17. Two of her children go to school and the eldest is working. She lives in her own five-room house in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala, where she also works. Her house has electricity and piped water and the family gets three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees, and medication.

Assa works six days a week and rents her working place. She sells crafts (wholesale and retail) to all categories of people. She sells to an average of eight people a day. She uses public transport to buy her items from Kampala city centre. She's been in this business for the last three years. She first had a retail shop but due to competition and demand for crafts in the area, she changed the business.

Assa has been with MCDT for six years and is servicing her thirteenth loan, working all along with her same group mates. Her major challenges are fluctuation of prices, high transport costs, and seasonality. Assa aspires to see her business grow bigger and to open another branch in Wandegeya, one the city suburbs. She will use this loan to increase stock in her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of crafts.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese F., 54, is married and has seven children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells her produce in the village three days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208 USD). SPBD loans are Akenese's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase items for her plantation (chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axe, and so forth) and to pay for her children's school fees. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the plantation and to pay school fees

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mr. S. Bun, 39, and his wife, Mrs. Saven Doung, 40,  live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have four children; three sons and one daughter. Three of their children study in the local school and help their parents to grow banana trees and flowers when they have free time from school. The youngest son is still young and stays at home. 

Mr. Bun S. and his wife have been selling bananas for over ten years. They buy them from farmers in their village and from nearby villagers, and resell them at a market in Phnom Penh. Beside growing bananas, they also grow flowers. 

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.use: To purchase bananas for resale

loans.name: Anzhella

texts.en:
Anzhella is married and has two sons. She sells underwear and socks in two city markets - Privos and Lyaseevskaya. Her competitive advantages are good quality and good location of her business place. Being honest and respectful helps her to attract even more customers.

Anzhella has been in this business for many years. She decided to get involved in this business because she knows this particular kind of goods well and the business space she is appropriate for this kind of goods. Her gross income is 3000 UAH, working capital is 3600 UAH. She buys her goods often and sells a lot. The income helps to pay her bills and to raise her two sons. Her oldest son, who is 18 years old, helps in the business.

Anzhella would like to get 1,500 UAH to purchase more socks. This will allow her to offer better variety of warm winter socks and help generate more income for her family. Anzhella is sure that offering good products and showing respect toward her customers can make her business a success.

loans.use: to purchase more socks

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is 26 years old. She is married with no children. She owns a small business at the central market in Khoost city. She sells women's clothing in her small kiosk, and her income is 4,500 UAH (1 UAH =~0.124 USD)per month.

Ludmila has been in this business for 2 years only. She has worked hard to have enough goods to offer her clients for each season. Ludmila would like to get a loan to increase her inventory. She knows that good client service and a good assortment of clothing are key to her business growth.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Chheam

texts.en: Chheam S., 37, lives in Kandal Province in Cambodia. He currently works for a rubber factory. He gets a salary of $90 per month. He is married to Pen Sreymong, 32, who is a good mother of two children; both of them are teenagers and go to school. She is employed as a worker for fish raising and gets a salary of $75 a month. Mr. S. and his wife hope to have a suitable investment out of their home. Therefore, they both are applying for a loan as capital to purchase piglets to raise. The loan will help them to earn additional income to sustain their family's food sufficiently.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Araujos João Da Costa

texts.pt:
Araujos João da Costa M. é natural de Boane um dos distritos da província do Maputo, tem 35 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos, com idade entre 13; 9; 5 e 2 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta a sua família e vive numa casa própria.

Araujos estudou até 12ªclasse do ensino técnico profissional como docente, desde a sua infância esta a viver neste distrito de Boane apenas saiu durante 4 anos quando foi a formação. Em 1996 casou se casamento que resultou nos 4 filhos. Desde 1989 trabalha como docente e trabalha das 8h as 14h. com um salário mensal de 6400,00mt.

Para Araujos este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, assim também pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Araujos João da Costa M. is from Boane, one of the provinces of the district of Maputo. He is 35 years old, married and the father of 4 children aged 13, 9, 5 and 2. His only dependents are his family and he lives in his own house.

Araujos was in school until the 12th grade and is a professional teacher. He has lived in this district of Boane since his childhood, leaving only for 4 years whilst on training. In 1996 he got married and his marriage resulted in 4 children. Since 1989 he has been working as a teacher and works from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm with a monthly salary of 64000,00 MZN.

This is Araujos’ third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He also intends to pay the loan off before it is due in order to solicit another one to furnish his house.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. started selling fish five years ago in Kato, a suburb of Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region where she lives. Mary prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She is now 48 years old, divorced, and the mother of one child who is currently a senior in high school. Mary is requesting a loan to increase her stock of assorted fish which will increase sales and income. The additional income will be used to support her child's education and to grow the business. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Awurade Yekese’ which means ‘God is Big’.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Mariée, mère de 5 enfants Madame Maimouna Traoré a 35 ans et vit dans une famille  polygame  dans le quartier Kouloukoro de la préfecture  de koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ).
 Pour  des raisons sociales, elle n’a pas eu la chance de faire de longues études, comme alternative à cela elle s’intéressa très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus qu’elle a apprises auprès de ses parents. Son activité est centrée  autour  de l’achat  des déchets d’huile pour la fabrication du savon  traditionnel. Elle est très réputée pour cette activité à Koutiala et reçoit beaucoup de commandes.
Pour  l’élargissement de son activité et la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle Maimouna décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis  5 ans.  Après  5 prêts de groupe (prêt  solidaire) tous remboursés correctement, elle est à son premier prêt  individuel.  
Ce prêt servira à acheter,  5 barils de déchets d’huile à l’usine FAMAB  de Koutiala pour  sa fabrique de savons traditionnels chez elle même à kouloukoro. Après la fabrication, elle effectue sa vente à une clientèle essentiellement féminines, au comptant en détail et à crédit. 
Madame Maimouna compte avoir un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qu’elle  envisage  utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
Dans l’avenir, son ambition  est  d’ouvrir un magasin de stockage des déchets d’huiles et agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 5 children, Mrs. Maimouna Traoré, 35, lives in a polygamous family in the Kouloukoro neighborhood of the prefecture of Koutiala (Sikasso Region).

For societal reasons, she did not have a chance to stay at school for a long time, and as an alternative to schooling, she very soon became interested in income-generating activities that she learned by working with her parents. Her work has centered around buying the waste material left over from producing vegetable oil, to be used in making traditional soap. She has a good reputation for this business and receives a lot of orders.

In order to expand her business and satisfy her clientele appropriately, Maimouna decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 5 group loans (solidarity loans), all correctly reimbursed, she is on her first individual loan.

This loan will be used to buy 5 barrels of vegetable oil waste at the FAMAB factory in Koutiala, intended for making traditional soap at her home in Kouloukoro. Once the soap is made, she retails it to a clientele essentially made up of women, for cash or on credit.

Maimouna expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 F CFA which she intends to use to reimburse the interest on the loan and to contribute to improving living conditions for her family, investing any remainder back into her business.

In the future, her ambition is to open a storage facility for vegetable oil waste and to expand her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of oil waste used in making traditional soap

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Luis L. se dedica a su actividad de venta de elaboración y venta de calzados de todo tipo teniendo su taller de calzados en su casa de habitación en Masaya.

Actualmente el señor Luis posee cinco máquinas de trabajar y esto lo ha adquirido gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos que lo han llevado a ser una persona destacada ya que elabora calzados muy finos. La razón por la cual él espera en Ceprodel es para que se le apruebe un crédito para la compra de materiales de trabajo como el cuero para continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión para continuar.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis L. makes and sells all types of footwear. His footwear shop is in his house in Masaya. Luis has five machines for work. He acquired these through his great effort, which has led him to be an outstanding maker of fine footwear. He is hoping for approval for a loan from Ceprodel. He will buy work materials like leather to continue with his business, which really needs the investment in order to continue.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy work material

loans.name: Medonne

texts.fr: Monsieur Medonne N. sollicite un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC et Kiva pour acheter une armoire.  Il travaille comme chauffeur de taxi à Thiès, une ville située à 70 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Il y a pleine de taxis à Thiès, et en général chaque client paye 500CFA ($1.00).  Il a déjà reçu un crédit de l’IMCEC qu’il a remboursé un peu en retard, mais le comité de l’IMCEC a décidé qu’il a une bonne moralité et la capacité de rembourser ce crédit.  Monseur N. et marié et âgé de 38 ans.
texts.en:
Mr. Medonne N. is requesting a loan from IMCEC and Kiva to buy an armoire. He works as a taxi driver in Thiès, a city located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. There are plenty of taxis in Thiès, and in general, each customer pays 500 francs CFA. He has had an IMCEC loan before and has repaid it a bit late. But the IMCEC committee decided he is a man of good character who has the capacity to repay this loan. Mr. N. is married and is 38 years old.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an armoire

loans.name: Las Intachables Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Las Intachables" esta representado por L. señora Victoria y presenta un parentesco familiar entre  L. señora Roxana Julieta y su hermana L. señora Amalia ambas se dedican al comercio de diferentes productos por lo que tienen ingresos independientes una de L. otra. L. F. de ingresos de una de L. mayoría de las socias es L. venta de productos como ropa interior, comida y refrescos en lugares turísticos como en el rió Pirai, otras son promotoras de cosméticos y de ropa de cama. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe L. competencia de L. oferta y L. demanda pero las socias cuentan con buenos productos y ya son conocidas en sus puestos de venta. Este crédito esta destinado al mejoramiento de sus puestos de trabajo, a L. compra de materiales e insumos para diversificar sus productos y mejorar sus ventas para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. Alguna de las socias cuenta con experiencia en grupos solidarios  pero para una mayoría es una nueva modalidad de adquirir un financiamiento pero conocen como cada una trabaja por lo que no será difícil cumplir con responsabilidad y honestidad con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The members of the Las Intachables (The Impeccables) Communal Bank are represented by Señora Victoria. There is a family connection between Señora Roxana Julieta and her daughter, Señora Amalia. They are both engaged in selling different products but each of their incomes is independent from the other. The source of income for most of the members is the sale of products such as underwear, meals and refreshments in tourist areas such as Río Piraí. Others are distributors of cosmetics and sleepwear. Because in every commercial situation there is supply and demand, the members are providing good products and they are well known at their stands in the market. This loan is intended for the improvement of work places, and the purchase of materials and ingredients so as to diversify their products and increase their sales and thus provide their families with a better quality of life. Some of the members have experience in solidarity groups but for most it is a new method of obtaining a loan. But they know that with everyone working together it will not be difficult to fulfill their obligations with responsibility and honesty.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: For the past eighteen years, Yusuf has worked in agriculture, raising animals. He raises cattle which he cares for greatly since, thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses. Yusuf showed us his animals with great happiness as his cattle were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock. For Yusuf, it is very important to work raising his animals which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle so that in future he can earn more money. It will help his family to generate additional income. We appreciate your support for Yusuf’s projects. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua A. is 48 years old, divorced and has five children, three sons and two daughters. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in Ghana's Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. For the past year, Akua has made a living as a trader, selling cereals and maize to retailers and food vendors. She is applying for this loan to buy bags of maize in bulk from nearby communities. Her main goals are to expand her business and give each of her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Муборак женщина 56 лет. Замужем и имеет 5-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Муборак откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Муборак продает их на скотном рынке. Муборак кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она успешно закончила два предыдущих займов, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Муборак планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Муборак очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Muborak is a 56-year-old woman. She is married and has 5 children. Together with her husband, she is involved in feeding and selling livestock. Muborak feeds the livestock at home, and once the livestock is ready, Muborak’s husband sells it at the livestock market. Muborak has been our client for 1 year. She successfully repaid two previous loans and now wants to obtain the next one. Muborak plans to increase the quantity of her livestock and, thus, increase her family profit. Muborak likes our financing terms very much, and she is glad that such organizations that support the public exist.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. sells cosmetics at Atabadze near Elmina. She has received a junior high school education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. Mary has been selling cosmetics since 2000. She is responsible for helping her husband pay the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga Mis. Occ.. She is 41 years old. Victoria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products  in the local community. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900.00 PHP from PMPC. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Victoria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Mrs. Horn C. was born in 1970 and she now lives in the village of Rokar in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Sun Vichet, is a fisherman. Now Mrs. Horn C. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and some nets for fishing. She hopes to increase income and improve the family's lives with this loan. She has four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband and children are shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and some fishing nets.

loans.name: Benita Obex

texts.es:
La sra. Benita Obex G. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 24 años cuenta con una buena clientela como sus vecinos y transeuntes de la zona, también entrega por encargo para fiestas, restaurantes etc.
ella invierte en la compra de harina de maseca $1,377.00 y vende $2040 obteniendo una utilidad de $663.00. 
De esta forma  a podido construir el 75% de su vivienda, en este momento solicita el credito para poder terminarla ya que le hacen falta las puertas, ventanas y un porton de metal, vive con su esposo y su hija, parte de los ingresos que recibe los inviete en la educacion de su hija la cual tiene 
17 años y espera que se pueda graduar para que al terminar pueda obtener un trabajo y ayudarles en los gastos, Benita tuvo una perdida trajica que sufrio hace un año, su hijos se murio, ella espera que Dios le permita estar mucho tiempo y apoyar a su hija que tiene.
El esposo de ella la apoya en todo lo que ella necesita, la meta de Benita a corto plazo es 
poder terminar su casa, fue agradable platicar con ella ya que es una señora amable y muy querida por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Benita Obex G. has worked making and selling tortillas for 24 years. She has a steady clientele of neighbors and passersby in her neighborhood. She also delivers for parties, restaurants, etc. She invests $1,377.00 in the purchase of Maseca flour and sells it for $2,040.00, making a profit of $663.00. In this way she has been able to build 75% of her home. Now she is asking for a loan to be able to finish her house since it still lacks doors, windows, and a metal gate. She lives with her husband and daughter. Part of her income is invested in the education of her 17 year old daughter, who will hopefully graduate soon in order to work and help out with the family's expenses. Benita suffered a tragic loss a year ago when her son died. She hopes God allows her to live a long time and be able to support her daughter. Her husband supports her with all that she needs. Benita's short-term goal is to be able to finish her house. It was very nice chatting with her as she is a very kind lady beloved by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn flour, firewood, water, lime

loans.name: Aidos

texts.en: Aidos is 26 years old and lives with his wife and four year old son in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Aidos operates a retail meat business in his town. He began his business in 2004 and after several years of operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community. Aidos delivers meat to three local cafes for use in their food preparation. He also has individual customers who buy his meat on a regular basis. In order to expand his business in the past, he has previously received four loans from local banks and has always been reliable in paying these loans back. Because of his business success, he has managed to build a one room house for his family, though he would like to add on to this house in the future as his son gets older. Aidos is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD) loan in order to purchase several cows which he will use for his meat business.

loans.use: to purchase several cows which he will use for his meat business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo  y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años se dedica la crianza de animales (vacas), para ello implementó un espacio adecuado en su terreno donde construyó un establo para protegerlos de las lluvias. Todas las mañanas, María lleva a sus vacas a pastar en campos verdes, pero aun así no descuida la atención de sus hijos, pues sigue muy pendiente de sus necesidades y labores escolares. 
Para estas labores, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para transportar a sus vacas a los pastizales donde se alimentarán. 
El deseo a futuro de María es tener un establo más grande y mejor implementado para la crianza de mayor cantidad de animales. 

Esta es la sexta oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una socia responsable y perseverante dentro de su banco comunal, lo cual es apreciado por sus demás compañeros. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de dos vacas pequeñas de buena raza.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their 3 children. For the past 5 years, she has been breeding cattle on an adequate space of land containing a barn that was constructed to protect them from the rain. Every morning, she brings her cows out to graze in the green fields. María still looks after her children because she is very aware of their needs and their schoolwork. Her husband provides assistance by transporting the animals to pasture whenever they need to feed. In the future, María would like to have a bigger barn so that she can breed more animals.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. María is a responsible member who has persevered with her Communal Bank. The other members have much appreciation for her. The money she is requesting will be used to buy two small cows of good breed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two cows

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria vive en Alquiler con su hijo en la c/ “D”  zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; es comerciante y trabaja con materiales reciclados que compra o  junta para luego comercializarlos por cantidad.

El crédito que ahora requiere será utilizado para aumentar su capital de trabajo y poder comprar más material para su venta posterior.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2006 y tiene un historial de pagos bueno y  por el carácter social del préstamo ella puede acceder a u nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Maria lives in a rented house with her son on the “D” block of the Las Lomas region in the city of La Paz. She is a business woman, and she works with recycled materials. She buys them or gets them together to be able to later sell them in bulk. The loan that she needs now is to increase her work capital and be able to buy more material for later resale. She has been a member of Impro since 2006. Because of her good payment history and her good character she is able to access a new loan

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity of recyclable materials to later sell wholesale

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary U., 41, has been married to Mr. Phea Pok, 45, since 1984 and they have four children: three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a mason. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

One son is a construction worker and other two are in school. One of her sons just finished his beauty salon skill training and runs a beauty salon at his home.

Sotheary has been a silk weaver since 1980, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes the products to sell in Phnom Penh. Sotheary is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for continuing her silk weaving and to buy materials for her son’s beauty salon.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and materials for her son’s beauty salon

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn B. is from Cataggaman Nuevo, Tuguegarao City. She is 47 years old. Lovelyn is married and has 2 adult children. Lovelyn owns & operates a phone retailing business. She is just starting this business.

In 2005, Lovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lovelyn is requesting a loan of PHP 12000, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Lovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 31 años, una humilde mujer quien vive en su propia casa y esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de sobresalir en la vida. Por tal motivo se dedica al tejido artesanal, siendo esta actividad en el que diariamente teje, mostrando toda su creatividad y habilidad sobre estos tejidos y por lo que son vendidos en la ciudad del Cuzco y en Bolivia, que es donde más demanda tiene sus prendas. Este trabajo le llena de mucha satisfacción, ya que conoce esta labor por medio de su mamá, quien le enseñó cuando ella era una niña. Desde entonces lleva 7 años tejiendo, pese a que la parte más difícil es tener que transportar sus prendas a los distintos destinos de distribución, pero lo hace con mucha ganas ya que espera crecer su taller y mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, además dentro de su banco comunal la consideran como una mujer muy alegre y siempre esta pendiente de todos los acuerdos que tienen sus compañeros. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
Gloria is 31 years old. She is a humble woman who lives in her own house and is used to working very hard to get ahead in life. For this reason, she works at sewing traditional clothing. She sews every day, and her work shows such ability and creativity that it is sold in the city of Cuzco and in Bolivia, where it is in high demand.

This work fills Gloria with satisfaction. She learned it from her mother when she was a girl. She has been in business for seven years. The most difficult part of the business is transporting her products to the distant places where they are sold. But she does this with enthusiasm, as she wishes to grow her business and increase her income.

This is Gloria’s 1st loan with MFP, and she commits to making her payments on time. In her communal bank, she is considered a very happy woman, and she always complies with the agreements of the group. With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy wool to make more traditional clothing.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool to make traditional clothing

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is 46 years old and comes from Jala-jala, in the province of Rizal, an area that is growing in terms of livelihood enterprises. She is married to Rogelio, 48 years old, a farmer and a supportive husband. She is the loving mother of four children, the oldest being 22 years old and the youngest 2 years old. Erlinda is an optimistic mother who knows she will overcome all challenges to achieve her dreams.

The income of Erlinda and her husband is not enough to cover the expense of their family. Therefore, in 1999, she got the idea of joining ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.),  a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. Since then, she started a small farming business and it really helped them to meet their needs. She has now been in business for more than ten years. 

Currently on her sixth loan, Erlinda requests Php 30,000 as additional capital for her farming business. She believes that her proposed loan will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. She has disciplined herself to use all of the borrowed capital from ASHI-Kiva for her business to gain more profit and to use that profit to support the daily expenses and education of her children.

Erlinda has been an ASHI member for eleven years. ASHI paved the way for the achievement of the dreams of her family: to send her children to school and to have them finish their studies with a degree. In addition to this, though, she didn’t stop dreaming of her children having stable and happy families in the future.

Erlinda is very thankful to ASHI for its kind-hearted support of her dreams. She is also hoping that, with the help of ASHI in their lives, it will do much to help them provide a sustainable life and have a comfortable house to live in.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her farming business

loans.name: Haidy's Group

texts.en:
Haidy A. is from the village of Tinaclaan in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Haidy operates a family member's business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motor vehicle. Haidy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Haidy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haidy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC. Haidy is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be Haidy's 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline F. est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de MBORO depuis 10 et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 20 fois de suite. Elle fait de l'embouche porcine et du maraîchage.Son activité lui a permis de construire une chambre pour ses enfants. Son ambition est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacqueline F., aged 47, is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the village bank of Mboro for 10 years and has a great experience with loans in that she has had 20 consecutive loans. She breeds pigs and grows vegetables. Her activity enabled her to build a room for her children. Jacqueline’s ambition is to support her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Lon Pach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has seventeen people who live in Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province. Mrs. Lon P. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members.  They will each use their loan for different purposes.  All the members are shown in the photo, although some are obscured. 

Mrs. Lon P. is a Khmer noodle seller and also owns a general store in the local village.  She is a mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local public school, a third is employed in garment factory, and the last is too small to work or study. 

Her husband, Mr. Eng Sou, is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for supporting the family.  In the rice field, they have some problems because their field is infertile soil, but they do not have money to improve it. Thus, in order to increase rice production, Mrs. Lon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jojany

texts.en: Jojany, 27, is a borrower who lives in El Seybo, Dominican Republic. She has a perfect repayment history on previous loans and her story is representative of many other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International. Jojany lives with her husband and four children in a simple home in El Seybo, located in the heart of the agricultural east of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare, among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Jojany runs a successful business selling miscellaneous items to the women in her community. With this loan, she plans to purchase women’s blouses, pants and shoes, perfumes, and makeup to sell at a small markup. This is Jojany’s sixth loan with Esperanza International. With continued profits, she hopes to continue the growth of her business. She is very grateful for her loans, noting that she is now confident in the security of her children’s education. With a good education, she knows they will be able to overcome anything. In the long-run, Jojany dreams of having her own home. With her successful store, she is already well on the way. Thank you for your loan to Jojany! About Esperanza International: Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing, perfumes, and makeup to sell

loans.name: José Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor José Reynaldo S. M., tiene la edad de 62 años vive en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla es casado y su esposa realiza los trabajos domésticos, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad y casados.

Hace un tiempo su esposa tuvo un accidente y quedo con su pie lisiado, es por esta razón que él solicita de un préstamo para invertirlo en el hogar y realizar cambios en la infraestructura del mismo,  que le traigan mejores condiciones, debido a la afectación que sufre la señora, con el préstamo se compraran los materiales de construcción, necesarios para realizar los cambios debidos, este apoyo que se le brinde a la familia será de mucha ayuda a que la señora y su esposo habiten en un lugar mas cómodo y seguro para todos.
texts.en:
Mr. José Reynaldo S. M. is 62 years old, lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla suburb. He is married, his wife works in the home, they have 3 grown children that are married. Some time ago, his wife had an accident that left her with a crippled foot. He is requesting this loan to be able to make structural changes to his house, improving the conditions for his wife. The loan will allow him to purchase the necessary materials for the desired construction. This financial support will be of great help to the family, allowing them to live in a more comfortable and safe place.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora VICTORIA A. D. F., se dedica a la Lechería, elabora quesillos para su venta a las rescatistas en la zona D. Sumumpaya, donD. vive actualmente.Está casada con RENE F. CANDANO, él es maestro albañil y trabaja sólo medio año porque ayuda a su esposa con las vacas.Tuvieron cuadro hijos, todos ellos ya viven con sus familias fuera del hogar, por eso ellos no quieren dejar D. trabajar con sus vaquitas porque es su fuente D. ingreso y D. ocupación diaria.

Con el crédito comprará una vaca lechera para aumentar su producción,la demanda D. quesillos está en aumento en el mercado local.

Sus condiciones D. vida han mejorado en los últimos años con el acceso al crédito a plazo razonable indica ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. VICTORIA A. D. F. works in dairy production. She makes cheeses to sell to the rescue workers in the Sumumpaya area, where she lives. She is married to RENE F. CANDANO. He is a master bricklayer and he only works for half of the year because he helps his wife with the cows. They had four children. All of them have left home and live with their families. This is why they don't want to stop working with their cows because it is their source of income and their daily work. With the loan she will buy a dairy cow to increase her production. The demand for cheeses is going up at the local market. She indicates that her living conditions have improved in the last few years with the access to credit with reasonable terms.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Adela vive junto con su familia, un hijo y su esposo. Su negocio lo inicio desde hace dos años. Con el propósito de poder ayudar en los gastos básicos de agua y luz, su esposo trabaja como contador, el cual apoyo la iniciativa de mi negocio en donde me afilie con la empresa zermat y vendo por catálogos al gusto del cliente. Son producto bonito y accesible de compra. Pues ha logrado captar clientes. Con el crédito anterior logro mejorar un closet que tenia en mal estado todo esto gracias a su ganancias, a través del financiamiento. Con este préstamo pondrá cielo raso en la sala de su casa con el objetivo de amortiguar la presión del calor, ya que en estos días, ha sido muy caliente produciendo mucha presión alta. Es por eso la necesidad de esta mejora.
texts.en:
Adela lives with her family: a son and her husband. She started her business 2 years ago, with the objective of being able to help out with the basic household expenses such as the water and light bill. Her husband works as an accountant. He supported her in starting up her business, which involves catalog sales from the Zermat (beauty products) company. They have nice products that are affordable, and so she has managed to attract customers. With her previous loan, and thanks to her earnings, she managed to improve a closet that was in bad condition. With this loan she will put in a stucco ceiling in the living room of her house to make the room cooler, since during this summer it has been uncomfortably hot. This is the reason that she wants to make this improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to put a stucco ceiling in her house

loans.name: Suro Nipa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Bernice is  a 33-year-old woman who describes herself as reliable and trustworthy.  She has 2 children ages 1 and 10 years old.  Bernice’s family goals include providing her children with the opportunity to future their education.  

Bernice has operated a retail business selling provisions (groceries) for the past 4 years.  She will use the loan to buy bags of rice, gallons of oil, Milo (a cocoa drink), sardines and other food items.  Bernice would like to expand her business.  

Bernice is the leader of the trust bank group named "Sura Nipa", which means “be careful of man” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana.  As group leader, Bernice describes herself as firm, fair, and very understanding to all group members.  There are 12 members in this group.  The other group members are engaged in petty trading such as selling foodstuffs, vegetables, fish etc. They plan to use the loan to purchase stock to grow their business and thus provide more support for their family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Dora Esther

texts.es:
Cuando Dora terminó el bachillerato,    hace un poco más de 7 años, se dio cuenta no podía seguir estudiando por falta de recursos económicos, ella comenzó a buscar la forma de lograr el sueño de tener una carrera profesional, que le ayudara a conseguir un buen trabajo  y ayudar económicamente a su familia. Así fuè como aprendió el tema de la belleza y se dedicó a ofrecer servicios de peinados, cortes, alicer, pedicure y manicure y con la ayuda de una vecina que le dejaba ropa para damas a consignación, de una fácil manera de pagarle, se inició como negociante y al año siguiente se independizó porque le fuè muy bien, adquirió un capital propio y empezó a viajar a Barranquilla de donde trajo ropa femenina; posteriormente su hoy cónyuge se agregó al negocio y aumentó su experiencia microempresarial, asì mismo diversificó su oferta vendiendo una nueva línea de productos por catálogos como perfumes y cosméticos, sin dejar de ofrecer servicios de belleza pues tiene todos los implementos y el saber para hacerlo y es más la clientela que es la misma que solicita todos los servicios . En la actualidad los ingresos familiares provienen de sus negocios  y logró terminar estudios superiores y aspira a terminar otra carrera, afín con su trabajo. . En la actualidad solicita su primer crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertirlo en insumos para belleza y surtirse con bolsos calzado y ropa para damas principalmente.
Más adelante sueña con tener su casa propia, planeando la estabilidad los hijos que piensa tener,  también  quisiera ayudar a mucha gente a conseguir  su propio capital, como lo hicieron con ella, pues vive en un sector combinado entre familias y grandes empresas es decir en una de las zonas industriales de Cartagena y eso potencializa su actividad.
texts.en:
When Dora finished secondary school, a little more than 7 years ago, she realized that she couldn’t continue studying because of lack of financial resources. She began to look for a way to realize her dream of having a professional career that would enable her to get a good job and help her family financially. That was when she learned about being a beautician and she began doing haircuts, hair styling, hair relaxing, pedicures, and manicures. With the help of a neighbor who left her women’s clothes on consignment on easy terms, she began to sell, and the next year went out on her own because she was doing well. She put in some of her own capital and began to travel to Barranquilla where she brought women’s clothing. Later on her current partner joined the business and increased her micro entrepreneurial experience. They diversified what she was selling with a new line of products in catalogs such as perfumes and cosmetics. She didn’t stop working as a beautician since she had all the equipment and knowledge in the field and also her customers were asking for her services. Currently the family income comes from her businesses and she succeeded in completing her high school and wants to finish more studies related to her work. She is now asking for her first loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy supplies for her beauty business and merchandise, mainly purses, shoes and women’s clothing. In the future she dreams of having her own house, planning for the stability of the children she wants to have, and she also wants to help people get their own capital, as she was. She lives in an area that is a mixture of families and big businesses. That is an industrial zone of Cartagena and this helps her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty supplies and principally merchandise such as purses, shoes, and women's clothing

loans.name: Angela Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ángela es socia del banco comunal Las Cumbres desde 3 ciclos, este banco se reúne en la ciudad de Manta cada quinde días, sus socias son muy responsables a la hora de hacer sus pagos, y la señora Ángela lo podría ser la excepción.

Nuestra socia tiene como actividad la venta informal de ropa interior, sabanas, pantalones buzos de hombres y ropa de niños, para poder surtir su negocio le toca viajara a otras ciudades donde se encuentran los grandes mayoristas viaja cada quince días. Está separada y sus dos hijas son independientes de ella, para nuestra socia las cosas no han sido de total felicidad, porque ha tenido que enfrentarse a problemas de salud, se sometió a una cirugía que la imposibilitó por un tiempo y tuvo que estar alejada de sus ventas, ahora ya ha recuperado a sus clientas que en su gran mayoría se encuentran en la parroquia de Tarqui.

  Este nuevo crédito podrá surtir  su negocio en ropa de niños, sabanas y toallas, el sueño de nuestra socia es  tener un bazar completo de mercadería para así dejar de recorrer las calles porque su salud no está nada bien, con las ganancias tiene que seguir comprando medicinas para continuar con los  tratamientos.
texts.en:
Sra. Ángela is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Cumbres” (The Summits) for three loan cycles. This bank meets in the city of Manta every fifteen days. The members are very responsible when submitting their payments and Sra. Ángela is no exception.

Ángela has an informal business selling undergarments, bed sheets, trousers, men’s sweatshirts, and children’s clothing. In order to restock her business, she travels to other cities to buy from the large wholesalers every fifteen days. She is separated from her husband and her two daughters live independently. Things have not been completely happy for Ángela because she has had to deal with health problems. She underwent surgery which made life impossible for a while, so she was not able to make sales. Now that she has recovered, she is able to meet with her customers who mostly live in the parish of Tarqui.

This new loan will be used to restock her business with children’s clothing, bed sheets, and towels. Her dream is to have a bazaar full of merchandise so that she can stop walking through the streets since her health is still not good. Her earnings will be used to buy medicines she needs to continue her treatment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children’s clothing, bed sheets, and towels

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna L. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Miraluna works in someone else's business venture, providing transportation services. She has been engaged in this occupation for over two years and earns approximately $225 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Miraluna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Miraluna is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 9th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Lun T., 47, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. T. is an ice-cream seller, earning a gross income of $30 US per day. His wife is a grocery seller, earning an income of $7 per day. 

T. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a new motorbike to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: In God We Trust. Group

texts.en:
Ruth B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "In God We Trust." Ruth is a 27-year-old married woman. She and her husband have three children, who range in age from 2 to 8 years old. She explains that she was not able to attend school when she was growing up due to financial reasons.

For 4 years, she has been selling ladies' undergarments on Mechlin Street, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She is now seeking a loan (6,000 LRD of the total 30,000 LRD group loan) to buy more ladies' undergarments. She describes herself as hard-working woman, and she notes that her dream is to improve her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To improve her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria;  Ella tiene33 años de edad  y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la artesanía y a la bisutería, Ella elabora artes, en cerámica y los complementa con sus estudios de bisutería,  ella desea abrir su local de arte.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de materiales.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Manos Juntas" or "Hands Together". This bank is located in the Huanchac district which is part of the province and department of Cusco. The member's name is Maria. She is 33 years old, a single mother, and has 2 children. She produces artisan crafts and costume jewelry. She makes ceramic crafts and complements these with her costume jewelry. She wants to open her own arts store. She is requesting a loan to buy materials. The member is grateful for and values the loan and she promises to complete her loan payments in the set period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Rosario De Fatima

texts.es: Doña Rosario de Fátima R. B. de 53 años fue trabajadora de una importante institución bancaria del país, por problemas de salud fue jubilada antes de tiempo y desde ese entonces se dedica a la venta de productos de las marcas AVON, ZERMAT, ORIFLAME, pero sobre todo LOVABLE; sus principales clientes son ex compañeras y ex compañeros de trabajo. Ella además de los ingresos por venta de estos productos también recibe su pensión. Su objetivo es poder seguir trabajando mientras Dios le de las fuerzas para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Rosario de Fátima R. B., age 53, worked in an important banking institution of Nicaragua, but due to health problems she retired. Since then she has sold AVON, ZERMAT and ORIFLAME products; but mostly LOVABLE brand products. Her main customers are her former co-workers. She receives a pension on top of the income from these products. Her goal is to keep working as long as God gives her the strength to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and simsim and is requesting a loan to stock more of these goods to sell.  Mary is 35 years old and married to a farmer. She has four children and three of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion M. is a married woman who lives in Sitio-Nino, DAS, Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: pig Fattening, livestock and sari-sari (general) store businesses. Her husband Arneto M. Sr., who is 36 years old, buys and sells livestock to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are 1 to 13 years old.

Visitacion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Visitacion has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped increase her monthly income to PHP 48,000, lifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 24,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her various business activities so that she can continue to save up for future house improvements. Visitacion M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy additional working capital.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda M., 45, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Mercelito M., a mechanic, and is the mother to a five young adults, all of whom are already working. By the grace of God, Erlinda has managed to support all her children’s educational needs. As of the present time she is working hard to be able to maintain her finances.

Erlinda operates an auto-repair shop. Her husband is the main mechanic while she handles finances, accounts, inventories and promotion. They offer repair, check-up and beautification of all types of cars and jeepneys - any type of vehicle that is referred to them. They also have a little refreshment stand in their auto-repair shop, where they sell beverages to the waiting customers and passing passenger vehicles.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies like spare parts of cars, wirings, putty paint and others of the like. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Erlinda dreams or being able to have a good and comfortable life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy supplies like spare parts of cars, wirings, putty paint and others of the like

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina G., from the Barangay of Gotocan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, is 53 years old, widowed and has three grown children. To make a living, Felomina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Felomina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felomina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used for the acquisition of coco land. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For acquisition of coco land

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som M. is 49 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She sells groceries and makes $2 each day. Her husband has been a soldier since 1970 and makes $3 per day. This couple has two school-aged children. 

Som M. wants to raise pigs so she decided to take out a loan of $800 to start this business.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
Four members are forming this group loan.  They are living in Paraen Leu village, in Kandal province. Mrs. An H., a 55-year-old married woman, is the leader of this group, having been selected by its members.   With the loans, they hope that the income will increase to improve their family's living.  

Mrs. An H. and her husband, Mr. Try Nhorch, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate different vegetables for a living.  However, she doesn’t have enough money to grow this farm. Thus, Mrs. An H. would like to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to cultivate different vegetables.

This couple has three children who all are farmers, and they also cultivate different vegetables.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for farm

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina A. is from the village of Mimbunga, Gingoog City. She is 27 years old. Cristina is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish, such as sardines and mackerel in the local community. She also buys and raises pigs for future sale. Cristina has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP. which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cristina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en:
Rasul A. is a hard-working farmer because he knows that the only way he can support and provide for his loved ones is through hard work and dedication. Consequently, he leaves home every day at dawn to work on his farm and to look after his cattle. Rasul wishes to expand his business by purchasing young cattle and fodder for them. That is the reason that he is asking for a loan. Rasul will always cherish the memory of all those who gave him a helping hand when he needed it by granting him his request.      


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only seven per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of young cattle and fodder for them

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is married to M. L. and resides in the city of Multan in Pakistan. Multan city is known for its historic places and hot weather. She owns a two-room house there where she lives with her husband, 5 children and her brother. 

Her husband is a blacksmith by profession and makes iron boxes which are used to keep clothes, bed sheets, blankets, etc. Her brother is involved in an embroidery business. He does embroidery on clothes and gets income. He learned this skill from Nusrat and became expert by helping her in completing her embroidery orders.
 
Nusrat was unable to provide an education for her children, so that’s why they started work at an early age. Her eldest son, who is 20 years of age, makes school bags while her second and third sons make plastic baskets.  Her youngest children are below 10 years of age and they stay at home.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s business. With the loan, he will buy embroidery items such as clothes, beads, colored thread and sketches which will help him complete orders on time and make an extra income.

She is a new loan user of Asasah and is hopeful that a loan investment will bring positive changes to her brother’s business and he will be able to save some money from the profits for his marriage.

Note: In the photo, the lady with the raised hand is Nusrat.

loans.use: To buy embroidery items for business

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie is from the village of  Plaridel, Misamis, Occidental. She is 27 years old. Stephanie is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Stephanie owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members. Stephanie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Stephanie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Stephanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Stephanie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Stephanie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
Agripina tiene 46 años de edad, tiene siete hijos, vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Agripina nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria al lado del mercado de la ciudad de  Pisaq. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de comida y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Agripina requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y muchas cosas más.     

Agripina pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Agripina is 46 years old, has seven children, and lives in the city of Pisaq in the Province of Calca, Department of Cusco, Peru.
