She says that she sells food as a street vendor next to the market in the city of Pisaq. Agripina has been selling food for several years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy supplies such as rice, sugar, noodles, and other items.

Agripina belongs to the Communal Bank “Mosoq Ñusta”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, and other items

loans.name: Reynaldo Jose

texts.es: El señor G. labora como maestro de obar de construccion  es  casado,  tiene un hijos a su cargo, es el primer  del crédito que CEPRODEL le otorga, agradece el apoyo que le brindan con  este  desembolso, para realizarse compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, hierro, y pago de mano de obra para mejora de su vivienda en ampliar cuartos.
texts.en: Mr. G. works as a construction laborer. He is married and is raising children. This is his first loan with CEPRODEL. He is grateful for the support offered by it. With it, he will buy construction materials such as sand, cement, and iron, as well as to pay for labor to do some home improvement by enlarging some rooms.

loans.use: to do home improvement.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna S., is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Edna is married and has two adult children. To make a living she has been working at her business for almost 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. Edna is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used for buy-out in Tudela Branch PMPC and the remaining additional capital of her business. This will be the 1st loan taken by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her work to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy-out in Tudela Branch and the remaining for additional capital

loans.name: Namizzi Central Group

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old G. Peter is a timber salesman operating from Jinja. The happy-go-lucky father of two has been in this business for eight years now. He says he was able to get established in this trade with profits from his first business, commercial farming--not that he has deserted it. He still finds time to go and tend to the crops in his gardens. Both of these businesses have required him to work hard. And in that regard he has not shortchanged himself. Peter is affiliated with Namizzi central group, and he says this business can generate him weekly profits to the tune of 250,000 shillings. He says with this loan he is going to purchase more timber to resell. 

In the group photo, three group members are not seen clearly, so I marked them as unpictured.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to resell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 54 años de edad y es casado. Vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, quienes lo apoyan en su negocio. Residen en el distrito La Matanza, ubicado en la provincia de Morropon, en el norte de Perú. Se dedica a actividades agriculturas. Cuenta con un pequeño terreno donde siembra frijol. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 20 años en su caserío. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Desea usar su crédito para comprar fertilizantes y abonos que usará en el mantenimiento de su terreno agrícola y su cultivo de frijol. Con esta inversión, podrá sembrar una cantidad más grande de frijol que pueda vender al publico general y los negociantes  que suelen visitar la zona. Con sus ingresos, podrá solventar sus gastos familiares y del hogar. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Pedro is 54 years old and married. He lives in his own home with his wife and kids, who support his business. They live in the district of La Matanza, located in the province of Morropon, in the north of Peru. He works in agriculture. He has a small plot of land where he plants beans. He has been doing this for more than 20 years in his village. He learned from his father, so he knows this field of work perfectly. 

He wants to use his loan to buy fertilizers and manure that will be used to maintain his farmland and his bean crop. With this investment, he will be able to plant a larger quantity of beans that he can sell to the general public and the businessmen that often visit the area. With his income, he will be able to cover his family's cost of living. For this reason, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his bean crop

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 39 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling food items at the market. Janet has taken a loan to stock more food items to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more food items to sell.

loans.name: Gideon Wanyoike

texts.en: Gideon, 23, has operated a business in the transport industry in Naivasha town for the last three years. He also has a farm, and sells its produce in the local market. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend; this will be his second loan. He paid off his previous loan of KES 63,00 in good time. He plans to use this new loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Gideon hopes to buy a taxi and grow his farming into a large-scale operation.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married man living with his wife and one school-aged child. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a cattle farm since 2006. He works alone on his farm, producing dairy products such as milk. He sells his products to local markets and many customers upon request. His farm is the only source of income for his family. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 US from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase fodder for his cattle. This will allow his cattle to produce a good quality of milk so that he will be able to increase his sales. In the future, he is willing to buy more cattle in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Efua sells gari, as seen in the picture. She also sells secondhand clothes in  Elmina. As part of her responsibilities, she makes sure the food is always available in the home. A loan will go a long way to help her purchase more bags of gari to resell and grow her business. Efua plans to save up to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: buy more gari to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more zippers, lace and a more advanced sewing machine.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun is a garment worker, while her husband Chhen is a fisherman and drives a horse cart.  They live across the MeK. River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  They have been married since 2003 and have two young daughters.

Hoeun is asking for a loan of $400 to help with her husband’s fishing business by buying a new boat and motor.

Both Hoeun and her husband are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To help with her husband’s fishing business by buying a new boat and motor.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
En el centro poblado menor de Kiteni, distrito de Quillabamba, provincia de La Convención, en el Cusco conocimos a la señora Reyna y nos cuenta: 
“Nací en la ciudad de Curahuasi del departamento de Apurímac, tengo 39 años edad, tengo seis hijos y ahora vivo en la ciudad de Kiteni y donde desarrollo mis actividades económicas que son: cultivo y siembra de café, cacao, coca y achote y también vendo golosinas en el parque central de la ciudad”. 

Reyna es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia, ella cultiva café y cacao y vende a empresas formales que se encargan de procesar el café y el cacao, ella también vende golosinas como por ejemplo gaseosas, cervezas y otras cosas más.   

Sus compañeras de trabajo le invitaron para participar del banco comunal “Choclo de Oro de Kiteni” y porque le tiene confianza y ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como chicles, galletas, refrescos y otras cosas más.
texts.en:
We met Reyna in the middle of the small settlement of Kiteni, Quillabamba District, La Convención Province in Cusco and she told us:

“I was born in the city of Curahuasi, Apurímac Department.  I’m 39 years old and have six children.  Now I live in the city of Kiteni where I carry out my economic activities which are: farming coffee, cocoa beans, coca leaf and annatto.  I also sell snacks in the city’s central park.”

Reyna’s a tenacious, enterprising woman who is moving her family forward.  She grows coffee and cocoa beans to sell to formal firms that process the coffee and cocoa beans.  She also sells snacks, like soft drinks, beer and other things.

Her coworkers invited her to participate in the “Choclo de Oro de Kiteni” communal bank because they trust her.  On this occasion, she needs the loan to buy merchandise like chewing gum, cookies, soft drinks and others.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like chewing gum, cookies, soft drinks and others.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, a 37-year-old mother of three children between the ages of 20 and 25, has been selling shoes for 11 years, earning a monthly profit of KES.15,000. With this loan of KES.70,000, she plans to purchase more stock of shoes. With the anticipated profits, Rebecca wants to educate her children through college and hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of shoes.

loans.name: Rio Grande El Milagro Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta conformado  por once integrantes indígenas  que se  dedican a diferentes actividades económicas, ellas formaron  este grupo  ya que son vecinas de la  comunidad.
Este grupo se llama  Rió Grande el Milagro se llama  así por que  su gente  este grupo cree mucho en los milagros  que le ha dado dios, para salir adelante como es la ayuda de fundacion realidad  para hacer realidad sus sueños.
Este grupo esta reconocido  por el INEGI una población hermosa en  fauna .
La representante de este es la señora Maria de cuarenta y dos años de edad  esta casada  con el señor  Román ambos tienen  tres hijos  que estudian.
La señora Maria  se dedica a la venta de ropa desde  hace cinco años atrás es una señora muy reconocida en su población por la ropa  típica  que vende ya que es ropa ella por ella.
Ella pidió el préstamo  para comprar  más material para  la elaboración de  la ropa como son: hilos, telas aros para tejer y agujas, etc.
Esta muy contenta ya que su negocio le deja muy buenas  ganancias  para segur ayudándoles a sus hijos en sus estudios y a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, de igual manera  para realizar sus pagos  que ah  adquirido  del préstamo.
Los otros integrantes son:
Alejandro – se dedica  a la venta  de  pescado.
Josefina – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Damiana – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Juana – se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos.
Guadalupe- se dedica a la venta de  compra de fiero viejo.
Pedro- se dedica a la venta de venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Carlos se dedica a la venta de  compra de fiero viejo.
Verónica se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Irelia-se dedica a la venta de pescado por mayoreo y menudeo.
Maria Manuela - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Le dan las gracias a fundacion realidad por el apoyo que las ha dado para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de este milagro par tener una mejor calidad de vida.
***Las personas que no se ven bien en la foto por que las tapan  sus compañeras son: Juana y Maria***
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 11 indigenous members who each have different businesses.  They created this group because they are all neighbors in their community.  The group is called Río Grande el Milagro (Rio Grande the Miracle) becuase the members of this group believe strongly in the miracles that God has given them to be able to get ahead, such as the help from the foundation to help them achieve their dreams. This group is from an area recognized by INEGI (National Institute of Statistics and Geography) as one with beautiful wildlife.

The representative of this group is Maria.  She is 42 years old and married to Ramón, with whom she has three children who attend school. Maria has been selling clothes for 5 years and is very well known in her town for the traditional clothing that she sells, which she also makes.  She is asking for a loan to purchase more materials to make clothing such as thread, fabric, crochet hooks, needles, etc.  She is very happy because her business provides good earnings so that she can help her children with their studies and help her husband with household expenses.  She is also able to make her payments on the loan she has received.

The other members of the group are:  
Alejandro – sells fish.
Josefina – sells Mexican snacks.
Damiana – sells Mexican snacks.
Juana – sells Mexican snacks.
Guadalupe- buys and sells iron scrap. 
Pedro- sells Mexican snacks.  
Carlos - buys and sells iron scrap. 
Verónica -sells Mexican snacks. 
Irelia-sells fish both retail and wholesale. 
Maria Manuela - sells Mexican snacks.

The group thanks the Realidad Foundation for the help it has provided to enable them to get ahead and realize their dreams, and for being part of this miracle that provides a better quality of life.
 
***The people who are hard to see in the photo because they are blocked by others are Juana and Maria.

loans.use: to sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Cambodia operates as a free market, so lots of couples co-operate and try to make an effort to find which job is suitable for them to earn an income for the family. With many choices of jobs, Mrs. Bou has been running a business selling vegetables. She sells her vegetables in one market far away from her community. From this business, Bou earns about $4 USD. Everyday, Bou must spend some money for a motor taxi for operating her business. Because of the long distance and no motorbike for operating her business, Bou has decided to request some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase a motorbike for facilitating her business. She hopes that this fund will help her meet happiness and gain more profit each day.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has two children. Since completing school, she has prepared and sold fried fish and kenkey (milled casava) on the roadside in Jukwa. She has worked in the fish business for 6 years. Ekua’s husband is a farmer. Ekua uses the loan money to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale. The profits are used to clothe, feed, and pay the school fees of her children. Any remaining income she tries to save and reinvest in her business for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en: Binta, 42 years old, was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Binta’s husband is a teacher and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Binta has been a small-scale businesswoman for the past 5 years. She sells cloths – gara lappers (locally dyed cloths), traditional Bamako cloths, etc. Binta has requested a loan of 2,000,000.00 SLL from Kiva field partner, Salone Micro Finance Trust (SMT), in order to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy additional cloths for her business.

loans.use: to buy gara cloths and Bamakos (locally dyed cloth) to add to her business

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Irene tiene 46 años, casado con Gerardo de 52 años, con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Sivia. Irene se dedica a la venta de golosinas en el cafetín del colegio "Gervasio Santillana". En un comienzo no sabia nada de lo que es un negocio, pero gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres supo enfrentarlo, Sin embargo, no le era suficiente, por ello monto un mostrador para vender golosinas, desde entonces sus ganancias aumentaron. El trato amable y la variedad de productos que ofrecen le han dado mucha ventaja para captar clientela. Se siente muy entusiasmada por haber incursionado en el negocio, lo que ahora desea es abrir una tienda de abarrotes, donde pueda surtir sus productos, y pueda vender cereales, vegetales, carnicería y especias. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser efectivo  el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.500 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de nuevos productos para su cafetín.
texts.en: Irene, 46, is married to Gerardo, 52, and they have two children.  They all live together in her own house located in Sivia District.  Irene sells snacks at her school’s snack bar.  At the beginning she didn’t know anything about what business was like but thanks to her parents’ teaching she was able to face it.  However, it was not enough for her so she set up a counter to sell snacks and since then profits increased.  The kind treatment and assorted products she offers have been very advantageous for her to win over customers.  She is very excited about having gone into the business and now Irene wants to open a grocery store where she can stock her products and sell cereals, vegetables, meats and spices.  This will be her first MFP loan and she commits to be effective with her installment payments.  She will use the 1500 new soles to buy new products for her snack bar.

loans.use: to buy snacks for her snack bar.

loans.name: Olga Yojany

texts.es:
Olga es una madre de familia de 33 años, vive en su casa propia con sus hijos, cuenta con el  servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Las Lomas que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace algunos años Olga se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y crianza de aves de corral, ambas actividades lo tiene en su domicilio, sus productos los ofrece a sus clientes tantode casa en casa como en su domicilio y sus aves las comercializa una vez que hayan llegadoasu tamaño y peso ideal, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de belleza  como alimento balanceado para sus aves de corral y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Olga es una mujer trabajadora y una madre que siempre trata que su familia salga adelante a pesar de las dificultades que a veces se presentan en la vida.
texts.en:
Olga is a 33-year-old mother.  She lives in her own home with her children, with lights as their only utility, in the rural area of the Las Lomas district belonging to the department of Piura.  The area’s main activities are agriculture and livestock.

For a few years now, Olga has sold beauty products and raised poultry, both of which she does from home.  She offers her products to her customers both by going from house to house and from her home, and she sells her birds once they have reached the ideal size and weight.  With the earnings from both jobs, she can offer her children a better quality of life.

She has requested a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more beauty products and nutritious feed for her birds so that she will be able to earn more and have a better quality of life.  Olga is a hard working woman and a mother who always tries to help her family move forward in spite of the difficulties that sometimes come up in life.

loans.use: buy beauty products and nutritious feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, 26, is married with two children. She lives in Camanga, Tukuran, Zam.del Sur. Maricel owns and operates a farm, planting crops to earn a living. She has had this business for more than two years. Each month she earns Php 10,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 20,000.00 which will be used to purchase fertilizer and pay costs for rice planting. Maricel has been a member of GDMPC for one year and it's her first loan cycle. In the future, Maricel will use the returns to provide for her family and for the education of her two kids.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for rice planting

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей – фермер из Каменского региона. Он вместе с женой и 8-летним сыном живет в селе Водяное. Сергец занимается выращиванием ранних овощей вот уже 6 лет. На данный момент у него уже есть 6 больших теплиц и 2 теплицы для рассады. В свое дело вложено 70 000 гривен. Затраты на семена и пленку ежегодно составляют 25 000 гривен.  

Сергею необходим кредит в 13 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пленку и материалы для теплиц, а именно приобрести полиэтиленовую пленку на 5 000 гривен, арматуру для теплиц на сумму 6 000 гривен и семян на 2 000 гривен. В следующем году Сергей хочет купить землю в конце своего огорода и построить там дополнительные теплицы.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Sergei is a farmer from the Kamenka region.  He lives with his wife and 8 year-old son in the Vodyanoe village.  Sergei has been involved in growing early vegetables for six years.  Currently, he has six large greenhouses and two greenhouses for seedlings.  He invested 70,000 hryvnia into his business.  Annual expenses for seeds and plastic is 25,000 hryvnia.  Sergei needs a loan in the sum of 13,000 hryvnia to buy plastic and materials for greenhouses, specifically to 5,000 hryvnia to buy plastic, 6,000 hryvnia to buy fixtures for greenhouses and 2,000 hryvnia to buy seeds.  Sergei wants to buy land at the end of his farm and build additional greenhouses there next year.

loans.use: to buy plastic and materials for greenhouses, specifically to 5,000 hryvnia to buy plastic, 6,000 hryvnia to buy fixtures for greenhouses and 2,000 hryvnia to buy seeds

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo se han unido con la esperanza de obtener mayores ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias, ellas son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy emprendedoras. Realizan actividades independientes, pero también actividades en conjunto, las que hacen fomentar su compañerismo.
Una de esas laboriosas mujeres es la señora Maria, quien es la presidenta del grupo, ella tiene una pequeña peluquería bien equipada, nos comenta que gracias a este negocio, ella puede sacar adelante a su familia, ya que diariamente trabaja mucho, lo cual le trae buenos ingresos. Dice que ya tiene una clientela fiel que siempre acude hasta su peluquería.
Ella desea abastecer su negocio por lo que solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva, para la compra de tintes, esmaltes para uñas, spray, gel, y demás insumos, que son sus principales elementos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Eighteen women from the city of San Lorenzo have come together with the hope of obtaining better earnings, so that they can help their families. They are hard-working, determined and very entrepreneurial women. They carry out independent activities, but they also have joint projects which help them strengthen their sense of teamwork. 

One of these hard-working women is Maria, the group's president. She has a small but well-equipped beauty salon. She comments that thanks to this business, she has been able to help her family get ahead, since she works very hard each day and thus earns a good income. She says that she has a loyal customer base of people who always come back to her salon. 

She wants to stock her business, and for this reason she is asking for help from Kiva and the Paraguaya Foundation to buy hair dyes, nail polish, spray, gel and other supplies, which are the main items she needs for her work.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes, nail polish, spray, gel and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Circuncicion sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Circuncicion sigue dedicándose a la venta de verduras y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. 

Circuncicion con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Circuncicion requiere el préstamo para comprar mas verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, tomates, cebollas y pepinos. 
 
Circuncicion se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Circuncicion is still participating in the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” [Enterprising Women] communal bank of the micro-lenind unit of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cuzco. Circuncicion still sells vegetables and it is going very well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her business. 

With the previous loan things went very well for Circuncicion and she really benefitted from it. That is why she wants another loan, because it really helps her.  

Circuncicion needs the loan to buy more vegetables such as carrots, tomatoes, onions and cucumbers. 
 
Circuncicion is grateful for the opportunity that has been offered in this way and she is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Dinora Del Carmen

texts.es: Dinora del Carmen  vive con hijo, ella posee una venta de ropa y confesión,  ropa para damas, caballeros y niños como pantalones, blusas, camisas, vestidos entre otros; es muy conocida en la localidad pues siempre tiene lo que el cliente necesita con producto de calidad y a precios bajos, además su servicio es excelente siempre satisface los gustos de su clientela; Dinora es una mujer emprendedora siempre está luchando por conseguir su éxito, para ella el más grande secreto para llegar a ese triunfo es la constancia y el valor de seguir el camino, Dinora sabe que está en el camino correcto y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL n crédito que le permita comprar  ropa por mayor y diferentes telas. Dinora del Carmen tiene la confianza que esto le  ayudara a darle una mejor  calidad de vida a la familia.
texts.en: Dinora del Carmen lives with her son. She sells clothing for women, men and children like pants, shirts, dresses and other items. She is very well known in her area because she always has what the customers need and she has good quality products with low prices. In addition, her customer service is excellent and always satisfies her customers’ tastes. Dinora is a very enterprising woman. She is always fighting to obtain success. For her, her biggest secrets for reaching this triumph are perseverance and the value of following a path. Dinora knows that she is on the right path. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that allows her to purchase wholesale clothing and different fabrics. Dinora del Carmen is confident that this will help her give a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: purchase wholesale clothing and fabrics.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed.

Imelda has a shop that makes and sells viands (items of food), like afritada and caldereta. She has a vegetable garden and sells vegetables during harvest time. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making viands (food items).

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 26 year old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Christina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jackton Wanga

texts.en:
Jackton Wanga is a 26-year-old tailor in Mombasa. He is a married father of one child. He has been doing tailoring for the past four years and he is doing great. 

This is Jackton’s first loan from KADET. He plans to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth materials. 

He will use the anticipated profits to add more materials and repay his loan.
 
He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, sewing thread and cloth materials.

loans.name: Aizhamal

texts.ru: Айжамал, 25 лет, замужем, детей нет. У нее высшее образование, работает в аптеке менеджером по закупкам, ежемесячная заработная плата составляет 28,350 сом (KGS). В этом году Айжамал решила сделать ремонт в доме, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 128,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для проведения ремонтных работ по улучшению жилищных условий в доме. Приобретет гипсокартон для утепления, кафель, краску и прочее. Доходы от кредита Айжамал планирует вкладывать в дальнейший ремонт дома.
texts.en: Айжамал, 25 лет, замужем, детей нет. У нее высшее образование, работает в аптеке менеджером по закупкам, ежемесячная заработная плата составляет 28,350 сом (KGS). В этом году Айжамал решила сделать ремонт в доме, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 128,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для проведения ремонтных работ по улучшению жилищных условий в доме. Приобретет гипсокартон для утепления, кафель, краску и прочее. Доходы от кредита Айжамал планирует вкладывать в дальнейший ремонт дома.

loans.use: to buy drywall for insulation, tile and pain for renovating her home

loans.name: Elma Rutila

texts.es:
Elma es una gran madre de familia, trabaja de sol a sol para que a su familia no le falte nada, ella tiene 39 años de edad, es casada con una familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 8 y 16 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Elma para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia  trabaja como dependiente desde hace 3 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también cuenta con un negocio con el que obtiene un poco más de ingresos y a su familia mantiene mejor.
Elma desde hace algún tiempo se ha dado cuenta que es muy necesario remodelar su casa, pero aunque se ha esforzado mucho para  no le ha sido posible la remodelación por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como: cal, arena, cemento y piedrín.
Con este cambio ella espera darle a su familia un hogar más digno.

loans.use: Compra de materiales como: cal, arena, cemento y piedrín, para remodelar su casa.

loans.name: Maria Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina sells shoes and fashion jewellery, a business that she started some years ago, something that has allowed her to support her family and her husband by covering the household costs. Her husband works in a private company, but his salary is not enough to cover all their expenses. Catalina has three children aged 15, 11, and 19 years of age, and she knows that their short childhood is a very delicate period for which they need lots of attention.

Catalina runs a small store where she sells fashion jewellery and shoes but she needs your support to expand her business, for which she requests a loan of $250 to purchase more inventory and increase the selection of items for sale. She and her family need your support and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Catalina se dedica ala venta de zapatos y joyería, inició este negocio hace ya algunos años permitiéndole a través de estos años sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su esposo trabaja para una empresa privada, sin embargo su salario no es suficiente para cubrir con todos los gastos. Catalina tiene 3 jóvenes hijos de 15, 11 y 19 años de edad y sabe que su corta edad es una etapa delicada y necesitan de mucha atención.

Actualmente Catalina tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende sus productos de joyería y de zapatos pero necesita de un apoyo para hacer crecer su negocio, ella requiere de $250 USD para aumentar la capacidad de productos en su tienda y de esta manera ella puede aumentar la variedad y cantidad de artículos para vender. Ella y su familia requieren de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gozal

texts.en:
Gozel is 43 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region, Abutalub village, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. She is a widow and has 3 children.
One day she decided to set up her own business.
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 to buy foodstuffs.
The second loan of $800 she spent to buy scales and foodstuffs.
Now Gozal needs a loan of $1200 to buy a refrigerator and ice-cream apparatus.
She has been in this business for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and ice-cream apparatus

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: With an initial loan from SPBD, Ana, 25 years old, launched a small business selling ice-pops.  Flavored ices are a favorite treat of the Samoan schoolchildren.  Ana’s business success has helped her support her family, which consists of one child of her own and eight dependents from her extended family.  With the large demand from neighborhood children, Ana can make a clear profit of about USD 20 a day, Monday through Friday.  She uses the money mostly for her son’s educational fees, food for her large household and of course to make her weekly loan repayment.  Her next business idea is to expand her ice-pop business into a full food stall where she can sell a variety of treats and cooked foods.  She will also use her next loan to make some much-needed home repairs.

loans.use: :  building supplies (cement, corrugated iron, timber) and food supplies

loans.name: Affou

texts.en: C. Affou sells goods in the Angré open market (eastside suburb of Abidjan), especially spices. She is 24 years old and is married. She has 5 children. Three of them are living in Korhogo, in the north of Cote d’Ivoire and the other two live with her and are still completing their education. Her husband is an office clerk. She has 11 years of experience in doing her business. She joined the AE&I microcredit program in July, 2005. She requests this loan in order to purchase goods in bulk and benefit from a better purchase price.

loans.use: Affou Coulibaly will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs.Uch S., 47, is a widow and lives with her five children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a small booth selling Vietnamese noodles, earning about $2/day in profit. Two of her children work at construction; another is employed at a factory, and one drives a horse cart transporting passengers.

Mrs. Uch S. plans to use the money from this loan to purchase a horse for her son to operate his business.

loans.use: To purchase a horse for her son to operate his business

loans.name: Ma. De La Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria de la Luz has worked in the business of food sales for more than 3 years. This business has been the main source of income for her family. “My children and I all work in the business. I would like to fix the place up and purchase more furniture so that my clients are more comfortable while they eat the food I sell. I am requesting a loan for $1,000.00 for the purchase of furniture for my business.”

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria De La Luz tiene ya más de 3 años en el negocio de venta de comida. Este negocio ha sido la fuente de ingresos de su familial. En el negocio trabajamos uno de mis hijos y yo, quiero acondicionar mejor el local y comprar mobiliario para que mis clientes estén más cómodos al estar consumiendo la comida que yo vendo. Solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls para la compra de mobiliario para el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture

loans.name: Fauu

texts.en: Faauu M. is a thirty-year-old mother from Salua Manono and her business is her family plantation. She grows taro, bananas, and taamu at the plantation and she goes to the market two days a week.  Her husband is working in New Zealand and the plantation is run by her father. Fauu’s father has private lands in the village and this is cultivated for the plantation. She has five children and the money from the plantation and the income from her husband are her two major source of income. She is one of the oldest members of the loan program and she is still active and honest with repayment. She is looking forward to earning more loans, and she is also looking at expanding the business in the future.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for the plantation and also iron roofing for home improvement

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
I have lived all my life in a small town Kot Radha Kishan, which is about 50 kilometers away from a big city Lahore.  I have six children, three of whom are enrolled in a local school.  My husband is a constructor and lays concrete roof tops while I work at a local factory. I request a loan to buy goats which one of my sons raise at home to trade. 
Nasreen S. requests a loan for her husband’s construction business. Sheela S. will buy a cow with the loan. Root S. requests the loan to buy an embroidery machine. Sumaira B. will also buy a cow with this loan.   
I am the group leader of these women for past four years. All of them are my friends and I love being their leader because this gives me an opportunity to do something that can bring positive changes in their lives.

loans.use: To buy a few required tools

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.ru:
Gulmurod A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 43 years old, is married and has 6 children. He has a highschool diploma. Gulmurod has an animal rearing business. He would like to receive a loan in order to purchase young calves, which he will then feed and then resell. This is the only source of income for Gulmurod's family. Additionally, support of private animal rearing businesses gives an opportunity to develop the whole economic sector, which helps to keep meat prices stable. The client plans to repay his loan within 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Абдиназаров Гулмурод Боведипович житель города Яван. 43 года, женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Кредит запрашивает для того, чтобы купить бычков для откормки и последующей их реализации.Этот вид бизнеса является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Так же развитие животноводства в частном порядке дает возможность развитию всего сектора, что позволяет сохранять цены на мясо. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 3 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Hanoi Altagracia

texts.en:
Hanoi Altagracia is 30 years old and married with no children. Hanoi is an ambitious and successful entrepreneur. She owns and operates a clothing store in the Hato Nuevo community of San Cristobal. Her store is well stocked and lots of people regularly visit to get pants, shirts and to check out the chic collection of shoes she offers.

Hanoi wants to expand her business. She’s thinking about offering nail-care services to her customers. She says that she worked for a long time in a nail center and that she has a huge knowledge and experience in the matter.

With her loan, Hanoi will buy fashionable new pants and shoes to add to her inventory so as to attract new customers.

This is the third loan Hanoi will take from FSMA. She is a trustworthy and responsible person, and she always had repaid the loan on time.

loans.use: Hanoi will invest in bulk clothing in order to replenish her store.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is 25 years old and is a single  woman with one child, age 10 years old. Halima is a fish exporter with a business she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm at her shop and can earn a monthly profit of about $170 from her sales.  Halima now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Nazriniso

texts.en: A. Nazriniso has been the client of the MicroInvest since 2008. Her first loan helped her to develop the business and she was able to return her loan on time. Now Mrs. A. Nazriniso has a trade outlet for selling fabric for dressmaking. She sells her fabric for prices that are less than the bazaar prices so she has many customers. She works on the collective farm but the work is seasonal so she is concentrating on selling fabrics for dresses. She is married and has 2 children. Mrs. A. Nazriniso applies to KIVA for a loan to further the development of her business.  Mrs. A. Nazriniso requires the loan of 1800 TJS for 8 months. She thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA provides to small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Business development of fabric selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, pants and new items with which to expand a small business.

loans.name: Gie Aroka Group

texts.fr:
We are young people from the Mlomp ecovillage, and have already constructed a building in order to turn it into an inn. In our ecovillage there is no place for visitors to stay while passing through. We have invested in the construction of an inn in order to solve this problem. The inn will allow visitors to find a place to eat and sleep, rather than having to go elsewhere in other villages. This will allow us to earn our living and create jobs to fight the illegal immigration that has caused nearly all the village youth to leave. We need this loan in order to buy furniture and to build and supply the bathrooms and restaurant.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

Nous sommes des jeunes de l'écovillage de Mlomp qui avons déjà construit un bâtiment pour en faire une auberge. Dans notre ecovillage, nous n'avons pas de site d'accueil pour loger les visiteurs qui sont de passage chez nous. C'est pour palier à ce problème que nous avons décidé d'investir dans la construction d'une auberge. Ce lieu permettra aux visiteurs de trouver un endroit pour passer la nuit et se restaurer, au lieu d'aller ailleurs dans les autres villages. Cela nous fera gagner notre vie et permet de créer des emplois pour lutter contre l'immigration clandestine qui a fini de faire partir presque tous les jeunes du village. Nous avons besoin de ce prêt pour nous équiper en mobilier et aussi construire et équiper les toilletes et le restaurant.

loans.use: Achat de matériaux pour construction et équipement d'une auberge

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Agatha is a young Tanzanian entrepreneur; she is only 24 years old. She has established a store that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric, about 1.5m by 1m, often with a border (called pindo in Swahili) along all four sides , and a central part (called mji) that differs in design from the borders. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print applied by a rotary printing machine. Most often it is a multicolored, dark wax print on a lighter background. Kitenge is similar to the kanga, but of a thicker cloth and has edging on the long side only. Kitenge is also a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. Sales from Agatha’s store enable her to earn approximately $US200 per month. She is requesting a loan of $US275 in order to purchase wholesale quantities of cloth that she can retail for a handsome profit. With these increased profits, she hopes to expand her business in the future.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies in wholesale to boost her business

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: MAMADOU G. EST NE A BAMBEY EN 1958.il est gérant d'une boulangerie dans son quartier situé au dvf de bambey .avec le ramadan il veut augmenter son stock de farine  c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Mamadou G. was born in Bambey in 1958. He runs a bakery in his neighborhood in Bambey. He is requesting this loan because he wants to increase his flour supply for the upcoming observance of Ramadan.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase flour supply for bakery

loans.name: Molealii

texts.en: Molealii A., 49, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in a plantation and cattle farming business. She sells to the general public and villagers two days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD). SPBD loans are Molealii's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Molealii runs two businesses and mainly works on the taro plantation, while her husband works in the farm. Her main aim is that one day, she can be independent without borrowing anymore.

loans.use: To purchase weedkiller chemicals such as Gromozone, Sting and Roundup, fertilizers and fencing for cattle.

loans.name: Srey Pov

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Pov S. is a villager in Phngeas Village in Takeo Province.

She is a rice farmer. She harvests her field and therefore earns most of her revenue in February. Her husband Mr. Nop Koeurn is a pig breeder. Since the pig-breeding business is going well, he wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. Srey Pov S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for the business. With the rest of the loan amount, she will buy fertilizers to help support her field and make the soil more fertile.

Mrs. Srey Pov S. is 31 years old. She is the mother one child. Her child is only four years old and too young to work or study.

Mr. Nop Koeurn is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets and fertilizers

loans.name: Goundo

texts.fr: Goundo Cissé, 58 ans, mariée avec des enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Missirah depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut  acheter des tissus et les produits de teinture pour renforcer son activité de teinture et de commercialisation. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Goundo Cissé, age 58, is married and has children in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group Missirah for a year and a half. She wants to buy cloth and dye materials to bolster her business in dyeing and marketing. Her income will enable her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dyeing and selling clothing

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia T. is forty-eight years old. She is a married woman and has given birth to six children. Two of her children have completed high school and desire to go further to the tertiary level. The rest are still in the basic school.

Afia works to help her husband to provide for the family. As hard-working as she is, Afia runs two different types of businesses concurrently. She works in palm oil production and at the same time, fries ripe plantains. She has been able to combine these two businesses for thirty good years, long before she got married. 

Afia buys palm fruits from the surrounding villages to prepare the oil and distributes it to other oil dealers at wholesale prices. She also buys plantains from the farmers in her locality, keeps them till they get ripe, fries them in the afternoon and sells the fries to the people in her community. 

Afia wants a loan to buy her materials such as palm nuts, plantains, etc. in bulk to be able to serve a number of people. She belongs to the All Nation Trust Bank group where the members guarantee for one another as collateral so as to access the loan. She was in attendance during her group meeting when her photo was taken.

loans.use: To procure palm fruits, etc. in bulk

loans.name: But

texts.en: But N., 43, lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She earns a living as a local cultivator, as well as raising pigs for additional income. She has been earning an average of $3 per day since 1983. She is married and has five children—three of them are married and two are single and in school—while her husband is working with her in the business. N. is running her business very well with her pig raising, which she can raise at least twice a year. Because pigs are the main way for her to earn income and to expand her business, she is applying for a loan to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Armenza Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Armenza es casada, junto a su marido son propietarios de una pulperia que le brinda a sus clientes productos de consumo a bajos precios, lo que le permite mantener un mercado local constante y fijo.  El marido muy temprano garantiza la mercaderia para que su esposa se encargue de venderla a los clientes, su sueño es contar con estantes que le permitan exibir mas su negocio y fortalecer su inventario, para lo que solicita este credito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Armenza is married and together with her husband they are owners of a local store that offers consumer products at low prices for their clients, which allows them to run this constant and regular local market. The husband gets the merchandise very early so that the wife is in charge of selling it to the clients. Her dream is to have shelves that will allow her to display more of her business and strengthen her inventory, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her local store

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Eleuterio M. se dedica a su trabajo de venta de artesanías en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León. Es importante destacar que el señor Eleuterio es viudo y con cuatro hijos que mantener y es por esta razón que duplica sus esfuerzos para mantener a sus amados hijos.

Al darse cuenta que las artesanías como lo son las alcancías de barro se están agotando ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de dichos productos ya que le es de mucha necesidad adquirirlos en este momento.
texts.en:
Mr. Eleuterio M. dedicates himself to his work in the sale of handicrafts in the municipality of Telica in the city of León. It is important to emphasize that Eleuterio is widowed with four children whom he supports and it is for this reason that he doubles his efforts to be able for maintain his beloved children. When he noticed that his handicrafts, which are clay piggy banks, were running out he solicited a loan for purchase of said products given that it is very necessary for him to acquire more at this moment.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts.

loans.name: Hacienda Santa Catarina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Hacienda Santa Catarina esta integrado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras:

La Sra Carmen inicio con este negocio porque era una forma facil de trabajar desde casa y no descuidar a su hijo comenzó hace 6 años con el negocio de venta de  comidas, inicio vendiendo en su casa y actualmente vende sus comidas en los mercados rodantes. 

La Sra. Claudia inicio con este negocio para junto con los ingresos de su esposo darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de  vida, ella necesitaba un ingreso adicional aparte de un salario de su esposo por lo cual inicio con la venta de comidas que le funciono muy bien y asi que en su casa no faltara nada. Comenzó su negocio hace aproximadamente  2 años vendiendo comidas fuera de su casa y actualmente tambien vende en la cooperativa de una escuela cercana a su casa, por lo que sus ventas se han incrementado.

La Sra Esperanza inicio su negocio porque queria ser independiente y tener su propio negocio, comenzo vendiendo afuera de su casa y con los vecinos, acutalmente  tambien vende tambien en mercados rodantes 

Ellas necesitan un prestamo por MXN $16,000 que pagaran en 6 meses  para comprar materia prima   que les hacen falta  y poder continuar con sus negocios.
texts.en:
The group Hacienda Santa Catarina is composed of 3 enterprising women: Carmen began her business because it was an easy way to work from home and to care for her child. She began this business 6 years ago by selling food; she began selling at her home, and currently sells her food at local markets. Claudia began her business to be able to, when combined with her husband’s income, give her children a better quality of life. She needed an additional income aside from her husband’s salary, for which she began selling food, which served her well so that her home would lack nothing. She began her business approximately 2 years ago selling food outside her home, and currently she sells in a cooperative at a school close to her house, which has lead to an increase in her sales. Esperanza began her business because she wanted to be independent and have her own business. She began by selling outside her home with her neighbors, and currently also sells at local markets. They need a loan of 16,000 MXN that they will pay in 6 months to purchase basic materials that they need to be able to continue with their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Thảo

texts.en:
Thảo B. is a 39 year-old female living in the town of Nam Định.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Thảo and her husband are running a successful family business which is specialized in producing window gratings.  The  main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling these grilles to local businesses and community members.  Thảo has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4200000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2002, Thảo joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thảo has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.  Thảo is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Thảo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About TYM Fund:

The mission of TYM Fund is to improve the quality of life of poor Vietnamese women in rural areas by providing credit and savings to groups of fund members to enhance their participation & role in society.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia  es socia del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor del Distrito de Mazo-Cruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, de estado conviviente con 3 hijos, vive en el barrio Jose Antonio Chávez y cuenta con estudios de 2to de primaria. 
La señora viene trabajando con el MMR hace 1 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar el capital para su negocio de compra y venta de fibra. En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitirá incrementara su negocio, Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para construir su casa lo que mas le gusta es todo.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of the Dios es Amor community bank in the Mazo-Cruz district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 36, has 3 children, and lives with her common law husband in the Jose Antonio Chávez neighborhood. She has a second grade education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year. She used her first loan of 500 PEN to increase her working capital for her business of buying and selling wool. She currently needs a new loan for 1,000 PEN, which will allow her to increase her business. Her biggest desire is to keep working to build her house. What she likes the best (about Manuela Ramos) is everything.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
La señora Mauricia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero” del distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de estado civil casada, tiene 31 años de edad y 2 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa.  Vive en la Av. Ilo. Nº 284.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años e inicio su negocio de abarrotes con un préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que le sirvió de capital.
Actualmente ella pretende ampliar su negocio y adquirir más mercadería (cereales, enlatados, bebidas, entre otros)  para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, con ello podrá mejorar sus ingresos y ampliar su negocio (mini market).
texts.en:
Mauricia belongs to the Rio Desaguadero Community Bank in the Desaguadero district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is married, is 31 years old and has two children. She has completed high school. She lives at 284 Av. llo. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for eight years and began her grocery business with a loan of 300 soles, which served as capital. Currently, she wants to expand her business and acquire more merchandise (cereals, canned goods, drinks, among other items) for which she requires a loan of 2000 soles. WIth this, she will be able to improve her income and expand her mini-market business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cereals, canned goods, drinks, sodas, among other items.

loans.name: Bay's Group

texts.en:
Bảy Thị Nguyễn was born in 1960. (no: 010102090013). She and her husband are farmers. They raise geese, groose and grow vegetables. There are four people in her family. Two of her sons are workers. They have a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy food for domestic animals. There are three other Fund participants in her group. 
 Loan Thị Đỗ was born in 1973. (no: 010102090012). She lives with her husband and two children. Her loan  size is  4142 000 VND. She will use this loan to buy food for poultry and fish. 
 Bé Thị Nguyễn was 1961. (no: 010102090028). She is a worker. She wants to borrow 3.706.000 VND to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy food for domestic animals

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Mbaye S. travaille en dans le secteur des assurances. Ce prêt lui servira d’agrandir ses locaux et d’acquérir de nouveaux équipements pour la visibilité et l’accueil de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mbaye S. works in the insurance sector. He will use this loan to expand his premises and to obtain new furnishings and equipment for visibility and to welcome his clients.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equipment and Furnishings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional supplies in bulk for her shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth E. bakes and sells bread at Ateku near Elmina. Elizabeth has received no formal education.  She is married and has three children. Her husband is a tailor. Elizabeth has been selling bread since 2007. She is responsible for paying school fees. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients to bake the bread for sale. She hopes reinvest the new profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to bake the bread for sale

loans.name: Akojo

texts.en:
Akojo L. 30 years marries a soldier and has two children who all go to school. She lives a half km from Hai game market in Buluk town, Juba. She travels on foot to her business resturant. She sells different types of foodstuffs in her resturant and requests a loan to purchase more foodstuffs, cooks and sells to her customers in her resturant. In the future, Akojo aims at pay the school fees of her children upto University level.


 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell in the resturant

loans.name: Rahimakhon

texts.en:
Rahimakhon is a widow and the mother of four children. Her women’s clothing business has been a valuable source of income for her family over the past 15 years that she’s been in business. Rahimakhon is hardworking, polite and a communicative entrepreneur. She has a focus on service and loves being able to help women with their clothing needs. Rahimakhon has requested a loan of $1000 US to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new women's clothing for the spring season

loans.name: Las Muñequitas Group

texts.es:
Ana Lisbet C. M. es la coordinadora del grupo, a sus 27 años es una mujer muy esforzada, ella trabaja en un café de la zona y aparte vende cosméticos de la AVON y Zermat.

Inicio su negocio de venta de cosméticos a raíz de que su cuñada la motivara a hacerlo. Ella pensó que era un ingreso extra y que debía intentarlo. Ha sido muy exitoso para ella y le ayuda con los gasto en su hogar. Con tres hijos pequeños y su esposo ayudándole, tiene como meta mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Ana pretende invertir su crédito en la compra de una paca de ropa de segunda mano que venderá en su casa, pero su mayor sueño es poner un café pequeño ya que trabaja en uno y tiene experiencia en esto. Pretende alcanzar sus sueños con disciplina crediticia y esfuerzo.

Anghel trabaja en la venta de cosméticos al igual que Ana y Francisco tiene una caponera (Bicicleta de carga) que trabaja y desea con este crédito adquirir otra para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana Lisbet C. M. is the group’s coordinator. She is an energetic, 27 years old woman. She works in a local café and in addition sells Avon and Zermat cosmetics.

She started her business of selling cosmetics encouraged by her sister-in-law. She thought that it would be an extra income and that she should try it. The activity has been very successful and it helps her meeting her household expenses. Having three young sons and a husband who helps her, her goal is to improve their life conditions.

Ana intends to invest the loan in buying a bunch of second hand clothes to sell from her house, but her greatest dream is to start a small café since she works for one and has experience in this business. She intends to achieve her dreams with discipline, credibility and effort.

Anghel works selling cosmetics just as Ana, and Francisco has a “caponera” (freight bicycle) with which he works. He desires to use this loan to buy another “caponera” in order to improve his income.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Lot of second hand clothes

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: A. Otgonbayar is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Zavkhan province in western Mongolia. Her son and daughter both attend a local secondary school, and her husband is a taxi driver. They all live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Otgonbayar operates a small grocery trading business in her town. Currently, due to a lack of having an adequate selling location and place to store her products, she only operates her business during the summer. Otgonbayar started her grocery trading business in 1999 when she began growing and selling her own vegetables. For the future, she plans to rent a stall in a large market where she can sell year round. She is focused on growing her business, and says, "I want to buy 2 more hectares of land to grow more vegetables". She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase vegetables to sell this winter.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell this winter

loans.name: María

texts.es: María H. reside en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposo y, tres hijos y una nieta llamada Esmeralda de 4 años de edad. A pesar que los hijos de María son mayores de edad, ella los sigue apoyando en sus estudios. Don Valentín esposo de María tiene 62 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de pan y María por su parte tiene un negocio ubicado en el mercado donde vende variedad de verduras y frutas por el cual ahora solicita de este crédito, ya que quiere surtir su negocio para la época de noviembre y diciembre por que sus ventas aumentan.
texts.en:
María H. lives in the department of La Libertad with her husband, their three children, and a granddaughter named Esmeralda who is 4 years old. Even though her children are adults, María continues to support their education. Her husband, Don Valentín, is 62 years old and sells bread. In turn, María has a business located in the market where sells a variety of vegetables and fruits.

She is now requesting a loan so that she can restock her business for the months of November and December and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Adonai Group

texts.en:
Comfort is 28 years old. She is married and has four children. She says that with the help of God all her children attend school and she is happy about that.

Comfort owns and operates a grocery shop in her neighborhood where she lives. She sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits (cookies) and cosmetic products, etc. She works very hard in taking care of the family and sees her children as her future leaders who would one day change family hardships and living situations.

Comfort requests the loan support to buy stock in bulk to increase her inventory. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school. She would be more than happy for your support.

Comfort is the leader of a trust bank group called “Adonai”. She is the one seated in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers, etc.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk to increase her inventory

loans.name: Vaga

texts.en: Vaga T. is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Pesega. She is married and does not have any children. Vaga owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling a variety of food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. In 2009, Vaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Uch S., 40, is a local basket weaver who learned the trade from her grandmother.  She also sells baskets that she gets from her husband's production, or buys from other weavers. The family lives with two children who are already enrolled in public school. Uch S. is asking for a loan to buy baskets from other weavers in order to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy baskets from other weavers in order to meet the needs of her customers

loans.name: Santa Rita Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento SANTA RITA se caracteriza por ser un banco formado por socias antiguas, actualmente la mayoria D. las señoras se dedica a la venta D. productos como: celulares, productos D. belleza, ollas D. aluminio,atención en su tienda D. barrio y otras a la elaboración D. mantas, macrame y tejidos.VIQUI, Esta socia es una D. las más antiguas ocupa el cargo D. presidenta, la Sra. trabaja con tejidos y macrame, con el prestamo podra comprar por mayor lana ,cintas, y D. esta manera a conseguido diversificar sus productos y no solo realizar tejidos para niños, sino tambien recibir pedidos para damas y varones, con este aumento D. productos a incrementado sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad D. vida. ADRIANA, esta participando en su segundo ciclo, tiene a su cargo la secretaria, ella  trabaja en una empresa D. limpieza, pero como su sueldo no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es que ella deciD. emprender otro negocio con tejido en macrame, con el prestamo otorgado podra comprar material para elaborar mantas a pedido ,mejorando así sus ingresos D. ella y su familia. LUCILA, ocupa el cargo D. tesorera, tiene una familia D. 4 miembros, ella tiene una tienda D. barrio, con el prestamo podra comprar por mayor y diversificar los productos D. su negocio, con los ingresos piensa ahorrar para comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
The enterprise bank Santa Rita is characterized by being maD. up of senior members. Currently the majority of the women make a living by selling products such as cell phones, beauty products, or aluminum pots; attending to a neighborhood store; or making blankets, macramé, or hand-woven items. Viqui is the most senior member and is the president of the group. She works by weaving and making macramé. She will use this loan to buy wool wholesale and ribbon and to diversify her products so she doesn't only weave items for children, but also for women and men. With this increase in products, she will be able to increase her income and quality of life. Adriana is participating in her second loan. She is the secretary of the group and works for a cleaning company. Since her wages don't let her cover all of the costs of supporting her family, she decided to start another business by weaving macramé. With this loan, she will be able to buy materials to make her blankets for which she takes orders and will improve her and her family's income. Lucila is the treasurer of the group and has four people in her family. She has a neighborhood store. With this loan, she will buy items wholesale and diversify the products in her business. With her income, she plans to save money to buy some land.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her amount of merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Idalia C. Z. vende mercadería como pantalones, blusas, ropa interior, perfumees, pinturas y panas en distintos sectores del departamento de Estelí principalmente en sus municipios como Condega y san Juan de Limay y pueblo nuevo.
	
Rosa idalia utilizara el crédito para la comprar y vender la mercadería en los sectores ya mencionados su negocio comenzó vendiendo perfumees en san Juan de Limay y su negocio creció ya que su esposo le propuso que se dedicaran a vender ropa en otros sectores además de perfumees. Rosa es una vendedora ambulante no tiene establecido su negocio en un lugar estático pero le va muy bien ella sale a vender tres beses a la semana ella antes se dedicaba a la agricultura con su esposo.
 
Rosa espera que con el crédito le baya muy bien ya que las ventas suben para esta fecha y cree que tendrá mayores ingresos, ella es casada y tiene una hija de 4 años trabaja junto con su esposo, sus padres no viven con ella y tiene su casa propia donde vive con su familia. Este es el sexto crédito que tiene con Ceprodel y el primero que se le da para comercio ya que los otros eran para  agricultura donde nos dijo que se encuentra agradecida con Ceprodel por los servicios que se le han dado ya que le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones de vida mejorando su negocio y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa Idalia C. Z. sells goods such as pants, blouses, underwear, perfumes, paintings and corduroy in various areas of the Estelí department, mainly in its municipalities like Condega and San Juan de Limay and Pueblo Nuevo. Rosa Idalia will use the loan to purchase and sell goods in the above mentioned areas. Her business started by selling perfumes in San Juan de Limay. Her business has grown since her husband suggested to her that they sell clothes in other areas and well as perfumes. Rosa is a street vendor, she has not established her business in a fixed place but it has worked very well. She goes out selling three times per week. Previously she farmed with her husband. Rosa hopes that the loan will work well since sales have been rising to date and she believes that she will earn a greater income. She is married and has a 4 year old daughter, and she works together with her husband. Her parents don't live with her and she has her own house where she lives with her family. This is her sixth loan with Ceprodel and the first she has been given for trade since the others were for farming where she told us that she was grateful to Ceprodel for the services that they have given her since they have helped her to improve her living conditions, her business and her income.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE GOODS FOR SALE

loans.name: Urunbek

texts.ru: Каршиев Урунбек проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Каршиев Урунбек имеет среднее образование. Растениеводством занимается более 5 лет. Он вносит удобрение и обрабатывает почву разными способами. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Urunbek K. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. Urunbek has a secondary education. He has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He uses fertilizer and treats the soil by various other methods. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Marta Ester

texts.es:
Doña Marta Ester P. Ocho, quien actualmente cuenta con 25 años de edad, y reside
en el municipio de san Antonio Suchitepéquez, solicita su crédito especialmente para el 
mejoramiento de educación de sus dos hijos, la cual ella tiene la visión de mejorar 
las condiciones de vida de sus niños, ella anteriormente se dedica a oficios domésticos 
pero la cual con el tiempo se profesionalizo y tiene actualmente un trabajo que lo 
ayuda al sostén de la vida diaria, pero se vio en la necesidad de elaborar el préstamo 
porque lo que le ingresa no son suficientes para satisfacer todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
