Marta Ester P. Ocho, 25, lives in San Antonio Suchitepéquez. She is requesting funding to improve the education of her two children. She hopes to thus improve their living conditions. She used to be a domestic worker but she has gradually received training and has become more professional; she now has a job that helps her with her daily expenses. However, she needs funding because her earnings aren't sufficient to meet all her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay annual tuition for her two children.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim K. is 43 years old and is a villager who lives in Chrak Chi Koam village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bav Keam, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. Mrs. Khim K. is also rice seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family.

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Khim K. wants to expand it. Thus she decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy more rice to sell to continue enlarging her business.

Mrs. Khim K. is the mother of eight children, three of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other five are students in the public school and also support their parents' business. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Mira's Group

texts.en: Bokonbaevo is a village which is located at the shore of Lake Issyk-Kyl. It is one of the most visited places by tourists from all over the world. The villagers are very hospitable and well-wishing people. One of them is Mira B., the leader of this group. When Mira’s husband died, only her newborn son gave her the strength to go ahead. She totally dedicated herself to her son. Still, a wound that has never healed sometimes cuts the ground from under her feet but, looking at how her son is growing up and how he just looks like his father, she understands that life is terrific. Also, Mira has understood that wishes do not wash dishes, so she has had to do something for a living. With 500 KGS ($12) in her pocket, she started her little business selling a particular sort of potatoes, which later on turned out to be big business. Now Mira deals with the harvest of potatoes and sells them in the market. Her revenue is 3,450 KGS ($80) and she gets a pension of about 716 KGS ($16). She is planning to provide education for her son and to buy a house. Mira decided to buy 500kg of potatoes with the loan which she wants to obtain from Mol Bulak Finance. Anarkul K. is a forty-seven-year-old married woman with three children. Her eldest daughter is a student and the rest are schoolboys. Her husband is a driver for a company and earns 8,000 KGS ($180). She makes national items and sells them. She started her business with 2,000 KGS ($45) and her revenue is now 4,000 KGS ($90). She plans to provide education for her children, marry off her eldest son and finish building a shed. She wants to obtain a loan for sowing wheat. Kurmanbubu T. is a fifty-year-old woman who is married and has a daughter. Her husband works for a company and his salary is from 3,000 KGS ($70) to 7,000 KGS ($160). She makes national items to sell and her profit is 2,000 KGS ($45) per month. She wants to obtain a loan to buy materials for making more items. Aynura S. is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman. She has a husband and two children. Her husband is a worker and earns 15,000 KGS ($340) in the summer. She has a shop where she sells daily foodstuffs and her revenue is 10,000 KGS ($227) per month. By obtaining a loan she wants to buy a refrigerator for ice cream. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy 500kg of potatoes to sell

loans.name: Inés

texts.es: La señora O. tiene una pulpería ubicada en la comarca Los Altos jurisdicción de Masaya,  ella ofrece diferentes tipos de productos, es madre soltera y a cargo tiene un hijo el cual es el que le ayuda en el negocio después que viene de clases. Ella está visitando las Oficinas de CEPRODEL para que le den un financiamiento para la compra de arroz Faizán, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, gaseosas, arroz Doña María y detergentes;  y de esta forma surtiendo más su negocio tener un poco más de ganancia y darle una vida digna y cómoda a su hijo.
texts.en:
La señora O. has a small grocery store in the Los Altos region, Mayasa jurisdiction. She sells a variety of products. She is a single mother, and her son helps her in the store after school. She is visiting the office of CEPRODEL (local lending institution) to obtain a loan for the purchase of Faizán rice, sugar, oil, beans, soft drinks, Doña María rice, and detergents. These purchases will replenish her inventory, boost her earnings a little, and give a decent, comfortable life to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Faizán rice, sugar, oil, beans, soft drinks, Doña María rice, and detergents

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 32 años D. edad, es casada y tiene un hijo dependiente, vive junto a su esposo en el sector 18 D. Febrero, una zona urbano – marginal D. la ciudad D. Lambayeque, conocida por sus atractivos turísticos y por tener un comercio que se ha venido expandiendo en los ultimos años, actualmente es una D. las ciudades eje en el comercio D. la región, queda ubicada a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace un año a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Ella adquiere su mercadería en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista D. la región) y luego la ofrece a sus clientes, como el negocio es una fuente importante D. ingresos familiares, Ana María trata D. mantenerlo ofreciendo un buen trato a sus clientes.

La bodega ha ido creciendo y la demanda D. los clientes también, Ana María desea ampliar su establecimiento con la compra D. abarrotes D. modo que pueda satisfacer la creciente demanda que su negocio vieve experimentando, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ana María es una mujer bastante entregada a su familia y que siempre piensa en su progreso. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Ella es una mujer conocida y estimada por sus vecinos, ellos la consideran una mujer responsable y D. confianza.
texts.en:
Ana María, 32, is married and has one, dependent son; she lives with her husband in a marginal urban area of Lambayeque, called 18 D. Febrero, which is known for its tourist attractions and for having undergone impressive commercial growth in the last few years; currently it’s a commercial hub in the area located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last year she has had a grocery store installed in her home. She buys her merchandise in the Moshoqueque market (regional wholesale market) for resale later to her customers. Because the business is an important source of family income, Ana María does her best to maintain it and offer good customer service. The store has gradually grown and customer demand has too. Ana María wants to expand it buying more merchandise to meet the growing customer demand that her business is experiencing. She, therefore, is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1000 new sol, loan to help her meet this goal. Ana María is quite dedicated to her family and is always thinking of ways to help it make progress. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to proviD. them with a better quality of life. She is well-known and well-liked by her neighbors who deem her responsible and trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Dulce Honestidad Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dulce Honestidad está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Teresa Yesenia  García A. de 29 años quien desde hace dos años empezó ofertando los productos de la marca Avon, reconocida en Nicaragua por sus ventas vía catalogo. 
Este ha ido aumentando poco a poco gran parte de esto es debido a los prestamos y a la capacitación que les brido Adim donde aprendieron a invertir y tener una mejor atención al cliente y posibles socias. Ella con el crédito compra varios encargos que tiene en cosméticos y perfumes de dicha marca.
Sus compañeros de grupo son Verónica Lorena A. Martínez quien se dedica al comercio de cosméticos vía catalogo y ropa intima de diferentes marcas y Wilfredo A. C. es propietario de una zapatería.  Ellos invertirán el crédito en mercadería para sus negocios y así aumentarlos.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Honestidad” (Sweet Honesty) Group consists of three strong, hardworking, and enterprising individuals. The group coordinator is a young woman named Teresa Yesenia García A. who is 29 years of age. She started a business two years ago offering Avon products, which are well-known in Nicaragua, through catalog sales. Her business has been increasing gradually partly due to the loans and training classes that ADIM has provided. She learned how to invest and provide better service to her customers and potential members. Teresa will use her loan to buy cosmetics and perfumes to fulfill various orders.

Her fellow group members are Verónica Lorena A. Martínez, who sells cosmetics through a catalog and intimate apparel of various brands, and Wilfredo A. C., who owns a shoe store. They will invest their loan in merchandise so as to increase their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & perfumes

loans.name: Faithful Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Faithful” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Rugiatu M. (pictured third from left) is the leader of this group. Rugiatu is married to a security guard and they have three children. Rugiatu has been a businesswoman for three years now. She sells locally dyed cloths called “gara lappers”. With her share of this loan, she will buy materials like white cotton, caustic soda, inks, powder, rubber bowls, hand gloves, etc. to make more gara lappers in order to further expand her business. 

(In the photo is also loan officer Zainab B. who is handing over the loan to the group).

loans.use: To buy white cotton, caustic soda, inks, powder, rubber bowls, hand gloves, etc. to make gara lappers

loans.name: Khushbo Jalel Group

texts.en: Tamana is 30 years old and the leader of the Khushbo Jalel group.  She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan.  Tamana is married and has six children.  She wants a loan to support her husband.  He is a butcher, with four years of experience and his income supports their family.  He works hard and wakes up early in the morning to produce a higher monthly income.  Tamana is requested this loan to expand his business by making his shop larger.  Both are grateful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Help husband expand his business.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto P. de 26 años es una persona responsable, trabajadora y esforzada quien  tiene un pequeño negocio junto con su esposa el cual inicio hace cinco años con el propósito de salir adelante.  Ellos venden nacatamales, enchiladas,  carne asada y tacos desde viernes, sábado y domingo. 

P. invertirá en granos básicos, carne, maíz, carbón, leña, verduras…etc.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto P., 26 years old, is a responsible, hard working, determined person who has a small business with his wife which he began 5 years ago with a plan of getting ahead. They sell nacatamales [corn cakes filled with meat and vegetables and steamed in banana leaves], enchiladas, roast meat, and tacos on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. P. will invest in basic grains, meat, corn, charcoal, firewood, vegetables, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, corn, charcoal, fire wood, and vegetabes.

loans.name: Jenalin

texts.en:
Jenalin G., 27, wants to make sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Jenalin is married to Roel G.. She has been supplementing her husband's income by managing her own ice-cream business for the past few years.

Jenalin has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She has been consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her ice-cream business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as additional capital for buying equipment and raw ingredients needed to continue the production and supply of ice-cream.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also dreams of having her own house and a land someday.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying equipment and raw ingredients for ice-cream production and supply

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda D. is from the village of Brgy.Lantap, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Yolanda owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To improve his business by purchasing additional cartons of frozen meat and pig feet

loans.name: Nancy Yessenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy;  Ella tiene 35 años de edad  y es madre casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la administración de su tienda abarrotes, ella a implementado un espacio en la misma tienda en el cual a puesto algunos artículos de librería. La socia necesita implementar con mayor mercadería.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la tienda abarrotes en el área de librería con mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the "Manos Juntas" ("Joint Hands") loan group, based in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. Nancy is 35 years old. She is married with 2 children. She has a grocery store and has fitted out a space in the store as bookshop. She needs to stock up on merchandise. She is requesting the loan to invest in her grocery store, particularly in merchandise for the bookshop area in the store. She is grateful for the loan, which she values very much, and pledges to pay it back in the agreed terms.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for the bookshop space in her grocery store.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.es:
Lelia  es socia del Banco comunal “Las Retamas” desde hace seis años atrás, pertenece al distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene estudios superior incompleto.
Lelia tiene tres hijos.

Actualmente se dedica a la artesanía, elabora todo tipo de prendas de vestir, vende a los turistas nacionales e internacionales en el Hotel “TAYPI HUASI”. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles,  invirtió en su negocio de comida rápida que vendía en ese entonces.

Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizará para comprar  lana de alpaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de artesanía. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.

Notese en la foto junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Lelia has been a member of the Banco Comunal “Las Retamas” ("Broom flowers" Communal Bank) for six years; she lives in the Puno district (located in a province and region bearing the same name), she is 40 years old, she is married and has attended high school but did not complete her studies. Lelia has three children. She is currently engaged in craftsmanship, preparing every type of items of clothing that she then sells to national and international tourist at the Taypi Huasi Hotel. The first loan she requested to Movimiento Manuela Ramos, amounting to 300.00 PEN, was used to invest in her fast food shop, activity she was running at that time. She will request a new loan of 1000.00 PEN that she will use to buy Alpaca wool. In the future she desires to own a craftsmanship shop; the savings are what she likes the most about her Communal Bank. In the picture she is portrayed together with her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Alpaca wool

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 40 años D. edad y vive junto a sus seis hijos en el municipio D. Corinto en Morazán; ella al igual que todas las personas del área rural se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias criando cerdos, ganado, gallinas y además siembra granos básicos como maíz y maicillo, con la ayuda D. sus hijos mayores quienes se encargar del trabajo más pesado, ellos dependen D. estos ingresos que les genera el trabajo agropecuario.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. cerdos pequeños para aumentar su granja y poder comercializarlos cuando estos ya estén gordos y grandes, esta inversión ayudara a mejorar la comercialización D. Reyna y incrementaran las ganancias para su familia, el único riesgo con el negocio es que sus animales se enfermen o que al momento D. la venta los precios sean muy bajos.
Las aspiraciones D. Reyna son contar con una granja más granD., ayudar a sus seis hijos y que estos se superen para que puedan tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Reyna, 40, lives with her six children in Corinto, Morazán. She, like most of the area residents, is in farming and raises farm animals like pigs, cattle and chickens. She also farms basic grains like corn and sorghum with help from her older children who do the heavier tasks. They depend on the income these labors generate. She is asking for funds to buy small pigs to increase her farm and to sell them when they get big and fat. The investment will help her sales and increase profits for her family. The only risk her business faces is if the animals get sick or if prices drop when it’s time to sell them. Reyna’s hopes for the future is to have a larger farm and to help her six children better themselves so that they can have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Rebecca Aba Amosiwa

texts.en: Rebecca Aba Amosiwa M. sells 'gari' at Elmina. Rebecca has no educational background. She is divorced and has five dependents. She has been in this trade for six years now. She sees to the well-being of her family with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more 'gari' to sell. She anticipates reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more 'gari' (manioc grits) to sell

loans.name: Khoun

texts.en: Khoun S., 39, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She is a professional tailor, making $1 a day and staying at home looking after her children. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver who rides a motorbike with a trailer attached. On average, he makes US$5 of profit every day. This couple has four children, three are in school and one is a garment factory worker. To earn more profit, she is asking for a loan of US$300 to raise pigs.

loans.use: To raise pigs

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida T. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 35 years old. Aida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aida has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Aida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Aida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa M. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Baod, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  hog raising and buying and selling of firewood. Her husband, Librado M., who is 45 years old, works as a carpenter (foreman) to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 13 children who are between 2 and 23 years old. Two of her children are married, three are working and four are currently going to school.

Narcisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Narcisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital, so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Narcisa M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.
	
About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza M. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Liza is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Liza owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Liza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Liza is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Liza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru: Бабакулов Фаррух проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 34 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Фаррух занимается растениеводством. Он арендует не большой участок земли для посева картошки и пшеницы. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения семян и минеральных удобрений. Фаррух хочет получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Farrukh B. lives in Shahrituz.  He is 34 years old, married, and has two children. His wife works on a small farm.  Farrukh farms.  He rents a small plot to grow potato and wheat crops.  He has been doing this for five years.  He is taking out a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. Farrukh’s goal is to reap a good harvest and sell it.

loans.use: buying seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Dalerjon

texts.en:
D. Dalerjon is 22 years old. He is a very diligent and hard-working guy. He provides taxi services with his car. For the last three years his  business had been the main income for his large family, allowing him to improve their living conditions. 

As with any business generating income, Dalerjon also requires some investments from time to time. Now his car needs some repairs, so Dalerjon requests 4,000 TJS for purchasing spare parts. He promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all who support him.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mrs. Stella  B. is from the village of Baybay Triumpo, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Stella owns and operates a mini-restaurant in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 23 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In February 2010, Stella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC.

Stella is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional food ingredients for her mini-restaurant. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future emergencies.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional food ingredients

loans.name: Andrena

texts.en:
Andrena M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 28 and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Andrena owns a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Andrena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Andrena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es: El Sr. Jorge Armando, tiene una vivienda L. cual esta  remodelando ya que  se  encuentra  un poco deteriorada tanto  del  interior  como exterior D. L. casa, el se preocupa por L. buena imagen y como tiene muchas visitas  D. sus  familiares  y amigos  el desea brindarles  una buena impresión. Actualmente le ha estado  realizando mejoras a L. vivienda sobre todo por L. inseguridad  y piensa que al poner protecciones a L. vivienda, el  se sentirá mas protegido  y cuando se  encuentre  trabajando  estará mas tranquilo.
texts.en: Sr. Jorge Armando is remodeling his house because it is seriously in need of repairs, both insiD. and out.  He cares how the house looks because he often has friends and family to stay and he wants the house to make a good impression.  He is especially concerned about security and the improvements he's planning incluD. measures to make it more secure.  He says that when the house is better protected, he'll feel more easy when he's away at work.

loans.use: Security for house.

loans.name: Swagira

texts.en:
Swagira N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. Swagira has a business of selling clothes. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works seven days out of every week. Swagira has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

The main business challenge for Swagirah is seasonality and ever increasing prices of clothes. Her goal is to build her own home and start importing clothes. Swagirah lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married, 52-year-old man. He and his wife have four children, the youngest of whom is still in school. He lives with his family in the Kisii Town area of South Rift, Kenya.

He has been in the farming business for 30 years now. He employs two farmhands on a permanent basis and four on a temporary basis. His farm produces milk, maize, onions, and cabbage. He is wholly dependent on his farming operations to support his family's standard of living. Robert laments animal diseases, which significantly harm farmers' businesses, as well as fluctuating weather conditions, which sometimes destroy crops before the harvest.

Robert is requesting a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES ($375) from Juhudi Kilimo in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional income he expects to generate as a result of the loan will allow him to pay for his family's basic needs, especially his youngest child's education expenses. He is optimistic about the future and plans on expanding his farm through the purchase of more land.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Villa Bolivia Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Villa Bolivia esta ubicado en el barrio villa Bolivia de la zona del plan 3000, esta conformada por 10 integrantes todas mujeres. La presidenta es la Sra. Yoana ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana en diferentes ferias de la zona del plan 3000, ella viaja a la ciudad de Oruro a comprar su mercadería, actividad a la que dedica hace bastante tiempo y le va muy bien,  tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería. La mayoría de las socias de Villa Bolivia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, promotoras y venta de ropa americana. Villa Bolivia esta en su tercer ciclo. Las socias son personas trabajadoras que quieren salir adelante para darles un futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Villa Bolivia community bank is located in Villa Bolivia neighborhood, in Plan 3000 suburb.  The group has ten members who are all women.  The group's president is Yoana who sells American clothes in different street markets in Plan 3000 suburb.  She travels to the city of Oruro to buy her merchandise.  She has been in this business for quite a while and it is doing very well.  Yoana has two school-age children.  She will use her loan money to buy merchandise.

The other members of Villa Bolivia sell groceries, work as sales reps and sell American clothes.  The group is in its third loan cycle.  The members are hard-working people who would like to get ahead so that they can provide their children with a future.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes

loans.name: Dayirbek

texts.ru:
Дайырбек Хакимов  родился в селе Чельпек (Иссык-Кульская область),  в котором сейчас и проживает. Дайырбеку 49 лет. Он родился  и вырос в многодетной и среднеобеспеченной семье c одиннадцатью детьми, и после окончания школы не смог продолжить обучение в университете из-за тяжелого материального положения.  Дайырбек поступил в техникум  на специальность ветеринар  и параллельно помогал родителям по хозяйству. В 1982-1985 гг. отслужил в армии, служба в которой  помогла закалить его характер. По приходу из армии, Дайырбек начал работать в родном селе ветеринаром  и до сих пор сельские жители обращаются к нему за помощью. В 1996 году, в поисках дополнительного  источника  существования для своей семьи, он решил заняться сельским хозяйством, которое давало большую прибыль, так как к тому времени Дайырбек женился и у него родилась дочь. Дайырбек начал бизнес с 20,000 сом (KGS), купив одну корову и одного бычка для откорма и на сегодняшний день, в его хозяйстве имеется одна дойная корова, одна лошадь и десять овец.  
На данный момент Дайырбеку необходимы денежные средства  в сумме  60, 000 сом  (KGS) для увеличения поголовья скота и расширения бизнеса, так как растут расходы на обучение.  Уже сегодня нужно начать копить деньги на обучение детям в хорошем университете, чтобы они смогли получить достойное образование. 
  Но на этом Дайырбек останавливаться не хочет и в его планах на будущее - покупка кошары с земельной долей и увеличение поголовье скота.
Трудолюбивый  и целеустремленный, ответственный и пунктуальный человек,  оптимист по жизни мечтает создать все условия для счастливой жизни своим детям и дать им уверенность  в завтрашнем дне. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Dayirbek K. was born in the village of Chelpek (in the Issyk-Kul province) where he lives now. Dayirbek is 49 years old. He was born and grew up in a big middle class family with eleven children, but after graduating from high school he could not continue his education in the university due to a difficult financial situation. Dayirbek has enrolled in a technical school with a major in veterinary and at the same time was helping his parents in business. In 1982-1985 he served in the army which helped strengthen his character. After returning from the army Dayirbek began to work in his home village as a veterinarian and to this day the village residents come to him for help. In 1996 in search of an additional source of income for his family he decided to start a business in farming which gave big profits as at that time Dayirbek got married and his daughter was born. Dayirbek started his business with 20,000 KGS and bought just one cow and one calf for feeding, and at this time he has one milk cow, one horse and ten sheep.

Right now Dayirbek needs financial help in the amount of 60,000 KGS to increase the head count of cattle and expansion of business because education expenses are growing. He has to start saving money now for his children's education in a good university so they can get a decent education. But Dayirbek does not want to stop there and his other plans for the future include purchase of a fold with plot of land and increase of cattle head count.

He is hard working and single-minded, responsible and punctual person with an optimistic outlook on life and dreams for creating conditions for a happy life for his children and give them confidence in the days ahead.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a divorced woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a business of buying and selling fruit at the market to her neighbors and passersby. Previously she was a farmer and she sells farm produce, earning her another source of income. Mary faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and purchasing a big farm in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase 30 bags of passion fruit and 10 bags of oranges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 bags of passion fruit and 10 bags of oranges.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas has been running a retail shop for one year in Tala town. Most of his customers are local people who are mostly farmers. He earns an income of KES 1,500 per month. He is married and a father of six children, all in schooling.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a member of KADET, and he has borrowed from FAULU Kenya (MFI). This is his first loan. He intends to use the entire loan amount to add more stock to the retail shop.

In the future, he desires to grow his business and to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for the retail shop, e.g sugar, maize flour, cooking oil.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Adolfo hoy en día, trabaja en servicio de taxi, pues gracias al esfuerzo por obtener mejores cambios, sigue adelante.
 Tiene diez años de estar laborando. Su esposa es comerciante y ayuda con los gastos de la familia, ya que son cuatro hijos los que cursan el año escolar.
Adolfo ha vendido trabajando con financiamiento  a plazos, en diez ciclos, siendo de gran alternativa para dar mantenimiento a su taxi, ya que por circular cada día, tiende a tener más gastos. Teniendo unas veces para repararlo y otras ha sido con los préstamo que ha hecho el cambio de su motor.
Con este nuevo préstamo será para la compra de caja de velocidad, sistema de suspensión delantero y trasero, a si como lubricante que ayude a dar un mejor funcionamiento para ejercer su trabajo.
texts.en:
Adolfo provides a taxi service.  Thanks to his efforts to improve and change, he gets ahead in life.  Adolfo has been working for ten years.  His wife is a saleswoman and she helps him cover their family expenses.  They have four children who are all in school.

Adolfo has been working with loans for ten loan cycles.  It has been very helpful and allowed him to have maintenance work done on his taxi since, because he drives the vehicle every day, he tends to have a lot of expenses.  On some occasions, he has had his taxi repaired and on other occasions he has used his loan to change his engine.

Adolfo will use this new loan to buy a gearbox, front and rear suspension systems and also lubricant which will help his car run better and make it easier to do his work.

loans.use: to change his gearbox and buy lubricants which will improve the condition of his car

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es: Yovana, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer carismática y trabajadora. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pareja John de 29 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Yovana anteriormente laboraba como empleada domestica, pero siempre anhelaba tener su propio negocio. Con sus ahorros acumulados pudo abrir un bazar de venta de ropa, actualmente su puesto es muy concurrido por sus clientes por ofrecer prendas de primera calidad. Ella es una persona muy atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes cordialmente dispuesta a servirles en sus compras, para que así puedan estar satisfechos y retornen nuevamente. Su negocio es muy ordenado y apreciado por su clientela; su comercio lo realiza en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde la atención es de primera calidad, el trabajo lo cumple en compañía de su pareja donde vienen trabajando 06 años. Los proyectos que tiene en mente,  es alquilar un espacio más en el centro comercial para así mejorar y crecer económicamente. Este será su 12avo crédito, esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir creciendo. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará prendas de vestir y para ello tiene que  viajar a la ciudad de lima, pues el comercio de esta mercadería es a bajo precio.
texts.en: Yovana, who is 24 years old, is a charismatic and hard-working woman.  She lives in a rented house together with her partner, 29-year old John, and their 3 dear children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life.  Yovana previously worked as a maid, but she always wished to have her own business.  With her accumulated savings, she was able to open a clothing bazaar.  Currently, her stand is very popular with her customers because she offers high quality clothing.  Yovana is a very attentive person and she always greets her customers cordially, ready to help them with their purchases.  This way, her customers are satisfied and come back again.  Yovana's business is very orderly and valued by her customers.  Her business is in the city of San Francisco, where the service is first rate.  She has worked in the company of her partner for the last 6 years.  The project she has in mind is to rent another space in the commercial district in order to improve and grow economically.  This will be her 12th loan, and she is very happy to know that she once again can count on the support of all of you to keep growing.  With the 2,000 nuevos soles (USD $725), she will purchase clothing.  To do so, Yovana needs to travel to the city of Lima, which where is the sale of this merchandise has a lower price.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 33 years old. He is a husband and father of two daughters and two sons. Ahmed is a farmer growing seasonal vegetables in his land in Jenin city in northern Palestine. Ahmed wants to purchase new seedlings and enrich the variety of vegetables he grows. Ahmed took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the seedlings and fertilizers to make sure he produces a healthy crop and increases his income.

Ahmed is a religious man. Therefore, his wife is photographed instead as he is not comfortable with having his picture on the web.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria trabaja duro para el bienestar de su familia, vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en su casa  que heredó de sus padres. Vende alfalfa desde hace 10 años, así mismo se dedica en la crianza de animales, por otro lado dispone de terrenos propios y alquilados de los cuales cultiva alfalfa. Su trabajo diario consiste en comercializar la alfalfa que cosecha. Ella disfruta mucho de realizar estas tareas, por que al igual que su esposo aporta económicamente para su hogar. Asimismo puede disponer de su horario, por ello planea continuar con sus actividades e incrementar su capital de trabajo. Ya tiene varios ciclos de trabajo con MFP, en todo este tiempo de trabajo anterior ha mejorado significativamente su trabajo de las cuales se siente satisfecha porque siempre ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos. En esta ocasión comprará alfalfa al por mayor.
texts.en:
Gloria works hard for the sake of her family.  She lives with her husband and six children in her own home which she inherited from her parents.  She has been selling alfalfa for ten years and also raises animals.  In addition, she both owns land and rents land where she grows alfalfa.  Her daily work consists of selling the alfalfa that she harvests.  She really enjoys these tasks because it means she is able to contribute financially to her household alongside her husband.  She is also able to set her own hours.  She plans to continue in her business activities and increase her working capital.  

Gloria has been working with MFP over the course of several loan cycles and, during this time, she has improved her business considerably.  She feels satisfied because she has always shown herself to be responsible in making her loan repayments.  On this occasion, she will buy alfalfa wholesale.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 44 years old and is married to Jacinta. They have two children.  Charles has been running his retail shop for the last four years, making a monthly profit of KES.10,000. He has been loaned KES.20,000, with which he plans to purchase stock like flour, sugar, tea leaves, soaps, etc.

With the anticipated profit he plans to invest in the business, and in the near future he hopes to own his own wholesale operation.

loans.use: to purchase stock like flour, sugar, tea leaves, soaps, etc.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años es separada, vive en Machachi con sus  3 hijos, María se describe como una persona luchadora, humilde de caracter fuerte pero lo que eela se propone lo cumple.


Trabaja por 4 años sola  en la venta de salchipapas (comida rápida). Trabaja con FODEMI cerca de tres años, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de una carpa para cubrir su negocio, los créditos le han ayudado bastante ya que puede sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Su sueño es incrementar su productividad y mejorar su negocio para poder vivir a plenitud con su familia que son sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and separated; she lives in Machachi with her three children.  Maria describes herself as a striving person, who is humble and a strong character, but achieves what she sets out to do.

She has been working on her own for four years selling salchipapas (fast food - fried potatoes with sliced hot dog).  She has been working with FODEMI for nearly three years.  This loan that she is requesting is to purchase a tent covering to cover her business.  The loans have helped a lot as she can move her children ahead in life.

Her dream is to increase her productivity and improve her business, so as to live her life to the fullest with her family, who are her children.

loans.use: to buy a tent covering to cover her business.

loans.name: Ashrafkhon

texts.ru:
Ашрафхон добросовестный и честный человек. Он мясник, а также занимается купля продажей скота.  Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Более 12 лет Ашрафхон занимается купля продажей скота и мясо. Соличон старается, содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и устроит своих детей в хороших школах и университетах. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыли. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки скота. Соличон заранее благодарен всем кредиторам за поддержку и поощрение.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Ashrafkhon is a conscientious and honest person.  He is a butcher and is also involved in buying and selling livestock.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  Ashrafkhon has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 12 years.  He tries to provide good living conditions for his family and wants to place his children into good schools and universities.  He wants to expand his business and receive a desired profit.  Ashrafkhon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2000 for the purchase of livestock.  He is grateful to all creditors in advance for the support and help.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Las Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es: El Sr.  Williams   es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, Williams  tiene 30 años D. edad  actualmente es integrante en L. alcancía comunal “Las Rosas Blancas” grupo  conformado por  7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Williams  trabaja junto a su esposa  desD. hace 5 años en una bodega que está situada en el mercado D. su distrito,  a su vez trabaja hasta el medio día  en una moto taxi  que es D. su propiedad y por las tardes alquiL. su mota taxi, y aprovechando el tiempo libre en L. tarD. trabaja  D. cobrador  hasta L. noche, estos negocios  surgen  a raíz del nacimiento D. su hijo,  es así que Williams trabajo muy duro para obtener lo que hoy en día tiene Williams nos cuenta que su motivacion son su hijo y sus esposa, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, ha comprado cosas para su hogar  y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad D. vida,  con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos (Arroz, Fideos) para seguir implementando su bodega .Sabemos que Williams  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Señor Williams, aged 30, lives in a common-law marriage and is the father of a son. He is now a member of the communal bank "Las Rosas Blancas" (the white roses), a group of seven members who engage in various traD. activities.

Williams has been working for five years with his wife in a grocery store which is located at the market in his district. He also works until noon on a motortaxi that he owns. In the afternoon he rents it out, and thus has enough free time to work as a collector until nightfall. He began these activities when their son was born. Williams works very hard to get what he has today. He says that he is motivated by his son and his wife. Thanks to his effort and dedication he has a better income and can buy appliances for their home. His family has now a better quality of life. In order to ensure the continued growth of his grocery store, he applied for a new loan to buy some inventory (rice and noodles). Williams will meet his goals through hard work and effort, and the loans granted by the microfinance institution Edaprospo will help him.

loans.use: to buy inventory (rice and noodles) for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mark Jhun

texts.en:
Mark Jhun is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 5 children. 

Mark Jhun provides motorela, or habal-habal, services. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools & to pay for gasoline and maintenance for his vehicle.

Mark Jhun has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mark Jhun hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Mungunsar

texts.en: Mungunsar is 56 years old and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and grandson in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She operates a jewelry trading business in a local market. She started her business when she arrived from Korea in 2010. She has a lack of business experience. For now, her daily profit is 20,000-30,000 MNT. Even though she is fairly new to the business she already has some regular customers and is known for her service. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I want to increase my current asset in order to improve my profit". She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more leather and silver and to increase her assets.

loans.use: To purchase more leather and silver

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María de 63 años, una mujer muy carismática, que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de negocio.
Su negocio es una tienda que está ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda, escogió esta actividad porque podía cuidar de su casa y como no tiene mucha preparación educativa le parecía el negocio ideal.
Su actividad la realiza con mucha responsabilidad, su horario es de lunes a domingo desde las 7:00am hasta las 20:00pm.
Es soltera y tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad.
Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como: arroz, aceites, azúcar, etc.
Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y que su negocio incremente.
texts.en:
Maria is 63 years old and she is a very charismatic woman who aspires with the growth of her business. Her business is a store which is located in the front section of her house. She chose this activity because she was able to continue to take care of the home and it did not have much of an educational requirement. To her it looked like an ideal business.

She carries out her activity with a great sense of responsibility. Her schedule is from Monday to Sunday from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.

She is single and she has 3 children, all of whom are grown.

She requests a loan to purchase merchandise, such as: rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc. 

Her dream is to finish building her house and to continually increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Okpe (Xwlacodji) Group

texts.fr: OKPE(XWLACODJI) est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Clémentine Donsi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans.   Clémentine Donsi est mariée à un électricien du nom de Marcelin. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Clémentine Donsi vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Clémentine Donsi a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Clémentine Donsi vend depuis une dizaine d’années, des mèches  par le système de distribution. Parallèlement à cette activité, Clémentine Donsi vend des défrisants pour cheveux et des sous vêtements. Clémentine Donsi s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue élargir son activité, Clémentine Donsi sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe OKPE(XWLACODJI). Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Okpe (Xwlacodji) is a group of three persons, whose members reside in the same area in Benin. The representative of the group, Clementine Donsi (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 38 years old.

Clementine Donsi is married to an electrician named Marcelin. The couple has four children all in school and living under their care. She lives together with her ​​husband and children, and the couple shares responsibility for handling the various household expenses.

Clementine Donsi interrupted her education at high school level. To deal with her various responsibilities, she has been selling hair extensions through the distribution system over the past ten years. In parallel to this activity, she also sells hair straighteners and lingerie. She gets her supplies in Benin and from Togo.

In her quest to satisfy customers and wanting to expand her business, Clementine Donsi, together with other Okpe (Xwlacodji) group members, is requesting a third credit loan from ALIDé. This credit will serve to better meet the demands of their customers and make more profit.

loans.use: Buy hair extensions

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es: María, de 48 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante, vende jugos y reposterías (todo tipo de pan dulce y postres), madre de 5 hijos. Ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años vendía en una esquina del mercado después adquirió un pequeño kiosko en el mercado central de la ciudad de León donde la afluencia de clientes es constante, su esposo tiene un puesto de helados donde sus hijos después de clases lo ayudan atenderlo. Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para realizar malteadas de leches, batidos de frutas, reposterías, emparedados, sándwich, hamburguesas que son parte de los productos que ella vende en su kiosko. Con esta inversión podar adquirir más productos para vender u mejorar sus ventas durante esta época navideña donde hay bastantes visitas turísticas en la ciudad. Una de sus expectativas es comprar mesas y un exhibidor para colocar su repostería.
texts.en:
Maria, 48, lives in the city of Leon and is a merchant. She sells juices and desserts (all kinds of pastries and desserts). She is a mother of 5 children.

She started her business 20 years ago selling in a corner of the market. Later, she got a small stall in Leon's central market where the customers have more money. Her husband has an ice cream stall where their kids work after school. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for making milkshakes, fruit smoothies, desserts, sandwiches and hamburgers, some of the items that she sells at her kiosk. With this loan she will be able to have more products to offer and improve her sales during the Christmas season when there are a lot of tourists in the city. One of her objectives is to buy tables and a display case for her desserts.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make milkshakes, fruit smoothies, desserts, sandwiches and hamburgers to sell at her kiosk.

loans.name: Crispy

texts.en:
Crispy is a 31-year-old, married woman with three children.

Crispy earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years, and she earns additional income from food vending. Crispy is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Crispy is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is 55 years old, married, and has nine children.

Makerita owns and operates a business venture, providing dressmaking services to local community members.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Makerita needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Makerita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Because they lack collateral, most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks.  This is Makerita's first loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.
  
About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 49 years old and married. She has four children. Leonora has only completed an elementary school education. She cooks and sells daily meals and snacks to the people in her village. This is the source of her income. She enjoys cooking food and her specialty is to cook pansit  (noodles topped with egg, meat and vegetables). She has been doing this for 10 years. 

Leonora would like to further develop her business. She has insufficient funds so she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy eggs, pork, cabbage and noodles to cook and sell.

Someday, Leonora would like to cook different types of meals so that she may keep satisfying her customer's demand for delicious food. This way, she could earn more profit and make her family more successful.

loans.use: to buy eggs, pork, cabbage and noodles to cook and sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Rice farming is the business on which Alfredo and his family rely upon for their income during the harvest seasons of April and November. He usually makes a net profit of P10,000 from his half-hectare rice field. 

Alfredo is married and has one child. He is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy pesticides and fertilizers used in farming. He would like to improve his crop production to alleviate his family from their poor financial condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers used in farming

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Davis is 38 years old, married and a father of three children.  He has been in the carpentry business for the last ten years, with a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer and he is now applying for his third loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd, which he will use to buy tools such as a jigsaw, G-clamps, tenon saws and wood drills for his business.  He will save the anticipated profit and use it to help pay the school fees for his children. 

In the future, Davies hopes to grow his business into a large, fully automated workshop and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase working tools for his workshop.

loans.name: Volonte De Dieu Group

texts.fr: VOLONTE DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies qui se connaissent depuis leur enfance. La représentante du groupe, Isabelle (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 42 ans. Isabelle est mariée à un certain Athanase. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Isabelle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Isabelle a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Isabelle vend depuis dix ans, divers produits (conserves, savons, riz) et des tissus. Isabelle s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Isabelle sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe VOLONTE DE DIEU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: "Volonté de Dieu" is a group comprising three people, all of whom are friends who have known each other since childhood. The group leader, Isabelle (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 42 years old. Isabelle is married to a man named Athanase. The couple have five children, all of whom are in their care and attend school. Isabelle lives together with her husband and children. The couple provide for the household together. Isabelle ended her studies in primary school. To meet her various expenses, Isabelle has sold various items (canned goods, soap, rice) and fabric for ten years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clientele and expanding her business, Isabelle is seeking a fourth loan with ALIDÉ, along with the other members of the Volonté de Dieu group. This loan will allow them to better respond to the demands of their customers and to earn higher profits. The three previous loans were all repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy various goods (canned items, soap, rice) and fabric.

loans.name: Devaki

texts.en: Devaki is 40 years-old .  She is Married and has 2 children aged 17 and 15.  In 1996, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys seeds and fertilizers for her business.  In the future, Devaki plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 0  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to bys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mao Sot's Group

texts.en:
Mao is a 33-year-old mother who lives in Siem Reap province and has six children. She struggles for a living via rice cropping and raises pigs to earn extra income.

This is the sixth cycle for Mao with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans and now her living condition is getting better than it was before.

In her group of three, she is a leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig feeds. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Danaya Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les  05 membres du groupe  DANAYA IV  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MANA, un des villages de OUELESSEBOUGOU 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième  prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  l’arachide, le riz et le mil avec   SABOU, 1ère personne  assise de la  gauche vers la   droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du marche, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Esssohanam

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Essodolom est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans habitant à Agoè. Essodolom est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui travaille énormément pour gagner ses revenus. Essodolom s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Essodolom demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois, ce qui lui permettra de mieux revendre et d’avoir plus de recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et aider son mari à s’occuper de ses enfants en leur payant les frais scolaire dès le début de ce premier trimestre.

loans.use: Acheter 17 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence lives in Vituka area of Dar es Salaam.He is married with four children.He owns a shop selling cold drinks near his residence.He opened this shop three years ago after being dropped from employment.He was employed with Dar es Salaam Port Authority.Life was tough for him after being dropped.He get an advice from a friend to open a cold drinks shop.Since then he progress well with an exception of poor capital base.He want to improve his business by adding enough stock of Cold drinks.Drinks produced by Coca-cola Company have risen in price recently.Even more capital is needed to have sufficient stock of these drinks.He is in need of USD 550 to meet his expectation.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Valeddin

texts.en:
This 61-year-old man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.
He is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed $600 Valeddin bought a meaty bull-calf. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 3 meaty bull-calves.

loans.use: To buy 3 meaty bull-calves

loans.name: Misitini

texts.en: Misitini is a 48 years old.  She is widow and has to raise her six children on her own.  She joined the SPBD program in order to help her start her business.  She sells vegetables, plants and cooked foods in front of her house every weekday.  Some of her homemade specialties are pork cakes and pancakes.  On a good day she can earn about USD 20 after all expenses.  She is requesting another loan that will help her both expand her business and help her purchase bulk (and therefore cheaper) supplies as well as to make some repairs to her home.

loans.use: :  cement, timber, flour, sugar, oil, mutton

loans.name: Missiratou

texts.en: B. Missiratou is a 29 year old lady. She specializes in ladies'  fashion and beautiful skin products. She is married but living alone with her child because her husband has left home. Her ambition is to travel and purchase fashion beauty products in order to reach a new target market. Her business is growing very well and she wants to expand it in the coming months. B. Missiratou joined AE&I micro credit program in January 2005 and has been performing very well since that time. She is ambitious and self-confident. She has sent her daughter to school and wants to be able to pay the school fees by herself.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Carlos Guilherme

texts.pt:
Carlos Guilherme is a mechanic and lives in Xai Xai. He joined the program in 2005, since then his business has been doing well and he was able to start saving. He wants to improve the conditions of his house. He has 7 children of whom 4 are in school.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Carlos Guilherme vive em Xai-Xai e e mecanico. Ele entrou para o programa em 2005. Porque o negocio lhe corria bem ele conseguiu juntarrendimentos e agora quer construir uma casa melhorada. Ele tem 7 filhos dos quais 4 estao a estudar.

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Jacqueline Concepció

texts.es:
Jacqueline is an entrepreneurial woman who works everyday to find a better future for her two children, despite the arduous chores she performs in her small shop. She is always looking to make her work better and endure client’s satisfaction. Her clients are her neighbors. She remembers the previous years, when she partnered with her neighbor so they could both invest and work in their small shop, with time, the shop grew, so now they each have their own independent shop. Now, she sees her future with great expectations. She wants to grow her business and through her profits, build her house and renovate it so her children will be able to enjoy everyday. This is why Jacqueline requests a loan of $1000 dollars, so she can make her dream come true. In this time she will invest her money in buying more merchandise for her small shop. Let’s give our support for Jacqueline to continue forward in her noble dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer
